Return to Job Search Criteria Printable Format Job Description - Financial Svcs Rep 1-3 - Chapel Hill Harris Teeter (213504) Job Description Financial Svcs Rep 1-3 - Chapel Hill Harris Teeter - 213504 Description Provide a superior client service experience while assisting in and supporting all aspects of service and sales-related activities in the branch. Develop new and strengthen/expand existing personal and business client relationships through daily client relationship management, providing financial solutions that meet clients' needs and goals, penetrating all product and service lines. Provide financial solutions that meet clients' needs and objectives using sales activities to include conducting consultative conversations, online charts, teleconsulting and making referrals when appropriate. Support the efforts and goals of the branch team through personal sales of a wide variety of SunTrust Bank's products and services and use of referrals, as appropriate, across Lines of Business. Provide service excellence; perform routine client maintenance requests, problem resolution and basic sales functions. Commit to advancing individual knowledge of sales techniques and product knowledge to better serve consumer and business clients. Perform Teller functions as required. Ensure compliance with internal controls, operational procedures and risk management policies. Pursue on-going education of SunTrust products, services, and other lines of business. Depending on branch type/size and staffing may provide Teller support. Additionally, Financial Services Representatives (FSR) in In-Store locations are responsible for service and sales to include in-store prospecting, and assisting clients on platform and teller transactions Responsible for ensuring that all business transactions and practices in the individual's span of control comply with all regulations and the SunTrust Code of Conduct. Qualifications Financial Services Representative 1 Basic Qualifications: High school diploma or equivalent. One year Teller experience at SunTrust Bank or at least one year advanced teller position at another comparable financial institution, or minimum six months service and sales experience. Preferred Qualifications: College level courses. One year experience in a client service and/or financial sales experience role. Demonstrates ability to interact confidently with clients. Ability to identify, evaluate and resolve client financial needs. Cash handling or payment transactions experience. Financial Services Representative 2 Basic Qualifications: High school diploma or equivalent. One year retail sales experience or one year financial service and sales experience. Preferred Qualifications: College level courses. Two years experience in a client service and/or financial sales experience role and/or combined experience as a Teller and/or FSR at SunTrust Bank or comparable role at another financial institution and/or completion of Core and Intermediate STU Curriculum Training as well as corresponding FSR course work. Strong probing and listening skills to uncover client needs. Ability to respond in a professional manner with a high level of service quality. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Understanding of consumer and business lending instruments as well as deposit products. Demonstrated ability to meet or exceed sales goals. Cash handling or payment transactions experience. Financial Services Representative 3 Basic Qualifications: High school diploma or equivalent. Two years retail sales experience in a consumer or small business environment or two years financial service and sales experience with demonstrated consistency in meeting sales goals. Knowledge of branch operations, policies and procedures. Preferred Qualifications: College level courses with an emphasis on business, finance or accounting. Three years experience in a client service and/or financial sales experience role and/or combined experience as a Teller and/or FSR at SunTrust Bank or comparable role at another financial institution and/or completion of Core, Intermediate and Advanced STU Curriculum Training as well as corresponding FSR course work. Strong probing and listening skills to uncover client needs. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Cash handling or payment transactions experience. Job : Retail Banking Primary Location : North Carolina-NC-Chapel Hill-NC-Chapel Hill-Chapel Hill N. jobText: Catering Sales Manager  The Aquarium of the Pacific, Long Beach CA  US - CA - Long Beach  Email this job to a friend Contact  Company Name: SMG  Title: Human Resouces Manager  Email: Fax: 562-499-7603  Mailing Address: 300 E. Ocean Blvd. Long Beach, CA, US 90802  Contact Type: Employer  Job Details Job Description: We have an immediate opening for a dynamic Catering Sales Manager at our operations at the Aquarium of the Pacific, Long Beach, CA.  POSITION SUMMARY:  Responsible for generating, planning, coordinating, detailing and servicing special events at the Aquarium of the Pacific. These events include private and corporate functions, meetings, parties, and other social events.  POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:  * Generate revenue and provide excellent personal service to our internal and external guests.  * Coordinate groups and events throughout the Aquarium, ensuring availably, times, catering needs, audiovisual and other special needs of the guests.  * Develop and maintain communication line with AOP Guest Services and SMG operations. Keeps all event details current and staff informed.  * Give site inspections as needed.  * Seek, negotiate, and book new repeat business by doing outside sales calls, telemarketing, mailings, networking, phone coverage, attending trade shows, and travel.  * Ability to negotiate, influence, and sell prospective clients.  * Create requests for cash concession outlets when needed.  * Generate catering contracts and establish payment arrangements in compliance with accounting department guidelines. Finalize and distribute all sales orders to operations staff three (2) weeks prior to event. Distribute final sales order and delivery receipts and other applicable back up to accounting within three (3) days following the event.  * Provide detailed event analysis to support, maintain and/or improve company goals and guest satisfaction.  * Continuously interact with clients through duration of dessert. Obtain client signature on delivery receipts, sales orders, and contracts.  * Ensure a successful client event by routine and thorough checking of food standards, room set up and on-time service with the result of client satisfaction. Resolve any client concerns.  * Update and maintain file information for repeat events with total Food & Beverage revenues and client relations.  * Update all details of the events to operations staff.  * Practice continuous efforts toward menu upgrades and increased services.  * Other projects as assigned by Director of Catering Sales.  SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:  This position has no staff supervisory responsibilities. Event Supervision is required.  WORK CONTACTS:  Daily contact with: All guests, staff, and management of AoP, outside sales contacts, General District Manager, and others as needed.  PHYSICAL EFFORT:  The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand and walk. The employee must be able to lift and/or move up to 10 pounds.  WORKING CONDITIONS:  Working inside and out of the Aquarium of the Pacific as needed.  Job Requirements: EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:  * Associate's degree (A.A.) or equivalent from two-year college or technical school; or two year related experience and/or training; equivalent combination of education and experience.  * A general understanding of the hospitality and Food and Beverage industry.  * Excellent organizational, multi-tasking, and planning skills  * Strong hospitality orientation  * Maintains good hygiene and neat professional appearance.  * Excellent written, verbal communication and interpersonal skills  * Knowledge of Spreadsheet and Word Processing software, and the ability to learn new programs as needed.  * Ability to work with limited supervision and will require the ability to interact with all levels of staff including management.  * Requires ability to work flexible hours, including nights, weekends and holidays, in addition to normal business hours.  * Excellent written and verbal communication skills are necessary to sell, plan, and negotiate.  * Needs to be an independent self-starter that thrives in a fast-paced, constantly changing environment.  * An interest in environmental causes and marine life a plus.  SMG offers a comprehensive benefits package including 401K.  Be part of a Team determined to provide the utmost in food quality and service. Come motivated to engage in exceeding all expectations for events.  You may visit our websites at: www.smgworld.com, www.smgcatering.com and www.savorsmg.com  TO APPLY:  Resumes must include salary requirements for consideration.  SMG is an Equal Opportunity Employer  Management Position? Yes  Entry-Level Position? No  Work Permit Needed? Applicants who do not already have legal permission to work in the United States will not be considered.  Job Available: Immediately  Industry Categories : Catering/Convention  Position Categories : Catering/Events, Sales  Compensation Salary Range: Bonus Plan? No  Accommodation? No  Other: Salary, Commission, Health, Vacation, Personal and Sick Days  Apply Online

Company Schneider Electric Job Title General Manager HMI Business  Location USA - IL - Des Plaines Alternate Location(s) USA - MI - Ann Arbor IAT Req. # 25687 Job Function Executive Management Job Responsibilities This position is responsible for overall sales, marketing and profit & loss of Schneider Electric brands of HMI in the United States including Proface and Magelis. Sets yearly sales, marketing and operations plans to achieve and or exceed sales volume and profit goals. Develops and executes marketing plans inclusive of new product launches, obsolescence and promotional activities. Channels to market include distribution and direct sales, OEM and End User accounts along with supporting the Schneider Electric sales force. Monitors sales and net income results, takes corrective action to ensure business plan goals are met. This position reports to the Vice President, Best in Class Products.  Primary Responsibilities: *Sets goals and objectives, develops sales forecasts and business plans, establishes effective strategies, and executes to achieve year over year sales and profit goals. *Coordinates strategic product plans for targeted market segments with Industry OEM & End User Market Segment Managers.  *Applies market, application and account skills necessary for providing effective marketing support for existing Proface target audiences such as distributors, direct OEM's, End Users and the Schneider Electric direct sales force and distribution channel including the Schneider Industry, Power, Buildings, IT and Energy Businesses. *Analyzes market share and trends along with preparing sales forecasts for use in planning manufacturing capacity and controlling inventories. *Positions and differentiates product in the marketplace through competitive pricing analysis and coordinates this activity with the Schneider Pricing and Proposal Quotation teams. *Develops and maintains successful relationships with Proface and Schneider Distributors, OEM & End User Accounts. *Ensures that customer service levels are effectively maintained and makes recommendations for improvement as necessary. *Performs leadership and management functions necessary to direct the activities of the group including strategic planning, annual business planning, departmental budget preparation, salary administration, annual performance objectives setting and appraisals and career development. *Maintain awareness of the competitive trends and proactively respond against competitors such as Advantek, Rockwell, Eaton, Siemens, Idec, Red Lion and Mitsubishi. Proactively communicates feedback to the global business units. *Recommends changes, improvements or deletions in assigned product, or products.  Requirements: *A Bachelor of Science degree in Mechanical or Electrical Engineering is required. MBA is preferred. *At least 15 years of experience successfully managing 8 or more direct reports. *Industrial Automation experience in sales and or marketing with a proven background in successfully launching new products, developing effective sales & marketing plans.  *Travel requirements will be up to 40% domestically and includes trips to parent operations in Japan and France. *Fluent experience and knowledge of MS Office including Word, PowerPoint, Excel and Project. *Self starter and effective communicator who is passionate about his/her position and committed to fostering a " team" approach and successful results. We are an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.  |  |  Job Cart Job Cart Directions Interested in more than one position? Great! Instead of submitting multiple resumes, when you find a position that interests you, all you need to do is click on ADD JOB TO CART. At the bottom of the screen, you will see the positions you have added to your cart. When you are done searching, click on CHECKOUT & SUBMIT RESUME. If you have changed your mind and want to remove a position, you will be able to on the Resume Submittal Form, or click on CLEAR CART to start over. You are limited to selecting up to 5 jobs per location.

Return to Job Search page Printable Format Job Description - Staff Registered Nurse ( Hemodialysis RN ) - Wyncote , PA (092760) Job Description Staff Registered Nurse ( Hemodialysis RN ) - Wyncote , PA Description We love our patients. We think you will, too. What you do is vitally important at DaVita-and in the lives of our patients and their families. As part of our professional team of clinicians, you will ensure the compassionate, professional delivery of all dialysis-related nursing services in an outpatient setting. Make the most of your nursing skills to provide the highest level of care to our patients and ensure their safety, comfort, and well being. If you love patient-centered health care with real relationships inside a company that encourages fun on and off the clock, then DaVita is the place for you. We offer career options to fit your lifestyle. Here is what you can expect when you join our Village as a Staff Registered Nurse. Fun, relationships-based culture-patient- and teammate-driven FORTUNE 500 stability-with the nation's largest  independent provider of dialysis services Training Magazine Top 125 award-winning education Multiple career paths across a variety of cutting-edge modalities Rewards for your stellar performance Clinical outcomes consistently ranked above the national average-treating more than one-third of the dialysis population (that's approximately 100,000 patients!) Exceptional benefits-including the healthcare industry's most generous profit sharing program Dedication above all to caring for patients suffering from chronic kidney failure-at over 800 hospital units and approximately 1,500 outpatient dialysis clinics nationwide  Qualifications This role requires current RN license in the state of practice, CPR certification, and successful completion of basic EKG interpretation. Two years experience in providing nursing care to acutely ill patients are required; medical/surgical experience is preferred; and CNN is desirable. Why wait? Explore a career with DaVita today. Go to to learn more or apply. Or send your resume to  Chris Nash, Recruiter at  To learn more about DaVita and the world of dialysis, . Follow DaVita on  and  DaVita is proud to be an EEO/AA employer M/F/D/V. We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing and background verification checks. jobText: Report It Job DescriptionÂ SALARY RANGE: $45,000 to $65,000 + Annual Compensation.  LOCATION: Oakland, CA BENEFITS: Excellent single / family health and dental PPO, 80% employer contribution, 401K & more.  NACA OVERVIEW: The Neighborhood Assistance Corporation of America (âNACAâ) (naca.com) is a non-profit community advocacy and housing services organization. Started in 1988, NACA has a tremendous track record of successful advocacy against predatory and discriminatory lenders. Presently, NACA is the largest housing services organization in the country and is rapidly expanding by growing its existing 30+ offices, opening many new offices nationwide, and expanding the services it offers its membership. NACAâs confrontational community organizing and unprecedented mortgage program have set the national standard for assisting low and moderate income people achieve the dream of home ownership.  Today, NACA has commitments from banks and lenders totaling over $10 Billion for its Best in Americaâmortgage program, which allows NACA Members to purchase or refinance homes with no down payment, no closing costs, no fees, no requirement for perfect credit, and at a below-market interest rate. Everyone gets the same incredible terms, including the below-market interest rate, regardless of their credit score or other factors. NACA also provides free comprehensive housing services. NACA counsels Members into the extraordinary NACA mortgage using character based lending criteria that takes each Memberâs circumstances into account to determine whether they are ready for homeownership and what they can afford. This is in contrast to risk based pricing where people are often put into loans they cannot afford with brokers and other making tremendous fees.  NACA also provides home renovation assistance and post-purchase services. NACAâs Home and Neighborhood Development (âHANDâ) Department addresses repair issues and where appropriate provides rehab assistance throughout the renovation process. NACAâs Home Save Department provides comprehensive counseling for Members who are delinquent on their home, including establishing payment agreements and providing financial assistance to help Members avoid foreclosure. The NACA program is structured through a state-of-the-art mortgage web-based counseling, processing and underwriting software called NACA Lynxâ. This is a paperless system that allows for character lending, and loan processing and underwriting to be done on a very large scale. Virtually 100% of NACA Qualified Members are approved and funded.  NACA has revolutionized mortgage lending with its mortgage services and advocacy. NACAâs organizing department continues the aggressive advocacy against predatory lenders and in fighting for economic justice. NACA is a high-profile organization, having its program and advocacy featured in the national media, including the Wall Street Journal, Prime Time Live, Boston Globe, Washington Post, major news outlets, and local networks nationwide.  NACA STAFF PROFILE: NACA staff has a passion for and commitment to community advocacy and the delivery of excellent services to working people. While advocacy campaigns are an important part of everyoneâs work at NACA, staff spend the majority of their time providing comprehensive housing services to low and moderate people and administering NACAâs homeownership program. NACA offers tremendous opportunities for job growth and career development. NACA has a strong track record of promoting from within and rewarding hard work. NACA seeks staff with a positive and open attitude, a willingness to work hard, and the determination to achieve NACAâs mission. NACA strongly encourages minorities and bilingual people to apply.  POSITION SUMMARY: The Mortgage Consultant is responsible for providing comprehensive housing counseling services to NACA Members. The Mortgage Consultant works with Members to assist them through the home buying process to overcome the roadblocks that prevent them from purchasing a home. The Mortgage Consultant provides individual counseling from the initial intake to the mortgage closing, including counseling regarding: credit, budget, mortgage qualification, property search and inspection, mortgage processing, and closing. The primary responsibility is to have the Member become NACA Qualified (i.e. mortgage ready). Mortgage Consultants make decisions appropriate to the particular Memberâs circumstances, follow-up with problem resolution, and take action to facilitate successful completion of the task(s). The Mortgage Consultant is in fact underwriting the mortgage based on NACAâs character lending criteria and must make individualized judgmentâs about a Memberâs particular circumstances. The services performed by the Mortgage Consultant are a key component of NACAâs business, and of crucial importance to the organization and must administer the program to ensure the success of NACA and the continuous commitment of the funding sources. In the discharge of these duties, the Mortgage Consultant must accomplish the following on a day-to-day basis:  Counsel and address Memberâs credit and budget issues.  Qualify Members for home ownership based on their unique financial and personal circumstances and needs.  Determine the maximum purchase price they can afford based on their unique financial and personal circumstances and needs.  Assist Members during the housing search and home purchase.  Originate the mortgage.  Follow-up with Member on a regular basis.  Coordinate with NACAâs Underwriting Department.  Work with the NACAâs HAND Department on property repair and contractor issues.  Obtain documents needed for qualifications, underwriting, and closings.  Maintain Member information in the computer system and files.  Participate in presenting homebuyer and home ownership workshops.  Coordinate rehab and home improvement programs.  Assist in outreach focused on low/moderate income communities, churches and job sites.  Assist in advocacy campaigns.  Other duties as assigned.  COMPENSATION: NACA is the only job in the mortgage industry that allows you to provide low and moderate income borrowers with an incredible mortgage and make considerable income without engaging in abusive sub-prime market lending practices. The compensation at NACA is based on the NACA Results Compensation Program- NRCP.âThe commission-based NRCP begins after the first three months of employment, during which the compensation is straight salary in order to allow for training of the Mortgage Consultant and his/her development of a pipeline. The structure of the NRCP Program is results-based (i.e. earnings are relative to the number of loans closed), with a regularly paid draw that provides Mortgage Consultants with a minimum cash flow. The NRCP is very different from other commission-based plans used by for-profit mortgage brokers and lenders because:  1. NACA offers one single product to its Members, which is the Best Mortgage in America, with no down payment, no closing costs, no fees, and a below-market interest rate. NACA provides the lowest fixed interest rate for all mortgage applicants whether a prime or sub-prime borrower;  2. Compensation is paid at a fixed amount, regardless of the loan amount or any other terms. Thus, NACA Mortgage Consultants do not have to pit their own interests against those of the borrower since they do not have to charge front-end and back-end points (i.e. yield spreads) to earn or increase their commission;  3. The NRCP provides an advance of pay during periods when the Mortgage Consultant does not close loans, which is repaid by the Mortgage Consultant from future closings;  4. NACA Mortgage Consultants are not required to independently generate leads on a regular basis since NACA develops leads through workshops and other means, and the interest in the NACA Mortgage and active participation already exists and is growing. NACA has huge numbers of people accessing its program. These participants are extremely good leads that could not be generated through traditional sources;  5. Mortgage Consultants counsel borrowers in the office and focus on getting them NACA Qualified;  6. NACA Qualification is a character-based lendingâand not a risk-based pricing. NACA approves Members based on their overall circumstances and not on rigid criteria;  7. NACA Mortgage Consultants have at their disposal a state-of-the-art computer hardware and software system (âNACA Lynxâ), which makes for a fast, efficient and paperless mortgage qualification, processing and underwriting process;  8. A NACA Mortgage Consultant is expected to close five to ten per month and earn $45,000 to $65,000+.  This job description is solely for descriptive purposes and the responsibilities may change. This job description does not constitute a contract for employment. Job RequirementsÂ JOB REQUIREMENTS: A. EDUCATION:  Bachelorâs degree preferred  Mortgage and/or real estate courses are helpful  B. EXPERIENCE:  Mortgage brokerage, origination, processing and/or counseling  C. LICENSING REQUIREMENTS:  Applicants must be licensed or meet the state, federal and/or company licensure requirements.Â NACA will interview applicants who are not licensed and could make a job offer contingent on the applicant successfully completing the licensing process.  D. SKILLS:  Strong customer services skills  Detail oriented and well-organized  Problem-solving abilities  Must be able to work under pressure  Energy and enthusiasm for the mission of community advocacy and organizing  Ability to work independently with only general supervision  Ability to speak languages other than English a plus  E. TYPICAL DEMANDS:  Must be able to meet the demands of the job that consists of approximately 45 to 50 hours a week:  o Typical workday is 8:30 a.m. to 6:30 p.m.  o Two weekends every month for Home Buyer Workshops of five hours  o Other time as needed  Advocacy and actions may be required outside the office Report It CareerBuilder.com's Advice For your , when applying to a job online: Never give your social security number to a prospective employer, provide credit card or bank account information, or perform any sort of monetary transaction. Founded in 1986 and headquartered in Omaha, Nebraska. AMI has been providing turn-key environmental solutions. Working both across the country and across the world, AMI has been the single-source provider or key design-build team member on a range of renovation, demolition and construction projects. Some travel required. 40-60%  Education 4 year degree in Environmental Sciences or Construction Related field preferred.  EPA Asbestos Training Preferred.  Equivalent work experience/training will be considered. When you consider a career at La Petite Academy, know you will be joining a team that is passionate about thoroughly preparing their students for all the challenges that lie ahead. As an Assistant in Management, you will truly experience first hand the growth and development of your students knowledge and skill level. Your integral role in this process is one that sets the basis for their future successes. We understand the importance of a caring, attentive, and qualified educator who will teach and guide in a nurturing environment. Some of the exciting things that you will do as an Assistant in Management include, but are not limited to: Make a difference every day! Plan and implement the daily program. Conduct tours for potential clients Assist with other duties as needed: may include food preparation, van chauffeuring, answering the phone, responding to parent questions, and opening and closing the Academy. â¢ â¢ â¢ â¢ Search Registered Client Associate-Albany, NY : 1100010582 US-NY-Albany Description The Client Associate (CA) role is a sales support position, typically providing dedicated operational and sales support to multiple Financial Advisors (FA's). Incumbents may also on a regular basis support office initiatives, in addition to the businesses of particular FA's. For established clients, the CA will often serve as the most frequent point of contact with Merrill Lynch. Specific responsibilities will include but not be limited to: Frequent client contact, typically by telephone, but also in-person and by email, Resolving client inquiries and complaints and determining which issues require immediate elevation to the Financial Advisor (FA) or a member of the branch management team, Account administration & maintenance, Prospect for new business in addition to prospecting existing clients for new product and service offerings, Determine which clients are most appropriate to contact for specific initiatives & service offerings, Place certain unsolicited orders for designated clients, under FA supervision, and Serve as the main point of contact for established clients. Qualifications Undergraduate degree preferred, Minimum of 1+ years professional or relevant internship experience required, Series 7 & 63/65 or 66 registration preferred; if hired without licenses, candidate will need to acquire, Knowledge of investment and banking products, policies & procedures is required, Strong client service & technical skills (MS Word & Excel), Strong communication, time management and organizational skills are required. Please be advised that under current company policy, Merrill Lynch does not sponsor a visa petition or other work authorization, nor will the company provide relocation assistance, for this position. jobText: Current Job Opportunities Job Title: Practical Nurse-Licensed, 1  Agency:  DOC-LA Correctional Institute for Women  Opening Date: Mon. 08/24/09  Closing Date/Time: Continuous  State Salary Range: Depends on Qualifications  Agency Hiring Range: Min: Max: Job Type: Probational/Promo-All Classified & Agencywide/Temp Location: St. Gabriel, Louisiana  |  MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: Possession of a temporary permit or license to practice practical nursing in Louisiana. Supplemental Information:  As part of a Career Progression Group, vacancies may be filled from this recruitment as a  Practical Nurse Licensed 1, 2, or 3 depending on the level of experience of the selected applicant(s).  The maximum salary for the Practical Nurse Licensed 3 is  $50,274 .00  Please refer to the âJob Specificationsâ tab located at the top of the LA Careers âCurrent Job Opportunitiesâ page of the Civil Service website for specific information on salary ranges, minimum qualifications and job concepts for each level.  To apply for this vacancy, click on the  "Apply" link above and complete an electronic application which can be used for this vacancy as well as future job opportunities. Your application to this vacancy is active for 180 days. After this time frame you must re-apply to be considered for vacancies. This position may be filled by either Probational appointment, Promotional appointment, or by Job Appointment. If f i lled as a Temporary Job Appointment; should a permanent position become available within one year, the employee will be converted to a probationary appointment. License or temporary permit  must  be verified under certificates and licenses section of the application. If a paper application is submitted, the Supplemental Questions which coincide with the job posting must be answered and attached to the application. This is a 24 hour facility. Any degree, certificate, special license, or DD 214 must be verified by official documentation prior to hire. This Agency is a Drug Free Workplace. For further information about this vacancy contact: La Toya Taylor (225) 342-6536  Department of Corrections P.O. Box 94304 Baton Rouge , LA 70804 -9304 Job Concepts:  Function of Work:  To provide basic nursing care to patients/clients in stable conditions and in predictable situations in accordance with the Professional Nurses Practice Act. Level of Work: Entry. Supervision Received: Close from a Registered Nurse or Practical Nurse of a higher level. Supervision Exercised: May exercise functional supervision over paraprofessional nursing personnel. Location of Work: Statewide--health care facilities; correctional facilities. Job Distinctions: Differs from Practical Nurse--Licensed, 2 by the absence of journeyman level assignments and independent performance of duties. Examples of Work:  Implements selective aspects of the nursing care plan, i.e., comfort, hygiene, safety measures, nutrition, etc. under progressively more generalized supervision from a Registered Nurse or Practical Nurse of a higher level. Observes patients for changes in physical and/or mental status or behavior and reports significant changes. Obtains specimens for laboratory testing as assigned. Takes vital signs including temperature, pulse, respiration, and blood pressure. Administers medication and treatments in accordance with policies and procedures. Transcribes physicians' orders and records medication and patient's condition on patient's charts and other records. Receives and gives change of shift reports. Requests stock drugs, medications, and supplies as assigned. Administers CPR in emergency situations. Admits, transfers, and discharges patients. Gathers information about patient's past and current physical and mental status. May administer oral and parenteral medication as prescribed by the physician and documents procedure. Applies dressings, ointments, and other treatments as ordered and documents procedure. Assists physicians with routine examinations and treatments. Bathes, feeds, and makes patients comfortable. jobText: Job Seekers,  »  »  »  » Job Detail  | Share: Network Services Technician/Coordinator Institution: Location: Miami, FL Category: Admin - Computing - Network/System Administration  Posted: 08/30/2011  Application Due: Open Until Filled Type: Full Time The Network Services Technician/Coordinator performs highly skilled work in the operation, repair and preventive maintenance of academic and administrative computers. Determines how to best meet the computing needs of the campus and its community. Duties & Responsibilities:  Supports the operations of academic labs and administrative computing  Supports multi-platform operating systems such as Windows, Mac OS x and Linux  Troubleshoots and resolves computer-related desktop and application issues  Serves as liaison to academic and/or administrative departments in researching and implementing technology solutions that best fits their needs and the needs of the Campus  Installs and maintains computer, printers, applications and other computing peripherals  Performs preventive hardware and software maintenance  Maintains accurate inventory of all hardware and software peripherals  Researches new technology for possible adoption  Trains and supervises other technical personnel  Assists in supervising varied and multiple projects that may be assigned  Performs other duties as assigned  Minimum Requirements:  Associate's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or related area with four (4) years of experience in network administration, computer programming, computer maintenance and troubleshooting; or a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or related area with two (2) years of experience in network administration, computer programming, computer maintenance and troubleshooting, or six (6) years of related experience and A+ certification or MCTS certification  OR equivalent combination of education and experience  All educational degrees must be from a regionally accredited institution  Must have experience in Microsoft Office applications and Windows Server environments  Must have experience in current operating systems such as Windows and Mac OS x or Linux  Operational knowledge of local and wide area networks  Working knowledge of Active Directory, Exchange, VMware, group policies as well as scripting and reporting tools and knowledge of relational database systems  Working knowledge of multi-platform environments such as Windows operating system  Excellent interpersonal and communication skills  Ability to promote and maintain effective working relationships  Ability to work well in a multi-ethnic and multi-cultural environment with students, faculty and staff  Ability to work a flexible schedule that may include evening and weekend assignments This function/position has been designated as essential. This means that when the College is faced with an institutional emergency, employees in such positions may be required to remain at their work location or to report to work to protect, recover and continue operations at the College.  EEO/AA  Application Information Contact: Human Resources Department Miami Dade College TDD: 1-800-955-8771 Online App. Form: More Information on Miami Dade College for Miami Dade College on HigherEdJobs.  Miami-Dade is an equal access/equal opportunity community college and does not discriminate on the basis of handicap. An official online MDC Employment Application is required. Please visit our web site for application and instructions. | | | (NEW SECTION)  | | | | Patent Pending  |

Report It Company Overview Kindred Healthcare, Inc., a top-200 private employer in the United States, is one of the largest long-term healthcare organizations in the nation. We operate with a singular and clear vision: to be the nation's leading provider of skilled nursing, rehabilitation and long-term hospital services. We are committed to the idea of Quality Through People. We realize that to be the best, we must hire the best. Our environment is warm and professional. Working together as a team, and fostering a welcoming, positive attitude is the Kindred way. We support our employees. Through ongoing training, mentoring, continued education and safety initiatives, we help provide our people with the tools they need to perform at their best. Our facilities are state of the art. We invest in cutting-edge equipment and technology so that our employees can do their jobs most effectively. We believe in flexibility. If our employees are going back to school or have obligations at home, we understand and will develop a schedule that works for everyone. We support career advancement and believe in promoting from within. We listen to our employees' ambitions and goals and work with them to help make them happen. The satisfaction and fulfillment our employees gain from the quality of work and dedication to their patients and residents is priceless. Every bit of progress, every smile or "thank you" is its own reward.  Learn More about Kindred Healthcare Job Description At Kindred Healthcare, our mission is to promote healing, provide hope, preserve dignity and produce value for each patient, resident, family member, customer, employee and shareholder we serve. Kindred Healthcare, Inc. (NYSE:KND) is a healthcare services company, based in Louisville, Kentucky, with annual revenues of over $4.2 billion. At December 31, 2009, Kindred through its subsidiaries provided healthcare services in 621 locations in 41 states, including 83 long-term acute care hospitals, 222 skilled nursing centers and a contract rehabilitation services business, Peoplefirst Rehabilitation Services, which served 316 non-affiliated facilities. Kindreds 54,100 employees are committed to providing high quality patient care and outstanding customer service to become the most trusted and respected provider of healthcare services in every community we serve. For more information, go to www.kindredhealthcare.com. An Equal Opportunity Employer. Drug Free Workplace. As the Staff Development Assisant, you will assist the Staff Development Coordinator with all duties associated with training and maintaining the systemsforthe Coordinator. Help to Plan and deliver the kind of training our Nurses need to be knowledgeable, dedicated, resourceful, and willing to go the extra mile in caring for our residents. Responsibilities: Ensure employees receive compliance training and education necessary to perform their job responsibilities; monitor employee performance and take necessary action for compliance issues Maintainan orientation program for new, rehired and contract employees; conduct or coordinate new employee job training and CPR training as directed by the Coordinator Provide orientation and instruction to unlicensed personnel Working with the SDC, ensure competency of non-licensed staff through evaluation of skills and annual competency assessment. Ensure that the educational curriculum meets or exceeds state, federal and accreditation requirements; plan and conduct state and federally required in-service programs Conduct job responsibilities in accordance with the Company's Code of Business Conduct, the Corporate Compliance Agreement, appropriate professional standards and applicable state/federal laws Job Requirements The Staff DevelopmentAssistant must be skilled in developing and conducting training programs, work assessment and have knowledge of learning principles and training techniques. Also important is the ability to communicate effectively with residents, their families and at all levels of the organization. BS degree preferred. One year in a long-term care environment are required. One year of experience as an instructor preferred. Your Career Network:  Physicians / Surgeons (MD/DO) Employers Job Seekers: Register Log In We have Career Networks with jobs and information just for your profession: Job Details Physician Advisor University of Maryland Medical System (employer detail) Glen Burnie, Maryland Date Posted:  2/15/2011 Job #: 1173315 Full Time/Part Time:  Full Time Permanent/Temporary:  Regular Employment/Contract Work: Employment Visa Waiver Available: N/A Apply Save Forward to a Friend Job Description Baltimore Washington Medical Center has a great opportunity for a Utilization Review Physician Advisor. As representative of the Quality Improvement department and Performance Improvement program; provides clinical direction and leadership to the organization, increasing its ability to produce best practice patient outcomes grounded in quality, compliance, ethical, regulatory, and reimbursement parameters. As a peer to physicians and Physician Advisor to Care Management and administration, intervenes when practice patterns or behaviors create disparity between pathway standards, intensity of service, severity of illness, patient and family rights, teamwork or other issues regarding the stewardship of resources for individual patients, diagnostic populations, and the organization as a whole. Accountable for improving the overall quality and completeness of physician and NP/PA clinical documentation of diagnoses and procedures using terminology integral to HIPAA-related transaction sets, primarily in inpatient and observation admissions through negotiation and conflict resolution between treating providers, coders, and clinical documentation specialists. Educates all members of the clinical documentation, coding and patient care team on clinical definitions and documentation requirements pertinent to diagnosis-related group (DRG) methodologies, ICD-9-CM, code assignment, quality and cost efficiency measurements, and compliance to applicable laws. Supports the development of electronic medical record systems in the capture of clinical information and supports the appeals process in disputes with third parties.  Baltimore Washington Medical Center, a member hospital of University of Maryland Medical System (UMMS), is a 311 bed suburban community teaching hospital consisting of 600+ physicians to include resident rotation and faculty affiliation with the University of Maryland. Baltimore Washington Medical Center is situated near the Chesapeake Bay, an enticing place to live, play and work because of the diversified lifestyles that are offered. The Hospital is located between Baltimore, Washington and Annapolis thus providing easy access to cultural, recreational and education opportunities.  Qualifications:  Currently licensed as a Physician in the State of Maryland with appropriate Board Certification. Utilization management/quality improvement experience preferred. Physician will be on staff at Baltimore Washington Medical Center. BWMC is a suburban community hospital consisting of 321 beds with a medical staff of 600+ physicians, affiliated with the University of Maryland. BWMCs services include a freestanding Comprehensive Cancer Center, The University of Maryland Center for Diabetes and Endocrinology at Baltimore Washington Medical Center, Wound Healing Center, The Maryland Vascular Center, Joint & Spine Centers and the Aiello Breast Center. BWMC recently opened a 6 story patient tower, which includes 111 private medical surgical beds, a state of the art 24 bed intensive care unit, and a new obstetrical unit. Baltimore Washington Medical Center is situated near the Chesapeake Bay, an enticing place to live, play and work because of the diversified lifestyles that are offered. The Hospital is located between Baltimore, Washington and Annapolis thus providing easy access to cultural, recreational and education opportunities. UMMS hospitals and health care facilities are equal opportunity employers and proud of an environment of diversity. Contact Information Sharee K. ShareThis City : Boston, MA Date : 06/01 Barton Associates is a healthcare recruiting and staffing firm that specializes in placing physicians in both short and long-term temporary positions. The physician staffing market is currently a $2 billion industry that is forecasted to have substantial growth in future years. At Barton, we work with top healthcare facilities and medical practices nationwide to fulfill all of their temporary physician needs.  Barton Associates, founded in 2001, is capitalizing on the growing physician staffing market with major investment and expansion in our current operations. At this time we are hiring qualified recruiters and account managers for our brand new 21,000 square foot location in Peabody, MA.  Barton Associates is looking for hardworking, self-motivated, competitive, go-getters who want to begin and develop a career in sales and recruiting. We offer an opportunity to earn uncapped incentive compensation as well as a career path into management! Barton provides daily training (paid of course) and we focus on promotion from within our organization. We will help you get to where you want to be, earning the money you want to earn!  Positions Available:  Account Manager (Inside Sales): Obtain, develop and maintain client relationships with healthcare practices and facilities in order to sell Barton's services. Ability to effectively communicate is a must.  Recruiter (Inside): Recruit, develop and maintain relationships with locum tenens physicians in order to place them with our clients on a temporary basis. Ability to effectively communicate is a must.  Major Responsibilities:  *Participate in daily training meetings to develop individual sales and recruiting skills.  *Contact and communicate with healthcare facilities, practices and physicians to generate sales and ensure a high level of client satisfaction.  *Generate and follow up on sales and recruiting leads and referrals.  *Develop and maintain client relationships.  *Develop, manage and maintain a database of healthcare facility and/or physician contacts.  *Responsible for meeting daily, monthly and quarterly individual sales and recruiting production standards and metrics.  *Demonstrate team work and ability to interact and cooperate with all company employees  Qualifications:  *Self- Motivated and Driven to Succeed  *Competitive Drive and Aggressive Attitude  *Willingness to Learn and Develop Individual Skills  *Work Ethic  *Interest in Growing and Developing Career into Management.  *Bachelor of Arts or Bachelor of Science Preferred  Compensation:  Competitive package to include base salary, ability to earn uncapped incentives, healthcare, dental, life and disability insurance benefits as well as a 401(k) plan with a company match. Barton Associates provides fully paid training.  Please email your resume to:  Debbie Zabilski - Office Manager - Administration  10 Dearborn Road. | Peabody, MA | 01960  p: 978.998.7655 | f: 978.998.7688  http://www.bartonassociates.com Contact

jobText: ¢         ¢         ¢         ¥ Job  details Job details Job 1 of 1  Auto req ID 112566BR Position Title Licensed Financial Sales Consultant II - Harmar, PA Line of Business Retail Banking - Branch Banking City PA - Pittsburgh Building Location Code PA089 - Harmar Office Job Type Regular Job Status Full Time Job Description As a PNC Licensed Financial Sales Consultant, you'll join a successful and growing retail banking organization. In your role, you immediately become an important member of a single branch office, consulting with clients to understand their needs, develop financial plans, and deliver viable solutions. This is a licensed position (Series 6 and 63), although you will use your licenses in order to conduct consultative dialogue with customers, rather than to sell investment products. A typical day combines entrepreneurial opportunity with the structure, security and resources of an established name in financial services. Your comfort with performance-driven incentives and a self-managed workload will be an important part of your success, as will your basic communications and presentations skills. Our Financial Advisors and other PNC business partners will depend upon you as the local branch product expert, and upon your experience in working with regulated products. Customers will count upon your responsiveness and problem solving strengths. As a competitor, PNC is committed to market leadership, so you will be backed by state-of-the-industry software, call-desk support, and training resources. The successful candidate will have the following qualifications: At least 1 year of Customer Service experience is preferred  At least 1 year experience in sales required; preferably within the Financial Services Industry.  FINRA Series 6 & 63 (or 7 and 66) licenses required  Life/Health Insurance required  Proven track record in sales production and a strong desire to succeed  Excellent communication skills  Excellent interpersonal skills and professional manner  Computer literate including the ability to work in Windows based applications.  Ability to work evenings and weekends based on branch needs Special Job Requirements EEO Statement PNC is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer - M/F/D/V/SO Shift Daylight Total Hours Per Week 40 HR Job Code C07192 LIC BR FIN SALE CNSLT II Index Monitor

Strat & Planning Solution Mgr Email to Friend Job Category:  IT Location:  United States, WA, Redmond Job ID:  759033 44272 Product:  (Not Product Specific) Division:  IT The Field IT organization is part of MSIT and is responsible for providing the applications and infrastructure that Land Simple IT in the Field. Field IT is a global organization with 340 FTE resources and 400 vendor resources distributed across the world. The annual budget is approximately 130 million dollars.  The Strategy & Planning (S& P) team consists of 17 FTE positions and is accountable for the Planning and Operations of Field IT. The Strategy and Planning group provides the operational support and planning for all of Field IT. The main focus areas include: Operational Excellence(Finance , People , Vendor management) , Planning (organizational , Portfolio) , Portfolio Management, Business Capabilities & Services, Organizational Governance, and Data Visualization The position will play a key role in the following areas:  Field Business Process Analysis  Support the Field IT Architecture and Platform teams prioritize and document key field end to end business processes (Seller, Forecasting, and Partner)  Clarify key field end to end process pain points and business priorities Document existing field business capabilities and processes  Identify process gaps between current subsidiary and recommended global processes Develop proposals to support corporate investment in process and capability gaps Provided recommendations to field business leads on process simplification and standardization Integration of Field process priorities into MSIT planning Work with the Field IT leadership and corporate MSIT planning team to integrate field business process priorities into the MSIT planning process Document the process to integrate Field priorities into the MSIT planning process Make recommendations to improve transparency and effectiveness of investment decision making Identify the role of Field IT and the Field Business in the planning and prioritization process  Identify key business pain points and priorities to be represented Track and report the progress of the field priorities in the investment decision process Field IT Business Governance Drive and influence the Field IT transition to a business process centric organization focused on the end to end user experience  Requirements 10 yearsâ work experience in the high tech sector with 5 years working at an executive level influencing business process documentation, process implementation and organizational change management, organizational change, business proposals and organizational planning. Effective at converting corporate strategy into field execution  Proven ability to simplify and cut through complex environments driving clarity and organizational effectiveness  Strong Interpersonal and networking skills to support key stakeholders across Field IT and it business partners. Proven ability to drive and successfully implement change management initiatives. Excellent internal and external communications skills  Track record of working with leadership and business delivery teams  Bachelorâs degree required.  The role is not location dependent. the  smart solution for New York jobs Client Reporting Associate Location:  New York Posted on:  July 12, 2011 Job Description: Job Title: Client Reporting Associate Profession: Banking -> Investment Banking Private Wealth Management provides investment services to some of the most important of Morgan Stanley Smith Barney's clients. Client reporting is an important function that is considered one of the differentiating services to this important client segment. The Client reporting analyst will have multiple responsibilities in terms of managing the production of reports as well as projects to improve the service. Specific responsibilities include but are not limited to: Execute the generation and mailing of PWM official (statutory) statements and supplemental reports Respond to inquiries raised on any aspect of client reporting such as performance measurement, cost basis, corporate action processing, reconciliation, gain/loss calculations, and tax Assist in client reporting related projects such as creating business requirements, critiquing specification documents and test plans, assigning testers, and providing sign-off on code releases. Work with IT and team to build more efficient work flow for any time consuming manual processes such as, but not limited to, manual data entry and specialized report creation while maintaining data integrity. Provide support for assets held away and aggregation of internal and external client data. Oversee the loading of alternative asset information into the reporting tool. * He/she will be running routine processes on the database, researching performance and accounting questions * Entering data gathered from numerous sources into various online forms Skills Required * Expert knowledge of MS Office applications * Familiar with using a Bloomberg terminal Skills Desired * MS SQL Query Analyzer * Working knowledge of Investment Performance Measurement * Understanding of High Net Worth Client Investment Products * Demonstrate experience in client accounting * Comfortable manipulating multiple software programs and data sets. Job Title Date Posted 06/28/2011 City San Jose Location Other, Northern California Compensation Job Category Sales  Job Type Full Time Job Description Job Description InLineAdz, The National Leader of Local Market Digital Sign Advertising is in search of Sales Managers who are ready - and able - to build a team of TOP PERFORMER Local Area Sales Reps. We have openings in EVERY MARKET throughout the United States (large and small). Our goal is to fill an additional 85 locations this year. If you are serious about building a residual income local business - free from corporate politics, layoffs and downsizing, that is NOT an MLM or franchise business with high Investments and royalty fees....we might have the answer...!!! Top Performing District Sales Managers will earn over $150,000 in year one... which can (and will) grow to over $350,000 in under 5 years. We are looking for powerful sales leaders who understand that this is not a " get rich quick" program... it will take work!!! Those who qualify understand that this is about building something that will last... and creating " True Wealth" . We place large screen TV monitors into high traffic local businesses, and offer local business owners and merchants an opportunity to purchase a branding style advertisement for less than the cost of a cup of coffee a day (about $1.38). All the details are provide on our website. Our Screens are viewed by over 100,000 local consumers each year, making this form of branding the most cost effective form of local / targeted customer communication available to the small and medium sized local business. The District Manager Position offers, extremely flexible / full time hours (9-5), no nights or weekends. complete training provided on and off line and via ongoing live training events and conference calls.  Our District Mangers are responsible for the recruitment, training, guidance and mentoring of 10-15 Local Area Sales Rep and must be willing to roll up their sleeves in the beginning to demonstrate that they understand the business at every level, with personal sales success through prospecting and closing sales with local business owners, which can be achieved within 90 days! Some areas of the country have been filled, and new locations are being taken every day...Timing is essential... many people who have waited to apply have been disappointed that their area has been taken... to determine your candidacy and potential success, a brief " pre-screen" telephone interview will be required. After applying for this position via the SalesJob.com link, you will be directed to a company website for more information and given instructions on how to apply, please follow these instructions. Job Description: Job#: JID1041351  Habitat for Humanity International is a non-profit, ecumenical Christian housing ministry. The purpose and goal of Habitat for Humanity International is to eliminate poverty housing and homelessness from the world, and to make decent shelter a matter of conscience and action. Habitat invites people of all backgrounds, races and religions to build houses in partnership with families in need. Habitat for Humanity has an Operational Headquarters in Americus, Georgia and an Administrative Headquarters in Atlanta, Georgia, and is a global, non-profit ministry where our employees build futures and lives.  Habitat for Humanity International (HFHI) seeks an experienced professional to serve as the Data Performance Measures Manager for our US Support Center. This person will  work with internal and external business units and Data Maintenance Staff to collect, record and report on statistical information across multiple database solutions. Additional duties include: -Analyze business requirements and utilizes appropriate data resources, methodologies, and software tools, to assist business units and IT developers with construction of business applications, and fulfillment of ad-hoc queries and reports -Participate in the design, development, implementation, maintenance, and support of business intelligence and analytical systems, including initial user training and transition.  -Have a clear understanding of the organizationâs legacy and operational data flow, to map data from various organizational sources into a common view as described by the data model -Creates and assigns metadata entity and attribute descriptors, data flow diagrams, and other descriptive modeling documentation needed for data access mapping -Maintains metadata directory and data dictionary -Establishes and enforces standards for use of the unit data systems -Coordinates with the USSC Director and USSC Project Manager in the planning and coordination of internal data administration projects and staff -Define business units HFHI departments and US/Canada Affiliates Required Skills:  -Conduct interviews with business units and other key stakeholders to assess data reporting requirement -Analyze data requirements to determine data sources, accuracy, consistency, patterns and anomalies, etc -Create and maintain documentation and descriptors for data elements, and other required forms of metadata -Provide business rules and specifications to support data models -Conduct logical system reviews to ensure that the data model supports user requirements -Support development and deployment of business, and business intelligence applications -Assists business users and developers with ad-hoc query and report requests -Provide consultation and training to business users and developers in the efficient use of data reporting and ad-hoc tools -Assist in the training of new staff members # Job Category Business/Management/Marketing Job Type Full Position Job Location E-mail Experience Level 0-2 years Compensation Not Specified Company Direct Employer - Hound Credit 14 Posted/Last Updated March 12, 2011 Job Description Job Responsibilities and Requirements: Vice President - Business Valuation and Corporate Services Practice Group LeaderWe envision our leaders as being the foundation stones of the company, critical to the support and success of future growth. We recognize a strong leader as possessing a unique combination of strengths an entrepreneurial spirit, energetic attitude and a willingness to take calculated risks. Our leaders have a talent for building world-class practice groups that consistently achieve double digit top line sales heights while simultaneously meeting bottom line profitability objectives. Strong leaders provide a high level of support and direction in business development, team development and process improvements. We expect our Corporate Services Valuation practice leaders to leverage their entrepreneurial spirit to generate a profitable business, manage an individual profit and loss statement, and to work collaboratively with our direct sales force to produce sales. Proactive and observant in their approach, our leaders learn the needs of their team and are energetic in recruiting, mentoring and providing in-depth training to cement a world-class team brick-by-brick, consistent with business demands and client needs. Experienced leaders intrinsically know calculated risks must be taken to continuously refine processes and procedures; to efficiently and effectively develop, produce and present a consistently maintained, high standard of quality; and ensure the accuracy and thoroughness of the information in our products. Successful leaders embrace the weight of a diverse, fast-paced environment and react with urgency when required. Their tenacious attitude and political adeptness is a valued skill applied in situations adhering to the long-term stability, growth and development of a practice, people and processes.AccuVals Corporate Services Valuation practice (Corporate Services) provides appraisal and advisory services to corporations for financial reporting, property tax management, litigation support, risk management and all business planning purposes.The position will involve day-to-day interactions with the CEO, COO, regional business development managers, leaders of other practice groups, and the VP of Human Resources. The candidate will manage an individual P&L.OrganizationAccuVal provides a broad range of business valuation services and advisory solutions that empower many of the worlds largest and best-known companies to confidently make strategic decisions and achieve greater success. We promise our clients accuracy, integrity and dedication to their needs. Our firm is a dedicated partner that excels at personal service and proactive communication with the capabilities, resources and global reach to help clients set and achieve meaningful new goals every day.Experience RequirementsThe candidate should have at least 10 to 15 years of direct business valuation experience and exhibit the exemplary technical and communication skills necessary to produce professional and authoritatively supported enterprise and equity valuations. Professional industry designations such as ASA, NACVF and CFA are strongly desired but not essential, depending on the candidates background and experience. The candidate must have an impeccable history of supporting his or her valuation conclusions under the intense scrutiny third party public auditors, government institutions such as the IRS and SEC, and should be qualified as an expert witness in a court of law.The candidate should be proficient in all aspects of business development, and have a proven history of revenue generation attributable to the candidate. Including prospecting new customer relationships, scoping new engagements, closing sales leads and developing and/or supervising the on-time delivery of the high-quality work product promised.We offer advancement opportunities and an excellent benefit package including 401K, company paid health/dental/life insurance and opportunity for bonus.Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer  For more information of this job please visit us at  To know more about Hound, please visit us at  NOT OK to contact directly by recruiters NOT OK to contact about other services, products or commercial interests NOT OK to repost to elsewhere If you think this post is inappropriate for this site (miscategorized, prohibited, spam, outdated ...),  .  |  |  |  |  |  2011 8LIST.  ,  ,  ,
CleanTitle: Vice President - Business Valuation And Corporate

jobText: Date: 1-27-2011  Location: Redmond, WA  Area Code: 425  Tax Term: CON_CORP CON_IND CON_W2  Pay Rate: As per Experience  Length: 12+ months  Position ID: 182202  Dice ID: 10124953  Travel Required: none  Telecommute: no  NCDA Certified NetApp Senior Storage Engineer NetApp Senior Storage Engineer (NCDA) Location: Redmond,WA Duration: 12+ months A NCDA certified level 2 PSE should be able to implement (install and configure) with confidence NetApp storage solutions, and for this position be able to do this in a SAN environment, provision storage, configure switch*s, troubleshoot SAN fabric issues, etc.  In this position the candidate would be responsible for the day-to-day administration of NetApp hardware and helping the NetApp MSFT Account team demonstrate NetApp's competencies as a FC SAN within the cleints MSIT environment.  The environment will include FAS6080 devices, configured to snap mirror to one another for replication. The NetApp On-Site resident will be expected to maintain the systems in a healthy state, report on the system health and condition. Address any configuration changes, volume allocations, aggregate layouts, etc... Engage with NetApp support in the event of a support issue and work closely with the account team TGA to ensure proactive support measures and best practices are followed.  It is expected that the customer will also direct the resident for additional project type work related to the new NetApp systems, or reviewing the existing EMC/HP XP infrastructure and how NetApp can be leveraged to address needs in those areas.  This is listed technologies are of most importance  SAN; NetApp Storage Admin; SnapManager SQL; SnapMirror; NAS; NTFS  Required: , Brocade Switch, SnapDrive, MS FT Windows  Nice to Have: EMC Clarion, DMX, VMAX. ECC HDS USP, XP, Cisco Switch, Snap Manager for Hyper-V, Ops Manager, Protection Manager, SanScreen, Provisioning Manager, SQL  ________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ Thank you, Abhishek Kumar 646-200-7173 abhi@amtexsystems.com Abhishek Kumar Amtex Systems Inc. Local candidates are preferred. In person meeting is required prior hiring. The role will be to capture, analyze, and report on usage data, customer feedback, and revenue reporting across our product suite, being our central point of contact for understanding the state of our business and state of our product performance * and even more critically to make recommendations based on this data to the product and business teams on actions and changes in the product to capitalize on trends. The ideal candidate will have a deep background in metrics tracking and analysis, with the ability to put together dashboards and views on consumer web data that can allow teams to make actionable decisions as well as the keen ability to identify trends in data patterns and make recommendations on how we should react to the findings. In addition, a love for the entertainment world * music, movies, TV, pop culture * and a passion for great consumer products is a must!  Key Responsibilities: - Support consumer usage data reporting and analytics across current Entertainment & Lifestyles sites  - Define reporting dashboards to communicate said information clearly and regularly - Work with customer care to capture and analyze customer feedback - Develop a global view of revenue performance for our sites - Make recommendations back to product teams and business teams based on patterns that emerge from usage and customer data - Make recommendations on designs for an organizational structure that can be more customer focused in general Qualifications and Skills: - 6+ years experience analyzing data and usage patterns for consumer web products  - Strong background in customer feedback analysis - Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.  - Ability to speak and interact with business teams and technical teams - Experience dashboarding product KPIs and producing analysis and recommendations based on dashboards If you are interested in this opening, please forward a copy of your updated resume in word format to lli@base-one.com Base One Technologies Phone: (919) 341-7393 Fax: (914) 633-3851 Web:  Apply Now Hot Topics About Dice Related Dice Sites | | | | | Rate Job Dice.com Positive Neutral Negative Submit Report Job Dice.com Misrepresented job Pays below market level Not a real job Position no longer available Other Please Provide an Explanation (400 character limit) Security Check: Answer the question below to confirm you're a human being. We are not your typical salon and spa, as we are continually involved in local media, fashion shows, publications, weddings, and community service. Our customer service is unmatched, as is our talent. We are currently hiring for the position: Esthetician: Full Time or Part Time This is a unique position to the salon and spa as you will be the only Esthetician servicing a salon full of clients. Bring your "A" game and work ethic, and we will provide the Golden Ticket. Position Purpose: To provide professional quality spa services for guests. Provides consistent spa services for Salon Guests. Has excellent knowledge of face mapping and can adapt each service according to the needs of the guest. Takes care of his/her own appearance and well-being needs by having healthy skin-care practices. Believes learning never ends and is committed to continuing advanced education, both as provided by the employing salon and self-study. Description of Duties: Willing to perform all spa services listed on the Spalon Menu and is committed to learning how to perform each service consistently. Believes self-care is an essential part of the guest experience and commits to educating spa guests on the importance of self-care at home. Incorporates retail sales into treatments. Maintains extensive knowledge of Aveda products. Participates in regularly scheduled salon team meetings and cross-training opportunities. Participates in Aveda Advanced Trainings, Shows, and implements practices that are taught. Aveda experience preferred, but not required. Other duties as assigned and/or required. There's momentum here: Parent company PNC Financial was named by Business Week magazine as one of its " Top 50 Performers" in any industry. As a Financial Sales Consultant, you immediately become an important member of a single branch office. You will report to the Branch Manager. Every day, your position combines entrepreneurial opportunity with the structure and resources of room-to-grow offered by a large company. In your role, you'll identify the financial needs of our customers and recommend PNC products and services to meet those needs. You'll use your sales experience, product and procedural knowledge, and willingness to consultatively guide customer issues towards quick resolution. As a competitor, PNC is committed to market leadership in products, technology, and service. It means both you and your colleagues will be backed by state-of-the-industry software, call-desk support, and training resources. The successful candidate will have the following qualifications: At least 6 months of cash handling experience is required.  Prior experience in being evaluated by customers is preferred.  At least 1 year of customer service experience in a financial services, sales or retail industry is preferred.  Ability to cross-sell products and services is preferred.  Excellent interpersonal skills and professional manner.  Strong written and verbal communication skills.  Computer skills to include ability work in Windows based applications.  Able to lift heavy coin as well as stand on feet for a long period of time.  Able to work evenings and weekends depending on branch needs is required.
