Job Description » Return to Search Results Title Plant Controller Description Reporting directly to the Operations Controller of North American Tire (NAT) and having regular interaction/communication with the Director, Manufacturing Financial Planning and Analysis, the Plant Controller is responsible for the accounting, plant financial/cost analysis and internal controls at the plant. This includes responsibility for the monthly financial statement close and plant financial reporting, while maintaining effective internal controls in compliance with Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX). The Plant Controller is responsible for partnering with the Plant Leadership Team and other NAT manufacturing finance leadership to ensure plant and finance goals and objectives are achieved and to develop people resources. Knowledge and Skills * Track record of achieving measurable business objectives. * Thorough understanding of U.S. GAAP, accounting for complex transactions and internal controls in compliance with SOX. * Strong knowledge, understanding, and practical skills in relevant systems (i.e. ERP system (SAP preferred), MS Office products, Hyperion or similar application) as applicable to the region. * Experienced in building a highly performing Finance team, developing talent for the organization as evidenced by advancement and success of team members. * Consulting skills, including the ability to draw on the ideas of key team members and convert them into meaningful strategies and plans. * Change management experience, focused on getting large groups " on board" with new processes and techniques. * Interpersonal skills that establish and maintain excellent relationships and credibility quickly. Creates team atmosphere while achieving key objectives. * Develops team members through coaching and feedback on results. Shares personal knowledge and experience. Moves decisively on performance problems. * Demonstrates a high level of understanding of how key accounting decisions impact the business units and forecasted operating results/cash flows. Personal Skills / Attributes * Able to interface seamlessly with those on both sides of the plant / factory organization; the plant manager and plant leadership, and the associates on the shop floor. * A visible and passionate leader internally. Has the personal courage to recommend/make difficult decisions. * Able to analyze and grasp a situation quickly from different perspectives and create well-reasoned solutions. * Demonstrates ethical and moral behavior; unquestionable integrity and character. * Highly organized and has ability to manage concurrent deadlines and multiple priorities. * Through effective communications skills, able to present ideas and complex, technical information clearly and persuasively to a wide range of audiences. * Desire to grow professionally with an interest in a manufacturing company; including a willingness to relocate for growth opportunities is preferred. * Strong work ethic.  Requirements Successful candidate must possess a 4 year degree in Accounting or Finance MBA, CPA, or CMA strongly preferred Cost accounting, inventory management, and product profitability improvement experience is strongly preferred Experience in supporting and realizing results from activities such as Lean, 6- sigma, and quality 3 to 5 years of management experience strongly preferred Minimum 8 to 10 years of accounting/analysis experience in manufacturing cost environment including supervision of staff Knowledge of SAP preferred Strong analytical and problem solving skills. Effective leadership and ability to influence others Demonstrated coaching, interpersonal, and communication skills Highly organized and has ability to manage concurrent deadlines and multiple priorities Ability to communicate or present information, both verbally and written, effectively with all levels of the organization Desire to grow professionally with an interest in a manufacturing company, including willingness to relocate for growth opportunities is strongly preferred Strong Microsoft Excel work skills required; knowledge of Access a plus Sarbanes-Oxley (SOx) and Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) Tasks Responsibility for the financial reporting processes at the manufacturing plant. This includes the monthly, quarterly and annual financial statement close procedures, account reconciliations, and establishing judgmental reserve balances whether completed by the Centralized Plant Accounting department in Akron, Ohio or locally at the plant level. Ensure processes are compliant with U.S. Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) and Company Policy. Ensure that a robust internal control structure is in place, functioning effectively, and appropriately tested in accordance with SOX. Ensure that identified control and internal audit gaps are remediated on a timely basis. Responsible for delivering tone-at-the top messaging to the plant leadership team and accounting/finance department at the plant as to the importance of internal controls. Manage the quarterly letter of representation and SOX certification processes. Ensure appropriate assurance procedures are completed and communicated to the business leadership team. Develop talent for the finance organization, including development of professionals within the business and succession planning for key finance roles. Ensure a strong performance management process that aligns individual objectives with business metrics and connects performance against objectives to compensation and career progression. Drive continuous improvement initiatives related to finance processes and systems. Work with Plant accounting and finance teams as well as with other plant associates and NAT's divisional management to implement effective financial analysis tools and processes to improve the plant's financial performance. Participate in activities such as the annual operating plan, monthly/quarterly reporting, and special analyses as necessary. This position also provides financial analysis and reporting support to certain other business objectives such as safety, environmental compliance, and quality production. Understand and have an ability to summarize and communicate clearly the financial and operating results of the plants in order to measure progress against objectives and assess the effectiveness of decisions made. Work with finance leadership to identify actionable cost reduction and cash flow generation opportunities. Responsible for production cost information as well as any studies on plant investments, restructuring, and budget justification. Local oversight of the Standard Cost setting process which involves coordination of production levels and cost bases with the Manufacturing Financial Planning and Analysis and Product Business Unit organizations. Type Full-time Location NC, Asheboro Refer a Friend Apply Now  Goodyear  866-713-0051  2011 The RightThing Inc. All Rights Reserved.

. 4,480 Current Job Vacancies 2,483 Agencies Using EDJOIN Have a question or a problem using EDJOIN? Click to view Q:  What is a Wish List? A:  A Wish List is a list of all the jobs you have stored in the My Job Wish List page of your profile. This feature is ideal when you are searching for several jobs at a time and want to bookmark them to apply later. To use this feature, follow these steps: 1. Log into your EDJOIN account. 2. Enter your search criteria either from the Home page or by clicking on the Job Search tab. 3. Once you have found a job posting you want to bookmark, click the "Add to my wish list" button at the bottom of the posting, then continue with your job search.  4. When completed with your job search and ready to review/apply for these positions, click on the MY EDJOIN tab at the top of the page. 5. Click on the My Job Wish List prompt and proceed with the application process. PLEASE NOTE: Job postings that have already closed will no longer display on your Wish List. Q:  I am trying to apply for a position but it requires a password. Why is this and where can I obtain the password. A:  Some districts choose to post positions for current district staff only. In order to apply for these positions you must enter a password. If you are a current employee, the password can be obtained by contacting the HR department at the district to which you are attempting to apply. The HR contact information will be listed at the top right of the posting. Please Note: The password for an in district position WILL NOT be your EDJOIN password. Q:  Some of the job postings ask for a Certificate of Competence. What is it, and how do I get it? A:  The " Certificate of Competence" (COC) is the form that California public schools use to document Highly Qualified Teacher requirements. The California Department of Education has created a template, but some districts use their own form. Teachers should be able to obtain a copy of the COC from their Human Resources Office, and are encouraged to keep a copy of this form and related documentation.  Q:  Why is the Click Here To Apply button missing at the bottom of the posting I wish to apply for? A:  Some employers choose to not accept online applications through EDJOIN. In this case you will need to review the job posting for instructions on how to apply for the position or contact the organization who has posted the position. |  Keywords Location example: drug discovery New York, NY or 10001 > > For Job Seekers Systems Developer - EDRI and Surveillance Systems(Computer Systems Manager-I) Company: (Direct Employer) Location: Category: Information Technology, System Posted: Jan. 07, 2011 Job Type: Full-time Experience: At Least 3 Years Degree: Master or Equivalent Deadline: 03/07/2011 Description & Requirement DIVISION/PROGRAM DESCRIPTION: The nation's leading local health department seeks one (1) motivated, experienced Systems Developer (Computer Systems Manager, M-I) to join its award-winning, innovative technology team in implementing and enhancing the newly platformed disease registry systems for TB, STD, Communicable and Vaccine Preventable Disease registry systems and an Outbreak Management System as well as the Electronic Disease Reporting Infrastructure (eDRI), the system that that streamlines electronic disease reports (from laboratories and hospitals) to registry systems and integrates the systems.  JOB DESCRIPTION:  The New York City Department of Health and Mental Hygiene's (DOHMH) Division of Informatics and Information Technology is responsible for sending and receiving health related data to and from over 100 various healthcare and laboratories as well as managing and delivering disease reports to the appropriate Disease Control Bureau's surveillance system.  As the Systems Developer, your duties will include:  Responsible for making enhancements to eDRI, including adding new data sources such as the NYC DOHMH Public Health Laboratory, Death certificates, and mandated provider reporting from electronic health records across New York City health care facilities to efficiently deliver them to disease surveillance systems.  Contribute to development of building complex workflows and reports for Division of Disease Control Surveillance systems.  Provide day-to-day support as well as rapid development in the event of an outbreak scenario.  PREFERRED SKILLS:  Candidates desired skills/experience: at an expert level, with the following concepts/ technologies: IBM Websphere Platform including Message Broker and MQ. Java 5/6, Struts 2, Spring, ebXML, WS-Security, J2EE application development (Java/JSP), XML, and SQL 2005/2008 Server. Candidates should have several years experience in design, analysis, and programming Java applications based on Strut2 technology. A " hands-on" Developer with a proven track record of progressive experience, teamwork and technical skills; Strong technical vision with effective people skills to allow close work with coworkers and senior management; Innovative and creative problem solver, who is results oriented, has an aptitude for learning and can maximize resources.  QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS:  1. A Master's degree in computer science from an accredited college and three years of progressively more responsible, full-time, satisfactory experience using information technology in computer applications programming, systems programming, computer systems development, data telecommunications, database administration, planning of data/information processing, user services, or area networks at least 18 months of this experience must have been in an administrative, managerial or executive capacity in the areas of computer applications programming, systems programming, computer systems development, data telecommunications, data base administration, or planning of data processing or in the supervision of staff performing these duties; or  2. A Baccalaureate degree from an accredited college and four years of experience as described in 1 above; or  3. A four-year High School diploma or its educational equivalent approved by a State's department of education or recognized accrediting organization and six years of experience as described in 1 above; or  4. A satisfactory combination of education and experience equivalent to 1 , 2 or 3 above. However, all candidates must have at least a four-year High School diploma or its educational equivalent approved by a State's department of education or recognized accrediting organization and must possess at least three years of experience as described in 1 above, including the 18 months of administrative, managerial, executive or supervisory experience as described in 1 above.  NOTE: The following types of experience are not acceptable: superficial use of preprogrammed software without complex programming, design, implementation or management of the product; use of word processing packages; use of a hand held calculator; primarily the entering or updating of data in a system; the operation of data processing hardware or consoles. The Assets of Chesapeake Midstream (" CM" ) consist of over 5,000 miles of active gathering pipelines located in Oklahoma, Texas, Louisiana, Arkansas, Kansas, West Virginia, Pennsylvania, and New York.  Primary Duties  Responsible for gathering and analyzing physical flow details in order to generate accurate monthly and quarterly fuel reports  Work with field personnel, Engineers, Measurement Analysts, Contract Administration, Volume Control and Gas Accounting for continuous improvement of accurate source information for gathering and processing allocations and transactions, including fuel management  Understand Midstream regulatory requirements and take action as required  Perform transaction audits against contract terms to ensure accurate invoicing  Coordinate monthly closing activities across multiple functional areas  Coordinate new gathering system and plant setups in Quorum/TIPS software  Qualifications Preferred Qualifications  Knowledge of natural gas industry  Ability to work and contribute in a collaborative team environment  Excellent customer service awareness  Excellent problem solving and analysis skills  Excellent written and communications skills  Able to effectively manage time and prioritize projects in order to meet established deadlines  Able to work and communicate effectively with all levels of co-workers, clients, and other external contacts  Attention to detail and thoroughness  Strong computer skills including MS Access, Excel, Word, Outlook, Quorum/TIPS  A Bachelors Degree in Accounting, Business Administration or Finance; prior work experience in the Midstream segment of the oil and gas industry may be considered in lieu of a degree  Primary Location US-OK-Oklahoma City Send this job to a friend Send this job description to a friend by email. jobText: Home News Headlines Jobs by Location Jobs by Title Jobs by Company Today's Jobs Post Resume what in  All Locations Alaska Alabama Arkansas Arizona California Colorado Connecticut District of Columbia Delaware Florida Georgia Hawaii Iowa Idaho Illinois Indiana Kansas Kentucky Louisiana Massachusetts Maryland Maine Michigan Minnesota Missouri Mississippi Montana North Carolina North Dakota Nebraska New Hampshire New Jersey New Mexico Nevada New York Ohio Oklahoma Oregon Pennsylvania Puerto Rico Rhode Island South Carolina South Dakota Tennessee Texas Utah Virginia Vermont Washington Wisconsin West Virginia Wyoming Summer Intern - R D Job  Company -  BIO-RAD Location -  Hercules ,  California US Job Code -  ID11-002 Position -  See job description Job First Active on:  Tuesday, April 19, 2011 Summer Intern - R D ID11-002 Hercules CA Research Biochemistry/Chemistry major Duties and Responsibilities: Position Responsibilities: The summer internship with the Autoimmune R& D team in Clinical Systems Division at Bio-Rad Laboratories will be a great opportunity for an undergraduate in life sciences for exposure to: -Clinical Diagnostics Industry -Product development for the clinical diagnostics of autoimmune diseases -Understanding of how a product works -How to evaluate product performance The Autoimmune Team will be in a process of evaluating the performance of several clinical diagnostic kits and conducting research in new assay development. The summer intern will work with senior scientists on projects and participate in team meetings. He/She will learn about how clinical diagnostics assays work, how to evaluate their performance and how new assays are developed. He/She will learn how to perform ELISA assays and how to run clinical instrumentations. The intern will also learn about Quality System and Good Manufacture Practices, design and execute studies, problem solving, and writing technical reports. This is an excellent project for technical students who are interested I pursuing academic/medical/clinical careers to gain valuable experience in a challenging diagnostic/biotechnology company. Role & Responsibilities: Carry out a series of experiments under the direction of a Senior Scientist Learn and operate an ELISA Analyzer Design, execute, and analyze experiments Report data and test results to key stakeholders in a professional forum. Skills and Experience: QUALIFICATIONS: You must have completed your sophomore or junior year by June at an accredited college or university with plans to return to school in the following term (you are not eligible for this program if you have already graduated) - Have a grade point average of 3.0 or better (on a 4.0 scale) - Be eligible to work in the United States - Be willing to make a full-time commitment of 40 hours a week for 10 weeks from mid June to late August Biochemistry/Chemistry major EXPERIENCE: Biochemistry/Chemistry laboratory courses, experience in research laboratory a plus. Job Type Firm Type Location IH-Non GC InHouse Louisville, KY USA Senior Counsel âCompetition Law and Commercial Sales GE Appliances & Lighting ("GE-A& L"), a division of GE with revenues exceeding $8 billion, has exclusively engaged Major, Lindsey & Africa to conduct a search for a Senior Counsel âCompetition Law and Commercial Sales for its Louisville, Kentucky headquarters. The successful candidate will report directly to GE-A& Lâs General Counsel and will be responsible for all competition, distribution and commercial law issues. GE A& L is looking for an attorney with 10+ years experience in commercial law matters (including sales, commercial transactions, property/equipment sales/leasing and creditors rights), as well as distribution law, business regulation and competition issues. Serving as the lead competition and distribution lawyer for GE-A& L, the successful candidate will provide legal and transactional support/expertise. He or she will also support the companyâs marketing organization on marketing strategy, go-to-market strategy, and compliance with federal and state trade practices and advertising laws. In addition, the position will be responsible for certain domestic and global transactions; will review periodic reports, press releases and analyst presentations; and will handle compliance complaints and antitrust/competition investigations. The position will manage a team of commercial lawyers, so although in-house experience is not required, it is strongly desired. This is a national search and well-qualified candidates from any location in the U.S. are encouraged to apply. A relocation package will be provided and a competitive compensation package for the market is offered commensurate with experience. Interested candidates should send a Microsoft Word version of their resumes and a brief cover letter to dlambert@mlaglobal.com. jobText: JOB SEEKERS, EMPLOYERS,  |  Share What Where Search in Job Title Only +  +  +  Job Details Job Title Safety Manager Job Profile Title: Safety Manager  Location: CA-San Diego  Experience a Dynamic Global Company that is Committed to a Sustainable World and the Communities it Serves  Safety Manager  Parsons provides landmark planning, environmental, engineering, construction, and facility operation services to the U.S. Government. Our innovative solutions have supported sustainability, space exploration, aviation, chemical weapons clean-up, military installations and ranges and missile defense programs. Our services also support reconstruction efforts after man-made or natural disasters and homeland security initiatives. We make the world a safer place.  POSITION OVERVIEW:  Parsons Safety Manager will provide the expertise, technical assistance and support to and on behalf of the client for site safety management and oversight of their Owner Controlled Insurance Program (OCIP). Coordination and supervision of the activities of the safety managers provided by the OCIP Brokers and Carriers and on-site first aid facility staff(s) will be required. This individual will also be responsible for drug testing coordination/administration for the general contractor(s), subcontractors and sub-tiers.  SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES :  This individual will represent the company in all safety matters pertaining to internal and external activities. He/she may receive additional assignments in terms of broad objectives from the Corporate Safety Director. He/she may be asked to review, interpret and provide assistance on Corporate safety regulations and standards. He/she may be asked to monitors company safety performance and conduct project audits and/or safety inspections.  SKILLS/COMPETENCIES:  Requires extensive knowledge of Federal and state health and safety regulations and reporting procedures, as well as strong written and oral communication skills.  Ability to perform in a supervisory/managerial capacity is also required. Experience performing safety related work related to heavy civil construction; RCC dams, tunnels, pipelines, etc.  Participates in the development and implementation of project safety plans.  Assigns and provides technical supervision of safety performance, qualifications and programs.  Reviews contractors on bid list with regard to safety performance, qualifications and programs.  Conducts safety audits through review and analysis of performance of safety records and safety inspections of various offices and projects in compliance with SHARP Management.  Participates with labor relations representatives in pre-job conferences to present the company safety policy and explain implementation on the project.  Assists the Workers' Compensation Analyst in coordinating medical care and case management of employees injured at company facilities.  Reviews loss control reports from company insurance carriers and regulatory inspection agencies and confers with appropriate management representatives on compliance with regulations and citations.  Be of such physical condition that it would not interfere with the proper performance of their duties.  Performs other responsibilities associated with this position as may be appropriate.  PREFERRED EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:  4-year degree in Construction or related field (or equivalent experience) and 10-15 years of related work experience in the field of Health and Safety, including some supervisory experience.  About Parsons  Parsons offers an ethical, challenging, diverse, rewarding and fun work experience where enthusiastic, responsible people use their energy, talent and dedication to make a difference in the world.Parsons, an engineering and construction firm with revenues exceeding $2.9 billion in 2009, is 100% owned by the Employee Stock Ownership Trust. We surmount the toughest logistical challenges and deliver landmark design-build projects across the globe. Our ability to plan, design, construct, and operate varied facilities and infrastructure systems has satisfied our clients' needs for more than 60 years. With nearly 12,000 employees located worldwide, we team with an increasingly diverse group of global customers and stakeholders while maintaining our uncompromising principles of safety, quality, integrity, diversity, innovation and sustainability.  Parsons is an equal opportunity, drug-free employer committed to diversity in the workplace. M/W/D/V.  Job URL Location: USA-CA-San Diego  Posted on Oct 06,2011 Company info Your  is guaranteed. We will never give out, lease, or sell your personal information. Back to prior page Printable Format Job Description - CitiFinancial (CFS) Collections Services Representative - West Milwaukee, WI July/August (11027720) Job Description Brief Description of the Organization CitiFinancial provides community-based lending services through a strong branch network system in North America with over 2,100 offices in 48 states and Canada. Decisions are made locally by CitiFinancial team members who live and work in the locations they serve. This on-the-ground, face-to-face customer interaction gives us a unique competitive advantage, allowing us to best determine each client´s needs. Our consumer loan services include real estate-secured loans, unsecured and partially secured personal loans, and loans to finance consumer goods. CitiFinancial (CFS) Collections Services Representative - West Milwaukee, WI July/August - 11027720 Description CFS Loss Mitigation Specialist 1 The CFS Loss Mitigation Specialist 1 has initial and frequent contact with customers. This position will identify and address early and late stage collections requirements, needs/issue, volumes, and timelines for a portfolio or group of portfolios. This position will also recommend solutions for difficult delinquent accounts, provide excellent customer service to the portfolio of customers, perform administrative tasks (such as cash drawer management, answer telephones, routine typing, order supplies and pay bills), and service accounts. The position requires direct supervision from the Center Manager and hands-on coaching from the Assistant Center Manager.  CFS Loss Mitigation Specialist 2 The CFS Loss Mitigation Specialist 2 often has initial and frequent contact with customers. This position will identify and address early and late stage collections requirements, needs/issue, volumes, and timelines for a portfolio or group of portfolios. This position will also recommend solutions for difficult delinquent accounts, provide excellent customer service to the portfolio of customers, perform limited administrative tasks (such as cash drawer management, answer telephones, routine typing, order supplies and pay bills), and service accounts. The position requires general supervision from the Center Manager and some coaching from the Assistant Center Manager. **NOTE** The information listed within this description summary is intended to indicate the general nature and level of work. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive account of all the responsibilities, and/or minimum qualifications required of an employee assigned to this position. Qualifications Education Requirements: â¢High School Diploma or Equivalent required Experience â¢ CFS Loss Mitigation Specialist 1: 6 months to 2 years of directly related experience in one or more of the following core competencies: collections, customer service or sales.  â¢ CFS Loss Mitigation Specialist 2: 3+ years of directly related experience in one or more of the following core competencies: collections, customer service or sales. Licensing Requirements For all CFS non-Personal Loan Center (PLC) Loss Mitigation Specialist 3 positions: Possession of an active Mortgage Loan Originator License in the applicable state at the time of hire is preferred. All individuals hired into this position will be required to apply for and obtain any necessary state license to sell mortgage and/ or real-estate products in the time allotted by Company policy as a condition of continued employment. While requirements for licensure vary by state, in order to obtain and maintain a license you may be required to provide a summary of personal and work history, submit to periodic criminal background and credit history reviews, satisfy pre-licensure and continuing education requirements, as well as obtain a passing score on a written exam. For all other CFS non-exempt positions (Collector 1, LMS 1, LMS 2, and LMS 3 (in PLC only)): Possession of an active Mortgage Loan Originator License in the applicable state at the time of hire is preferred. All individuals hired into this position will be expected to make every attempt to obtain any necessary state license to sell mortgage and/ or real-estate products as a condition of continued employment. While requirements for licensure vary by state, in order to apply for, obtain, and maintain a license you may be required to provide a summary of personal and work history, submit to periodic criminal background and credit history reviews, satisfy pre-licensure and continuing education requirements, as well as obtain a passing score on a written exam. CFS Loss Mitigation Specialist 1 and CFS Loss Mitigation Specialist 2 only Problem Solving/Analytical Skills: Moderate analytical ability required to: â¢Review customer information in accordance with established credit criteria, to recommend credit decisions and product options. â¢Research and respond to customer inquiries promptly and accurately. â¢Perform mathematical calculations. Communication Skills â¢Ability to effectively communicate with all levels of employees, management and customers. â¢Demonstrated effective verbal, written, and listening skills. â¢Professional telephone skills and manners. Interpersonal Skills â¢Ability to work as a member of a team. â¢Demonstrated ability to work directly with people in a customer service capacity. â¢Ability to maintain lasting business relationships. Sales and Influencing Skills â¢Ability to determine customer needs. â¢Ability to determine the right product to meet the customer need. Office Equipment/Machines â¢Familiarity with PC-like hardware/software, including use of PC keyboard and mouse. â¢Ability to efficiently use calculators and typewriters. Physical Demand Mental/visual stress e.g., dealing with a high volume of calls, lifting heavy boxes, standing for extended period of time, walking for extended period of time, eye strain from extended use of computer, difficult/angry customers, driving, etc. Additional Requirements/Skills â¢Must have a valid driver's license (PR only). â¢Must be able to work flexible hours. â¢Basic knowledge of accounting helpful. â¢Ability to function in a fast-paced environment. Employment Opening Qualitative Research Director (Healthcare) Location Classification: Chicago, Illinois Position Type: Other Research Positions Company Classification: Marketing Research Company Hours/Schedule: Permanent Full Time Base Salary: Other/Not Specified Offered By: Hall & Partners, Global Marketing Research Company Chicago, Illinois 60654  Company Description: Hall & Partners is a specialist in brand and communications research, offering both qualitative and quantitative research solutions to some of the most vibrant domestic and international brands.  We are dedicated to an open, supportive environment which gives talented people the opportunity to grow along with a successful company; one which has seen dynamic, organic growth since its inception over 15 years ago. Job Description: The Research Director (RD) is an important role at the agency and is rooted in the development of client relationships and effective team management. The RD is likely to have at least ten years experience and be a truly seasoned, rounded operator. The role of the RD is more than just "running accounts" âitâs about managing client relationships and leading those relationships forward. The RD role is especially strategic âthe focus is on directing and developing across a number of key clients or in this case focusing on singularly important one. The RD often plays a significant role in winning these pieces of business or securing a significantly higher proportion of the clientâs research budget. While working closely with Chicago Partner in our Healthcare group and the rest of the team, the RD plays an essential role in fostering the client-H& P relationship. The client should consistently think that we produce fresh, innovative work that regularly contributes to the development of their business, brand and communications. The relationship should be run in a non-complacent, constantly challenging way. Contact should be regular and high quality. Interaction should go beyond project issues and in the direction of the right kind of contribution to the business.  Specifically, as a part of account management responsibilities, the role of the RD is to respond to client rfps, direct the proposal writing and study design; use advanced moderating techniques with ease, working independently or as part of a multi-member team; provide strategic analytics and presenting research findings to large international and cross-discipline client groups.  Overall itâs about the long-term client relationship âthe RD doesnât just do good work, they need to be constantly alert to strategic opportunities and threats. Their skills and presence should be such that theyâre regularly successfully running significant meetings and presentations. But they need to never be an island - and think through the right time to get the Partner or MD involved in a way that safeguards and enhances our business Bachelors Degree  . "Growing" the team for which the RD has management responsibility is a critical part of achieving this. They will have direct management responsibility for a team of capable, ambitious executives who need to be stretched and developed so that they can themselves increasingly run clients and projects. The team is likely to consist of between two to five people. Overall, the RD role is fundamentally about adding to the business âcritically it is about building things, and changing the shape of the business in a material fashion - not just managing revenue. It requires someone with distinctive individual potential âplaying a crucial role in the overall success of Hall & Partners.  Job Requirements: â¢Minimum of 10 years research experience within leading qualitative shops or planning at agencies with hands-on qualitative experience âmoderating groups, doing ethnographic interviews, etc. â¢Senior account/client management experience on a large pharmaceutical or healthcare client.  â¢Ability to speak with Senior Planners at Agencies, global and domestic marketing directors and brand / therapeutic category research consultants â¢Strong moderating and research project skills â¢Strong communications and time management skills. Willingness to travel â¢Solid organization skills and ability to multitask â¢Positive attitude and personality  Additional Comments: How to apply: Please submit resumes with targeted cover notes to careers@hallandpartners.com. No staffing agencies. jobText: Job Announcement DEPARTMENT OF THE ARMY Vacancy Announcement Number:  SWDM11099272 Opening Date:  June 15, 2011 Closing Date:  June 21, 2011 Position: Patient Transfer Coordinator (OA), GS-0303-05 Salary: $31,315 - $40,706 Annual Place of Work:  US Army Medical Activities Ireland Army Community Hospital Patient Administration Division, Outpatient Medical records Branch, Fort Knox KY 40121 Position Status:  This is a Permanent position. -- Full Time  Number of Vacancy: 1 Duties: You will serve as a Patient Transfer Coordinator performing a variety of duties to expedite and coordinate procedures for movement of patients between medical facilities, by air and ground. Processes transfer of patients to other medical treatment facilities, and receives request for transfer of patients. Ensures transportation, attendants, medication, records, x-rays, baggage and any special equipment accompany patient. You will assist as an Admissions and Dispositions Clerk, to perform Admission and Disposition duties using the Composite Health Care System (CHCS), which entails the interviewing of patients being admitted to this hospital and determine eligibility for treatment. Prepares inpatient record and related paperwork for the ward. Serves as individual responsible for depositing of funds into the Patient's Trust Fund. Receives valuables and funds from inpatients and forward items to the Custodian of the Patient's Trust fund for deposit.  About the Position: The position is located in the Patient Administration Division, Ireland Army Community Hospital. Incumbent will serve as a Patient Transfer Coordinator. The supervisor will provide instructions regarding the scope of assignments and results that are expected, but incumbent will use own initiative in carrying out the duties.  Who May Apply: (Click on Who May Apply)  All Federal employees serving on a career or career-conditional appointment.  Reinstatement eligibles.  NAF/AAFES Interchange Agreement eligibles.  Applicants eligible under Veterans Employment Opportunities Act of 1998 (VEOA)  Veterans eligible as 30% Disabled Veterans.  Veterans' Recruitment Authority (VRA).  Interagency Career Transition Assistance Plan (ICTAP) eligibles.  Family member employees eligible under Executive Order 12721.  Military spouses eligible under EO 13473.  Qualifications: Click on link below to view qualification standard.  General Schedule  To qualify for the GS-5 grade level, one year of specialized experience equivalent to the GS-4 grade level is required. SPECIALIZED EXPERIENCE: Best qualified candidates must show experience in the following areas: 1) Experience with the procedures in transferring patients, ability to coordinate movements among supporting personnel, preparing appropriate paperwork, providing general information on applicable procedures, a basic knowledge of the medical facility and medical terminology. 2) Experience in performing admissions and disposition duties by interviewing patients being admitted and determining eligibility for treatment.  Typing - Any Grade: Qualified typist is required (40wpm).  GS-05: One year of experience directly related to the occupation and equivalent to the next lower grade level, or 4 years of higher education above high school, or a combination of experience and education.  The experience described in your resume will be evaluated and screened for the Office of Personnel Management's basic qualifications requirements, and the skills needed to perform the duties of this position as described in this vacancy announcement.  Applicants who have held a General Schedule (GS) position within the last 52 weeks must meet the Time in Grade Restriction.  Education can be substituted for experience. Review the qualification requirements for specific information.  One year of experience in the same or similar work equivalent to at least the next lower grade or level requiring application of the knowledge, skills, and abilities of the position being filled.  Must have 52 weeks of Federal service at the next lower grade (or equivalent).  Only degrees from an accredited college or university recognized by the Department of Education are acceptable to meet positive education requirements or to substitute education for experience. For additional information, please go to the Office of Personnel Management (OPM) and U.S. Department of Education websites at - http://www.opm.gov/qualifications and http://www.ed.gov/admins/finaid/accred/index.html  Ability to communicate orally and in writing.  Other Information: (Click on Other Information)  To successfully claim veteran's preference, your resume/supplemental data must clearly show your entitlement. Please review the information listed under the Other Requirements link on this announcement or review our on-line Job Application Kit.  May require shift work and/or work on rotating shifts to provide coverage on evenings, weekends, holidays and in other situations.  The Department of Defense (DoD) policy on employment of annuitants will be used in determining eligibility of annuitants. The DoD policy is available on  Salary includes applicable locality pay or Local Market Supplement.  In accordance with section 9902(h) of title 5, United States Code, annuitants reemployed in the Department of Defense shall receive full annuity and salary upon appointment. They shall not be eligible for retirement contributions, participation in the Thrift Savings Plan, or a supplemental or redetermined annuity for the reemployment period. Discontinued service retirement annuitants (i.e., retired under section 8336(d)(1) or 8414(b)(1)(A) of title 5, United States Code) appointed to the Department of Defense may elect to be subject to retirement provisions of the new appointment as appropriate. (See DoD Instruction 1400.25, Volume 300, at  .)  Special Note to NSPS Applicants: If you apply for and accept a GS position, your GS pay will be set differently than if you transition out of NSPS with your organization. If you apply for and accept a position and your pay cannot be set within the GS grade range, you will not be eligible for pay retention. Be sure to refer to the NSPS web site (  ) for more details on how this might affect your specific situation.  Payment of Permanent Change of Station (PCS) costs is not authorized, based on a determination that a PCS move is not in the Government interest.  Defense National Relocation Program will not be authorized.  Other Advantages: The city of Radcliff, outside the gates of Fort Knox, has a prosperous, diverse, and stable economy. Radcliff is at the geographic center of the Hardin County economy, between Fort Knox and Elizabethtown. Residents enjoy a low crime rate, good schools, short commutes, and a very low cost of living. The average commute to work in the county is fewer than 10 minutes. The military influence has created a very diverse and welcoming culture.  Other Requirements: (Click on Other Requirements) Personnel security investigation required.  This position has a mandatory seasonal influenza vaccination requirement and is therefore subject to annual seasonal influenza vaccinations. Applicants tentatively selected for appointment to this position will be required to sign a statement (Condition of Employment) consenting to seasonal influenza vaccinations.  You will be required to provide proof of U.S. Citizenship.  Male applicants born after December 31, 1959 must complete a Pre-Employment Certification Statement for Selective Service Registration.  Direct Deposit of Pay is Required.  Applicants claiming veteran's preference must clearly show an entitlement to such preference on the resume/supplemental data submitted.  Failure to provide all of the required information as stated in the vacancy announcement may result in an ineligible rating or may affect the overall rating.  One year trial/probationary period may be required.  How to Apply: (Click on How to Apply)  Resumes must be received by the closing date of this announcement.  Self-nomination must be submitted by the closing date. Applicants wishing to withdraw from consideration may contact the Central Resume Processing Center at (410) 306- 0137 or applicanthelp@conus.army.mil.  Resume must be on file in our centralized database.  Announcements close at 12:00am (midnight) Eastern Time.  If your resume is currently in our central database, you may click here to  Self Nominate Click here to use the  Army Resume Builder to create your resume. Follow the instructions in this vacancy announcement to apply for the job.  Point of Contact: Central Resume Processing Center, 410-306-0137, applicanthelp@conus.army.mil  THE DEPARTMENT OF DEFENSE IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

jobText: Jobs in Chicago Job Seekers: Home Chicago Jobs Part Time Jobs Job Resources Resume Posting Job Search Career Fairs Chicago Staffing Job Seekers: My CareerBuilder My CareerBuilder Post Resume Back to Search Results > >  Asset Manager  Hill-Rom Company Inc Learn more about this company > >  View all jobs at this company > >  Apply Now > >  Save it |  Email It |  Print it |  Follow Company |  Share with Facebook Friends Report It Job Snapshot  Location:  Chicago, IL 60646 ( Map it! )  Loading Map...  Employee Type:  Full-Time Industry:  Healthcare - Health Services Medical Equipment Other Great Industries Manages Others:  No Job Type:  Finance Inventory Management Education:  High School Experience:  Not Specified Post Date:  3/7/2011 Contact Information  Ref ID:  11-0317 Description  JOB SUMMARY: Manage daily operations of the AssetAdvantage program including staffing, scheduling, training, coordination of inventory management activities, and performance of utilization management data collection, reporting, and analysis. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES  Ensure complete scheduling and training of AssetAdvantage staff.  Ensure adherence to all established and documented Standard Operating Procedures for AssetAdvantage and Hill-Rom.  Follow national AssetAdvantage operational standards to manage customer's equipment inventory and ensure proper process and appropriate utilization levels.  Monitor and report daily and monthly performance metrics to leadership team and customer as required.  Monitoring and management of profit and loss for targeted financial goals for AssetAdvantage site(s).  Oversees, and participates in as necessary, oxygen tanks (site specific for tank programs) and/or equipment delivery to and retrieval from designated areas throughout the healthcare facility, as well as daily verification rounds and the performance of equipment decontamination procedures all in accordance with company and customer guidelines.  Utilize a PC based computer system to track equipment throughout the facility.  Facilitate effective and professional communication with company and customers' stake holders/personnel.  Provide education and in-service training on AssetAdvantage program to customer personnel as needed  Assists with projects, inventories, or other special requests as needed.  Demonstrates a pro-active approach towards safety and health in compliance with all company, governmental and customer regulations in the areas of HAZCOM, ECP/ICP, Joint Commission, HIPAA, substance abuse/drug free workplace, Standards of Ethical Business Conduct, back safety and patient transfer protocols and maintenance of a clean/safe work environment.  Participation in and completion of required safety meetings and medical testing for self and team.  Other duties may be assigned. SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES AND SITE ACCOUNTABILITY:  Responsibility for managing up to 15 (full-time equivalent) direct reports; and/or  Responsibility for overseeing up to two AssetAdvantage sites. QUALIFICATIONS:  Proven organizational skills, ability to multi-task and manage time effectively.  Ability to effectively communicate and present business reviews, departmental meetings, key metrics, and other reports as needed.  The demonstrated ability to make difficult staffing decisions based on the employee's performance.  The ability to perform all essential duties and responsibilities in safe and ethical manner.  Ability to comprehend company and customer guidelines for infection control.  Ability to write routine reports and correspondence.  An enthusiastic, positive work attitude capable of inspiring staff and fostering a team environment.  Exhibit a professional attitude and appearance, while conforming to both company and customer policies and procedures.  Ability to walk a minimum of seven miles per day.  Ability to lift a minimum of 60 lbs.  Ability to âtilt and roll' oxygen tanks on/off carts and staging areas (ranging from 9 lbs to 287 lbs). > job details Position/Title: Supply Chain Planning Analyst  Job Location: Napa, CA Job Category: Date Posted: Friday, July 8th Company: Treasury Wine Estates Type of Work: Full Time Visit Website: Description: So you want to be a Vintrepreneur? To work here you'll need to have an entrepreneurial spirit, a passion for wine and a commitment to being a global ambassador for all our treasured brands. As Vintrepreneurs, wine is our thing. We are all attracted to the opportunity to be part of a distinctly wine-driven culture, yet make our presence felt as individuals. And what makes us all the more special and super-charged about what we do, is that we can do it with a common understanding from different places; places we know and love, places we can feel in our bones and taste in our wines. The Supply Chain Planning Analyst will have a project focus concentrated in the following areas:  *The first is inventory planning for importation and distribution of finished goods using Manugistics planning systems.  *The second focus is the identification, reporting and management of high risk inventory stock in N. America for both imported and domestically produced goods.  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES & ACCOUNTABILITIES: *Responsible for finished goods availability and obsolescence (including new product or major product change transitions) for brands and locations as specified.  *Responsible for finished goods service levels for brands and locations as specified.  *Provide planning reports and coordinate supply meetings for specified channels.  *Manage planning system inputs/outputs to produce a replenishment plan to meet inventory stock targets for specific brands and locations.  *Evaluate and update distribution planning rules to optimize inventory levels, meet service levels, and minimize at risk inventory. *Identify, review, and communicate changes to vintage status. *Analyze and report out status and actions needed for at-risk inventory produced for N. America. Individuals performing the Distribution Planning and Inventory Analyst role will be assigned some or part of the specific role responsibilities listed. Specific Role Responsibilities: General Distribution Planning - *Manage integrity of advanced planning system (Manugistics) to create a 12 month bottling and inventory plan that minimizes the risk of stock-outs and obsolescence for domestic and import produced wines for N. America. *Create planning reports for supply meetings for Italian and New Zealand brands. *Drive lead time reduction strategies throughout the supply chain. *Develop processes to integrate and make visible the interdependencies between demand changes and the impact to the supply chain through to customer delivery in a third party logistics (3PL) distribution network. *Develop short term replenishment plan by vintage and load. *Identify and report any items at risk for service issues, high stock, or vintage alignment.  *Work with Brand Managers, Quality Assurance and Customer Service on any at risk issues.  *Coordinate set up any order placement for all new items or label transitions.  *Utilize advanced planning system (Manugistics) to create a 12 month distribution plan for forward warehouses (Bailment or 3PL). *Set up distribution planning rules to meet inventory objectives.  *Assist in development and implementation of DRP for Northern California multi-site distribution. *Monitor and manage vintage change to minimize freight costs and maximize customer service. *Develop distribution plan to support forward deployment of domestic inventory as needed. *Inventory Analysis of Inactive and At Risk Inventory. *Generate inventory reports for monthly supply scorecard and S& OP meetings as defined. *Lead bi-weekly meeting with Commercial Finance and Sales on Close out list. *Identification and coordination of at risk inventory for QA review.  *Develop process to identify high stock and obsolete inventory still at a current vintage status.  *Other duties as assigned.  QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE:  *BS degree in Business, Operations, Engineering or equivalent experience. *Application of Lean principles a plus. *Well-developed analytical, interpersonal, oral, written and problem-solving skills a necessity. *Ability to work well in a multi-task environment and within constraints of deadlines. *Extended hours (evenings, weekends) may be required. *Ability to contribute to a positive work atmosphere by communicating with clients, customers, co-workers and management according to established standards.  *Demonstrated super-user experience with Microsoft Office tools including Excel and Access. Access and Excel integration skills a plus. EXPERIENCE: *Three or more years of successful experience in supply chain; manufacturing/ consumer products experience required; wine experience a plus. *Previous experience in multi-functional teams critical. *Competency in enterprise software applications (JDE a plus). *Experience with supply chain planning or scheduling software application processes and principles. *Demonstrated experience with MRP/ DRP/ Planning software required. *Demonstrated experience with Microsoft Office tools TO APPLY: If you are interested in this position please apply online. Go to www.tweglobal.com to submit your resume or use the following link: https://secure.pageuppeople.com/apply/556/gateway/?c=apply& sJobIDs=741851& SourceTypeID=175& sLanguage=en Treasury Wine Estates is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer No relocation assistance is available for this position. No recruiters or phone calls, please. Search Jobs: Lead Mainframe Storage Engineer (Job Id  W535647 )  Posted on 2/17/2011 Location: Cincinnati, OH Job Type: Full Time Salary: Not specified Please apply as directed in job description. |  ShareThis Job Description GENERAL FUNCTION: Responsible for the analysis, installation, performance monitoring, capacity planning, modification and support of Large Scale Enterprise Mainframe Storage Environment. Function in Lead Engineering role in the research and implementation of new technologies and their potential match to business solutions. Follows corporate standards to implement storage solutions for IBM Mainframe platform systems. DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Maintain storage systems performance by pro-active monitoring, trending, and utilization of system resources.  Maintain system reliability and availability by managing system updates and patches. Function as a technical expert in problem resolution for mainframe storage infrastructure hardware and software issues. Assist with the design and management of the physical and logical configuration of all systems storage. Plays a key role as an individual contributor on projects of a moderate to high level of complexity. Perform a lead role in the development, planning, preparation and ongoing disaster recovery readiness. Maintain appropriate controls and documentation to ensure compliance of audit requirements and qualifications. Work closely with other IT departmental staff, Network, NOC, Facilities, Systems Engineering to coordinate efforts and maintain high level of customer satisfaction ? both internal and external. Responsible for systems performance and resolution of production incidents, which may require 27 hr/day and/or 7-day/week on-call coverage. Assumes additional responsibilities as assigned. SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES: None. KNOWLEDGE amp; SKILLS REQUIRED: Bachelor?s degree in Computer Science/Information Systems or comparable experience. At least seven years of experience with Mainframe Storage Systems. Experience with enterprise storage arrays, EMC, and IBM. Experience with Mainframe storage tools/software, such as SMS, FDR, TDMF, etc. Experience with disaster recovery methodologies and data replication technologies. Experience with disaster recovery methodologies and data replication technologies, such as SRDF. Experience with Replication Switch Administration a plus. Must have excellent verbal and written communication skills. Job Description » Return to Search Results Title General Service Technician Description The General Service associate is responsible for being able to professionally do non-technical automotive service repairs while ensuring Goodyear's high customer satisfaction levels are achieved. The General Service associate performs all tire and wheel related services while following Goodyear's " Good to Go Policy" . In addition, the General Service associate maintains cleaning and maintenance in the service department, showroom, exterior of building and tire racks. All work must be performed according to Goodyear's policies and procedures. The General Service Technician must complete all projects as assigned by Manager.  Requirements High School Diploma or GED preferred Valid driver's license is required Must be at least 18 years old Ability to lift an object weighing up to 60 pounds. Tasks Drive customers vehicle onto hoist or jack in preparation for removing wheels from vehicle or fitting new tire to wheel. Includes test driving cars to diagnose problems. Follow established processes in performing Goodyear's standardized Vehicle Maintenance Inspection. Performs non technical automotive services on automobiles using Goodyear's policies and training. Uses Protective Safety Equipment when operating machine and manual working tools and ensuring that the environment is safe for self and for other associates working. Maintains standards in the area of sales, service, safety and housekeeping. Housekeeping in the service area, tire racks, front store area and outside the building to maintain a clean and inviting location. Provide customer service to both internal and external customers. Duties and Responsibilities: * Assess the completeness, accuracy and appropriateness of Purchase Proposals submitted for processing, determine credit worthiness for financed purchases and accept/process deposit payments. * Perform data entry of owner, inventory, finance and deposit info, as indicated on purchase proposal and in accordance with business rules, to produce a document set suitable for signature(s). * Assist/Support Sales Team and Managers with questions regarding Contract files and business rules. * Responsible for reviewing and knowing the Sale Authorization Chart listings, financial charts and price sheets as changes occur. * Participate and assist in training exercises. * Responsible for monitoring stock levels and/or supplies for the site and assist with the ordering of supplies. i.e. Owner Bags and Handbooks, II Books, CD ROMs, file folders, office supplies, toner, paper, labels, etc. * Audit executed contract file documents to ensure information contained on the documents match Purchase Proposal and SUN System. Audit file for consistency of signatures throughout. Prepare files for submittal to audit team according to file Prep Checklist(s). * Perform daily closing procedures according to site specific closing checklist and in accordance with policy. * Perform other related duties as assigned. Key Relationships: Service to the needs of the sales staff and sales management is a daily working relationship. Expect communication directly with owners when notarizing documents, answering incoming telephone calls and clarifying information related to a purchase. Qualifications WORKING CONDITIONS, HAZARDS AND PHYSICAL DEMANDS: Document Processor may work between multiple sales centers. Should be able to lift a 10 pound box and operate a fully loaded hand cart. Climbing of stairs at some locations may be necessary to get to Contract office. The Document Processor should be able to sit comfortably in front of a computer for up to 4 hours. EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE, KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES: * High School Diploma * Typing 40 to 55 words per minute with above 95% accuracy * Attention to detail * Able to operate efficiently in a high paced / high demand office * 2+ years of administrative experience in related field * Proven experience handling multiple tasks * Excellent oral communication skills * Customer Service LICENSING AND CERTIFICATION: * Notary commission required - may be obtained post employment within a reasonable time frame. Search Results Security Officer P/T 12:30pm to 12:30 Sat / Sun Hunt Valley Tell A Friend Apply Online Job Code: 73588-511291 Location: Hunt Valley, MD Shift: Part Time  AlliedBarton Security Services is the industry s premier provider of highly trained security personnel to many industries including commercial real estate, higher education, healthcare, residential communities, chemical/petrochemical, government, manufacturing and distribution, financial institutions, and shopping centers. Our more than 50,000 employees and 100 offices across the country service a client base of several thousand which includes approximately 200 Fortune 500 companies nationwide. AlliedBarton is headquartered in  Conshohocken ,  PA , and has been American owned and managed since 1957. As the first security services company selected as one of  Training magazine s Top 125 training companies for six consecutive years, AlliedBarton offers on-the-job, web-based, and ongoing training programs for all personnel from security officers through executive level management. Our commitment to training includes industry specific programs that are customized for the security challenges in several of the markets we serve. AlliedBarton s focus on Human Capital Management moves employee growth and satisfaction to the forefront of all company initiatives. By utilizing employee retention programs and promotions from within, AlliedBarton is able to foster a culture of quality security officers and continuous customer satisfaction. AlliedBarton security officers adhere to quality standards designed to provide unparalleled service. Our security officers are proactive, responsive and ready to meet our client s needs. Patrol facility or man post as instructed and serve as a general security presence and visible deterrent to crime and client rule infractions; detect suspicious activities and watch for criminal acts or client rule infractions at or near assigned post which may be a threat to the property, client or employees at the site. Report all incidents, accidents or medical emergencies. Respond to emergencies, such as medical and bomb threats; and to alarms, such as fire and intrusion by following emergency response proceedings.  Security Officer Basic Qualifications:  Must be at least 18 years of age or older as required by applicable law or contractual requirements. Must have a high school diploma or GED, or at least 10 years of verifiable employment history. At least one verifiable employer.  No criminal convictions as specified under AlliedBarton guidelines. Ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing in the English language for the purpose of public interaction and report writing. Authorized to work in the United States. Ability to perform essential functions of the position with or without reasonable accommodation. Negative result on pre-employment drug screen. Successful completion of AlliedBarton s Security Officer Basic Course exam.  Ability to maintain satisfactory attendance and punctuality standard. Neat and professional appearance. Friendly and professional demeanor.  Ability to provide quality customer service. Ability to handle typical and crisis situations efficiently and effectively at client site. We offer an attractive compensation package including competitive hourly wage, benefits, training and opportunities for advancement. AlliedBarton is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/D/V. jobText: DIRECTOR OF COMMUNICATIONS Elizabethtown College is seeking an experienced communications/ marketing professional to fill the Director of Communications role. Articulating the brand of Elizabethtown College through collaborative work with colleagues will be the primary focus of this position. The incumbent will serve as the editor of official College publications and will be the primary contact for the College's newspaper. Developing a proactive media strategy, while measuring media effectiveness, is a responsibility of this position. This is a collaborative role working closely with the other members of the office of marketing and communications to promote effective communication strategies. Candidates must have a bachelor's degree; plus eight to ten years of experience in communications. Previous experience in higher education communication and/or marketing is preferred. Candidates for this position must have strong time management, prioritization and collaboration skills and should be able to complete projects on time and within budget. Previous experience managing an expert's list or speaker's bureau is preferred. The ability to strategically pitch stories to national and local media is necessary; previous experience managing a publication and editorial board is helpful. The ability to collaborate with other members of the campus community is necessary; we are seeking an individual with a strong background in communications to bring to Elizabethtown. Located in southeastern Pennsylvania, Elizabethtown College offers its 1,900 students more than 47 academic programs in the liberal arts, sciences and professional studies. Driven by its commitment to Educate for Service, Elizabethtown centers learning in strong relationships, links classroom instruction with experiential learning, emphasizes international and cross-cultural perspectives and nurtures the capacity for lives of purpose and leadership as global citizens. For more information, consult www.etown.edu To apply, candidates should send a letter of interest, employment application (found at www.etown.edu/humanresources - Job Opportunities), resume, writing samples (three news writing samples and one feature writing sample) and contact information of three references to: hr@etown.edu (preferred) -OR- Elizabethtown College Attn: Human Resources One Alpha Drive Elizabethtown, PA 17022 For more information visit: www.etown.edu/humanresources Application deadline: April 8, 2011 As an affirmative action/equal opportunity employer, Elizabethtown College is seeking candidates who will enhance the diversity of its faculty, staff, and administration. Description: - Administrative Assistant* (SLH-1101193) Job Description SLH-1101193 Administrative Assistant* Description Sutter Lakeside Hospital is a 25-bed critical access hospital serving the health care needs of residents of Lake County and its surrounding communities. Our beautifully landscaped campus houses medical-surgical beds, an intensive care unit and a 29,000 square foot state-of-the-art emergency room and surgical center. Other specialized are services are offered through our Family Birth Center, Physical Therapy Center, and Family Medicine Clinic. Provides professional administrative support services to the CAO. This includes working on special projects and assignments in a self-directed manner, maintaining a high level of confidentiality of information. Schedule and/or attend numerous meetings including document preparation, transcription, and related follow-up. Assists the CAO in maintaining a high level of responsiveness and maintains a communication network between the organization, medical staff, all nursing units, vendors, consultants, and the community. This position also coordinates communication between multiple departments throughout the facility to ensure cooperative and collaborative relationships and to promote teamwork to achieve organization and department patient, employee and physician satisfaction goals. Qualifications High school graduation or equivalent; A.A. degree with related course in business skills preferred. Prior office experience is required, preferably within the healthcare setting, with a demonstrated ability to positively handle public contacts and effectively maintain an office work flow system with rapidly changing priorities. Prior secretarial experience strongly preferred, as is exposure to human resources programs and services. Ability to type 50 wpm is required as is operation of word-processing systems. Advanced level skills in Microsoft (Word, Excel, Outlook) is required; experience with PowerPoint is highly desireable. Skill in operating data bases is highly desirable. Primary Location : California-North Coast-Lakeport Organization : Sutter Lakeside Hospital, Lakeport Employee Status : Regular Accepted Applications : All Candidates Accepted Benefits : Yes Position Status : Non-Exempt Union : No Job Shift : Day Shift Hours - 8 Hour Shift Days of the Week Scheduled : Varied Days Shift Start Time : 8:30 Shift End Time : 17:00 Schedule : Full Time Hours Per 2wk Pay Period : 80 Send this job to a friend Send this job description to a friend by email. Our direct client is seeking a Senior Informatica ETL Developer for an immediate contract-to-hire opening. The client is looking to interview and on-board a qualified resource ASAP, and subsequently convert this resource to full-time within a 90-day period. This person will be part of the team that supports a growing Data Warehousing and Business Intelligence environment using Informatica, Oracle 11g/10g RDBMS, Oracle ODI, SQL Server 2005/2008, and Microsoft SSIS. This individual will be responsible for the following: * Develop data profiling and quality assessment processes * Develop data filtering, transformation and loading requirements * Determine appropriate translations between source data and target databases * Capture metadata as it pertains to sources and targets * Load and transform data from data sources into target databases * Design and implement appropriate error handling procedures * Develop project, documentation and storage standards in conjunction with data architects * Monitor performance, troubleshoot and tune ETL processes as appropriate Qualifications: Minimum of 7-10 years experience in the architecture, design and development of ETL programs using Informatica's data integration tools;  Expert knowledge of Informatica version 8.5 and above;  Minimum 2 full lifecycle project experience with small development groups, e.g., leading ground up development of Informatica standards in one or more previous projects.  Demonstrated ability to navigate through organizational and technical uncertainty  Mastery of Unix concepts and commands, including process management, directory structures, file permissions and editors  Solid background in Oracle database 9i, 10g or 11g  Stored procedure development experience  Solid experience building SQL queries, including creating sub-queries, minus/union, and inline queries  Fluency with business concepts related to relational and dimensional data models  Excellent oral and written communication skills  BA/BS in computer science or equivalent experience  Experience with one or more scripting languages: perl, shell, awk, sed, etc  Experience with other relational databases including MS SQL Server 2005/2008 and Informix Candidates will be asked to provide samples of technical documentation that they have created, as well as provide salary history. The hiring manager will be conducting initial phone screens and subsequently interview candidates in-person before an offer is extended. For immediate consideration please submit your resume in Word format, along with daytime contact information.  Client is unable to provide H-1B Visa sponsorship at this time. All submittals will be treated confidentially. Selected candidate may be asked to pass a comprehensive background, credit and/or drug screening. Principals only, no third parties please. Atrilogy Solutions Group, Inc. was established in 1998 to provide information technology (IT) and business process consulting services. Our focus areas include: Enterprise Resource Planning (Lawson, Oracle, SAP) Healthcare IT Consulting (Epic, Cerner, McKesson, Allscripts, Meditech)  Custom Solutions Contract IT Staffing (Project Managers, Business Analysts, DBAs, Developers, Quality Assurance and Testing, Software Configuration Management etc.)  Atrilogy supplies project management, functional and technical consulting within each of these lines of business. We are capable of delivering complete projects or providing supplemental resources for customer-driven projects. Loading Map...  )  Employee Type:  Full-Time Industry:  Insurance Manages Others:  No Job Type:  Insurance Education:  4 Year Degree Experience:  At least 8 year(s) Post Date:  5/13/2011 Contact Information  Contact:  Donna Hart Phone:  401-946-2310 Fax:  401-528-1350  instantly fax your resume > >  Description  Responsible for oversight of the underwriting function and for coordination with other AIPSO departments. Manage and perform complex underwriting duties in accordance with CAIP procedures and related duties under the direct supervision of the Director. Provide leadership and expertise to underwrite the largest and most complex policy applications, renewals, repricings, restrictions and cancellations to determine risk acceptability and coverage. Reviews underwriting guidelines and procedures and provides final approval .  Requirements  Education : Bachelor’s degree from a 4 year college with supplementary insurance education preferred.
