Job Announcement DEPARTMENT OF THE ARMY Vacancy Announcement Number:  NEAI11067341 Opening Date:  May 20, 2011 Closing Date:  June 03, 2011 Position: Air Conditioning Equipment Mechanic (VARIOUS SHIFTS), WG-5306-10 Salary: $20.90 - $24.41 Hourly Place of Work:  Tobyhanna Army Depot, Dir/Systems Integration & Support, Integration Support Div, Environmental Control Unit Br, Tobyhanna, PA 18466 Position Status:  This is a Permanent position. -- Full Time  Number of Vacancy: FEW Duties: You will perform a full range of work involved in the repair, overhaul, modification, maintenance and servicing of a variety of mobile related reach-in refrigerators; cold storage and cold room equipment; freezers, water coolers, dehumidifiers; & conditioning units and systems; air conditioning heaters; and ventilating systems and related equipment. Diagnose and locate malfunctions; disassemble, repair, replace and/or adjust the more complex problems with more extensive repairs to compressors, thermostats, pressurestats, humistats, relays, switches, evaporators, condensers receivers and automatic control devices. Modify, fabricate and install parts; works in accordance with technical manuals and specifications as required.  About the Position: THIS POSITION REQUIRES TRAVEL WORLDWIDE OVER 50% OF THE TIME IN SUPPORT OF THE MOBILE DEPOT MAINTENANCE MISSION. Tobyhanna Army Depot is the largest, full-service electronics maintenance facility in the Department of Defense with a total installation work force of more than 5,000. The depot's mission includes design, manufacture, repair and overhaul of hundreds of electronic systems for all branches of the Armed Forces. They include satellite terminals, radio and radar systems, secure communications, electro-optics, night vision and anti-intrusion devices, airborne surveillance equipment, navigational instruments, electronic warfare, and guidance and control systems for tactical missiles. For over 50 years, Tobyhanna personnel have built a tradition of unparalleled customer satisfaction through the delivery of timely, cost-effective, and high-quality products and services. Located in Northeastern Pennsylvania, near Stroudsburg, Scranton and Wilkes-Barre.  Who May Apply: (Click on Who May Apply)  Current Army employees with competitive status (includes Army employees serving on a career or career-conditional appointment).  Qualifications: Click on link below to view qualification standard.  Trades and Labor Qualified candidates for this position must show in their resume the ability to do the work of an Air Conditioning Equipment Mechanic without more than normal supervision (SCREEN OUT).  Your resume must indicate your overall, knowledge, experience, training and education (as stated in the major duties paragraph of this announcement) to independently perform the work of an Air Conditioning Equipment Mechanic. Resumes will be reviewed for dated detailed experience/training which provided knowledge of equipment assembly, installation and repair, etc.; technical practices of the trade (theoretical, precise, artistic); the ability to interpret instructions, specification, etc. (includes blueprinting reading); the ability to use and maintain tools and equipment; knowledge of materials; and troubleshooting.  PHYSICAL EFFORT: Frequently works in awkward positions, cramped are or hard to reach places. Work involves frequent bending, reaching, crouching, standing and arm movement. Mechanic carries and sets up parts and equipment that weigh up to 50 pounds. Often lifts and moves heavier items with the assistance of other workers and lifting devices such as hoists, pulleys or cranes.  WORKING CONDITIONS Work is performed inside and occasionally outside; shop area is heated and adequately ventilated; floors are concrete and grease, dirt and dampness is frequently encountered; area is noisy; variable temperatures occur when working in cold storage areas. Subject to possible injuries such as strains, sprains, cuts, bruises and electrical shock from hand and machine tools and dropped units end equipment. Frequent exposure to refrigerant gases end exhaust fumes; Follows numerous safety procedures and is required to wear protective gloves, goggles, mask, ear plugs, shoes or other safety clothing and equipment appropriate for the position.  CONDITIONS OF EMPLOYMENT: Employee must obtain and maintain an EPA Universal Refrigerant Certification within 6 months.  Experience and training that furnish the knowledges, skills, and abilities needed to perform the duties of this position consistent with accepted practices of the trade. Ability to use and maintain appropriate tools and equipment. Ability to read, understand, and apply instruction and other materials related to the job.  Ability to do the work of the position under normal supervision.  Other Information: (Click on Other Information)  Temporary Duty (TDY) travel is 50 percent.  Permanent Change of Station (PCS) allowances may be authorized, subject to the provisions of the Joint Travel Regulations and an agency determination that a PCS move is in the Government interest.  Other Advantages: This job provides an excellent opportunity to make a positive contribution to the U.S. Army vision.  Other Requirements: (Click on Other Requirements) Personnel security investigation required.  A medical examination is required.  The Department of the Army provides reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application and hiring process, please notify the servicing civilian personnel unit. Requests for reasonable accommodation are made on a case-by-case basis.  You will be required to provide proof of U.S. Citizenship.  License/Certification: within 6 months: EPA Universal Refrigerant Cert.  Male applicants born after December 31, 1959 must complete a Pre-Employment Certification Statement for Selective Service Registration.  Direct Deposit of Pay is Required.  Position requires employee to wear a uniform and/or protective clothing.  One year trial/probationary period may be required.  How to Apply: (Click on How to Apply)  Resumes must be received by the closing date of this announcement.  Self-nomination must be submitted by the closing date. Applicants wishing to withdraw from consideration may contact the Central Resume Processing Center at (410) 306- 0137 or applicanthelp@conus.army.mil.  Resume must be on file in our centralized database.  Announcements close at 12:00am (midnight) Eastern Time.  If your resume is currently in our central database, you may click here to  Self Nominate Click here to use the  Army Resume Builder to create your resume. Follow the instructions in this vacancy announcement to apply for the job.  Point of Contact: Central Resume Processing Center, 410-306-0137, applicanthelp@conus.army.mil  THE DEPARTMENT OF DEFENSE IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

jobText: Home News Headlines Jobs by Location Jobs by Title Jobs by Company Today's Jobs Post Resume Employers what in  All Locations Alaska Alabama Arkansas Arizona California Colorado Connecticut District of Columbia Delaware Florida Georgia Hawaii Iowa Idaho Illinois Indiana Kansas Kentucky Louisiana Massachusetts Maryland Maine Michigan Minnesota Missouri Mississippi Montana North Carolina North Dakota Nebraska New Hampshire New Jersey New Mexico Nevada New York Ohio Oklahoma Oregon Pennsylvania Puerto Rico Rhode Island South Carolina South Dakota Tennessee Texas Utah Virginia Vermont Washington Wisconsin West Virginia Wyoming Research Associate I -Genetic Analysis Platform Job  Company -  Broad Institute Location -  Cambridge ,  Massachusetts US Job Code -  500 Position -  Full Time - Regular Job First Active on:  Tuesday, March 08, 2011 Research Associate I -Genetic Analysis Platform Overall Responsibility To join a high-throughput team actively involved in targeted high-throughput gene expression studies. Performs bench level experiments to assist with projects aimed at managing the Expression Platformâs technical processes in order to ensure the output of high quality RNA profiling data. Responsibilities will include setting up chemistry reactions using robots, monitoring quality control of reactions, and reporting weekly summaries of lab observations and empirical data. Will employ a variety of genomic techniques, including RNA handling, preparation and storage of RT and PCR reactions and operation of various liquid handling devices and sensitive laser scanners. The work relies heavily on laboratory automation, UI interaction, databases, and SOPs. The role is part of a fast-paced team environment and work must ensure support of current team goals and practices by producing high-quality genetic data, active involvement in troubleshooting experiments, maintenance of a notebook and daily tracking sheets, and data file management. Characteristic Duties â¢Conducts various bench level experiments to support the goals of the Genetic Analysis Platform. â¢Operates and maintains laboratory equipment to complete investigations. â¢Prepares, orders, and maintains stocks of necessary reagents, solutions and supplies â¢Documents, compiles and analyzes experimental data. Reports data in oral and written reports. â¢Attends team meetings for experimental planning. â¢Assists with calculations and assists in preparing graphic displays of data as part of data analysis. â¢Maintains and improves technical knowledge base. â¢Other related tasks as required. REQUIREMENTS - QUALIFICATIONS:  Research Associate I -Genetic Analysis Platform Qualifications â¢Bachelorâs degree in Biology or related field required and at least one year of lab experience with genomic technologies and analysis preferred or equivalent combination of education and experience. â¢Familiarity of basic laboratory techniques and principles of molecular biology required; some research experience in addition to degree-related lab work preferred. â¢Hands-on experience with liquid handling automation and integration preferred. â¢Solid knowledge of computers and experience with Excel and databases required. â¢Excellent organizational, time management, and written and verbal communication skills required. â¢Must be able to juggle several tasks at once and thrive in a fast-paced environment. â¢Must be able to work independently, using sound judgment to handle a variety of tasks and effectively solve problems with minimal supervision and work as part of a team. Broad will not offer visa sponsorship for this opportunity Broad Institute Back To Results Apply to this job! the  smart solution for Houston jobs Manager of Markt Risk Location:  Houston Posted on:  August 20, 2011 Share this job on Facebook Job Description:  Title: Manager of Markt Risk Location: TX-Houston * Manage the quantitative analysis to assist trading and management decisions including the pricing of structured transactions, and the development and implementation of new models. Oversee the design pricing, hedging, trading, and risk management models. * Advise senior management on risk quantification and mitigation utilizing variety of tools and resources, pricing of complex transactions imbedded options(i.e. Storage, Transportation, Asset Management), and hedging strategies to assure appropriate risk adjusted gross margin. * Advise business units and the IT group on data architecture, analytical solutions, operations, and market risk.  * Validate and test the Deal Capture System to ensure accurate position reporting as well as develop and implement business processes for system users. * Select, develop, and implement risk management systems (valuation, Value-at-Risk, scenario analysis, stress testing) to assure accurate deal capture and information flow throughout all departments.  * Author and enforce risk policies including volumetric and quantitative limits.  * Manage middle office audits and applicable compliance programs.  * Advanced degree (PhD/MBA/MS) in Statistics, Economics, Engineering, Math, or related field preferred, with some advanced finance education required. * 5 years experience; 3 years in the energy field with financial engineering experience. * Must possess strong decision making, personnel management, mathematical and technology skills. * Advanced knowledge of the fundamentals of the energy markets in North America with a focus on natural gas. * Knowledge of physical commodities, financial products, derivatives valuation (options and swaps), transportation and storage asset valuation and hedging and trading strategies. * Excellent written and organizational skills with the ability to verbally communicate clearly and concisely to all levels of personnel. * Possess an understanding of market risk measurement: VaR, option pricing, sensitivity and stress testing. the  smart solution for Houston jobs RN Case Manager Location:  Houston Posted on:  June 15, 2011 Share this job on Facebook Job Description:  RN Case Manager-00417-31011 Primary Location: United States-Texas-Houston Job: Case Management Schedule: Full-time The RN Case Manager works with physicians and other members of the multidisciplinary team to develop a plan for each patient from admission to discharge. The tasks and responsibilities include: * Performs continuous assessments and evaluations to ensure patient is progressing towards desired outcomes. * Assesses and responds to patient/family needs by coordinating efforts of other team members. * Identifies and resolves barriers that hinder effective patient care. * Collaborates and consults with physicians on patient--s progress and discharge planning needs. * Performs utilization review ensuring admissions meet criteria for appropriateness of care and medical necessity. * Manages the process to review and, as appropriate, appeal denials received from payors. * Coordinates the discharge planning process ensuring involvement of all members of the healthcare team. Counsels with patients and family members in decision making and in meeting psycho social needs of the patient. * Maintains knowledge of resources and facilities available to patients and family members. * Collaborates with personnel at other facilities to coordinate smooth and effective patient transfers and transitions. * Compiles, evaluates, and reports statistics to members of the team and utilizes the information to facilitate process improvement activities. * Provides age and culturally appropriate care. * Orients and mentors new staff members. * Follows Standard Precautions using personal protective equipment as required. Required Job Qualifications include: * Current licensure as an RN. * Graduate of an accredited school of professional nursing. Bachelors of Science in Nursing preferred. * CCM preferred. * Minimum 5 years of clinical nursing experience. * Knowledge of CMS guidelines and experience working with payor specific guidelines and contractual rules preferred. * Customer service abilities including effective listening skills. * Critical thinking skills, decisive judgment and the ability to work with minimal supervision meeting firm deadlines. * Assertive and persuasive communication skills, action oriented. jobText: Category  ALL JOBS/NURSING  Location  Albany  Work Status  Full Time  RN Cardiac Care Unit (tele)- FT daysHR:12382  Description  RN Cardiac Care Unit - Full time days, 8 or 12 hour shifts.  The Coronary Care Unit is a 36 bed unit providing both critical care and telemetry services for cardiac patients. Services provided include inpatient comprehensive care to a population consisting primarily of CHF, MI, unstable angina, syncope, cardiac dysrhythmias, drug toxicity, pulmonary edema, and patients undergoing cardiac procedures such as cardiac catheterization, PCI, EPS, ablation, elective cardioversion, pacemaker and AICD insertion. In addition, the critical care beds beds serve patients who are hemodynamically unstable, those requiring short-term hemodialysis or plasmapheresis and multiple drug therapies. Utilizing the patient focused care model, most patients remain on the unit from admission to discharge. Nurses working in cardiac critical care have the support of regional critical care courses, on-site BLS and ACLS classes, and comprehensive orientation developed by clinical nurse specialists in cardiac critical care nursing. Our clinical ladder program provides the opportunity for professional growth through mentoring, opportunities for leadership, and generous educational funding.  At St. Peter's, we recognize that nursing is one of the most challenging careers¿and the most rewarding. We work with nurses to ensure that their professional experiences meet the expectations they had when they chose nursing. From its earliest days in 1869, St. Peter's has put nurses at the heart of the institution's operation and administration. We recognize the crucial role you play in the care of every patent treated, and we have worked hard to ensure that you find the professional culture, the career support, the medical resources and the career opportunities you're seeking. YOU belong at St. Peter's Hospital - a nationally acclaimed center of cardiac excellence. Solucient has recognized the STAFF of St. Peter's by awarding Top 100 Hospital status several times AND Top 100 Cardiovascular Hospital status for 7 years in a row. Health Grades has given the St. Peter's cardiac programs 5 STARS. And better yet, the STAFF has voted St. Peter's the best employer in the region.

Employment Listings Kindergarten Teacher  Tracking Code  310-269  Job Description  Merryhill School teachers create, manage and participate in a variety of learning environments and activities that provide opportunities for students to develop to their fullest potential and achieve their learning objectives. Participate collaboratively and professionally with other faculty and staff to promote the general well-being of the school, and collective/ individual interest of its staff and student body. Promote professional learning through self-assessment, reflection on practice and professional conversations. Required Skills  - Formalize lesson plans weekly for upcoming instructional period; modify, as needed. - Relate instructional objectives to elementary curriculum standards and demonstrate effective decision-making concerning instructional goals. - Determine students'' performance using informal and formal testing and observation, when appropriate. - Develop and implement an appropriate classroom management system. - Aid students in developing self-confidence and a positive self-image. - Effectively implements elementary curriculum content, standards, and teaching methodologies including technology. - Prepare students for lessons by reviewing, outlining and explaining objectives. - Present lessons in a clear, well-organized and logical structure, embracing enthusiasm and optimism. - Use a variety of instructional materials such as contextual, supplemental, teacher-constructed, teaching bulletin boards, audio-visual, hands-on, discovery and activity-based learning. - Reflect an attitude that values diversity. - Provide for varied levels of student performance including multi-level teaching and accommodations, when appropriate. - Awareness of student''s emotional, social and educational needs. - Use results of formal testing and a variety of other assessments to evaluate student progress and instructional effectiveness, as required. Required Experience  EXPERIENCE & CREDENTIALS: - Bachelor''s degree in Elementary Education or equivalent.  - Teacher credential as specified under state regulations.  - Advanced degree in education preferred. - Previous teaching experience preferred. - Demonstrated knowledge of and proficiency with technology and commitment to the unique role it plays in the educational arena of the 21st Century. COMMUNICATION & INTERPERSONAL SKILLS: - Exhibits strong interpersonal and communication skills.  - Utilizes technology to effectively communicate with staff, parents and the administrative team. Stroke Neurologist position. An outstanding medical center is seeking a Neurologist who is Fellowship-trained in Cerebrovascular Disease; Neurologic Critical Care is a plus. The ideal candidate will assume the role of Medical Director and is expected to grow this Joint Commission-certified Stroke Center into a comprehensive cerebrovascular center. This state-of-the-art Stroke Center is equipped with the necessary diagnostic tools to quickly assess brain aneurysms, strokes, hemorrhages and other neurological disorders. Currently, the multidisciplinary team includes neurology, neurosurgery, vascular surgery, neuroradiology, interventional radiology and neurointerventional radiology. The area offers excellent schools, affordable homes, and many recreation and social amenities, and is within driving distance of Philadelphia, PA, New York City, and Washington, DC. Job Description Residential Skills Specialist-Relief March 9, 2011 Residential Skills Specialist-Relief Rosemont Treatment Center and School On Call Swing Shift SEIU Represented Reference Job Code: RSS-REL-150 To Apply Please follow Application Procedures POSITION SUMMARY: RSS I and RSS II positions are responsible for providing Dialectical Behavior Therapy (DBT) psychosocial skills training and providing care and close, intensive supervision to all clients. RSS I and RSS II may also be approved and authorized to deliver alcohol & drug group educational services. EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE REQUIRED: Bachelor's degree in a social service, mental health, discipline or CADCI Certificate preferred.  Work experience in related field preferred (i.e., shelter, residential or day treatment, counseling, substance abuse treatment, etc.).  Prior experience working with at-risk female adolescents preferred.  KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES REQUIRED: Must value working in a multicultural/diverse environment.  Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing, with a broad variety of individuals and in a wide variety of circumstances. This includes appropriate communication with clients, families, co-workers, supervisors, other service providers, and management staff and includes ability to use tact, discretion and judgment in interactions with others.  Demonstrated understanding, interpretation and implementation of child/adolescent development and treatment principles, models, concepts and theories.  Demonstrated ability to accurately read, record and interpret information.  Demonstrated ability to work effectively on multiple projects, including prioritizing and bringing them to a timely completion.  Ability to provide auditory and visual supervision of clients.  High level of attention to detail and ability to work independently using discretionary judgment within program guidelines/protocols.  Ability to work effectively as part of a team and individually.  Ability to maintain appropriate professional boundaries in working and interacting with others and in handling confidential information.  Ability to effectively monitor safety and demonstrate group management skills and effectively de-escalate potentially chaotic or volatile situations. This includes ability to interpret behaviors and attitudes of children and adolescents and also includes ability to provide crisis-intervention up to and including physical restraint.  Ability to regularly attend and be punctual for scheduled work shifts and be in a condition suitable for assuming responsibilities of position.  Manual dexterity allowing for performance of routine office functions, including faxing, copying, phone use, computer use, etc.  Manual dexterity allowing for performance of routine safety functions, including use of fire extinguishers, shut-off valves, etc.  Physical dexterity permitting bending, lifting, stooping, kneeling and performance of physical restraint of adolescent females up to 50 pounds.  OTHER REQUIREMENTS: Must pass criminal history background check.  Standard First-Aid/CPR Certification required.  Individuals providing drug and alcohol services who are recovering from a substance abuse related disorder must be able to demonstrate continuous sobriety under nonresidential, independent living conditions for the immediate past two years per OAR Standards for Outpatient and Residential Alcohol and Drug Treatment Programs.  Driving for work purposes is not a requirement of this position. However, if employee does drive personal vehicle for any work-related purpose, a valid driver's license for state of residency is required, as well as personal auto liability coverage and a driving record permitting coverage under the corporate auto liability policy.  COMPENSATION: $10.92 per hour APPLICATION PROCEDURE: Email a cover letter and resume to  and reference job code "RSS-REL-150" in the subject line of your email and in your cover letter.  Alternative: Fax your cover letter/resume to Morrison Child and Family Services at (503)736-9759 and put "RSS-REL-150" on your fax cover letter.  To be considered for this position you must follow this application procedure and you must meet all position qualifications/requirements. NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE. Position Summary This is a great opportunity for candidates with a strong consulting and technical background to work in a rapidly growing, fast paced environment. The Consultant reports to the SVP, Global Services Group. Responsibilities The Consultant is responsible for the following: Proficiency in Day software based solutions & technologies Deliver high quality consulting services to our growing client base and be an ambassador in our client relationships Provide input into estimating engagement activities Document knowledge and best practices with clients, partners and colleagues via direct interaction and Day communities Understand the client's technical environment and how they use Day technology in order to provide the best, focused advice, and ensure this information gets stored in Day's client data center Efficiently analyze project issues related to the work you have completed, identify the possible solution options, and work with team members to present and review those options and our recommended solution with the client Proactively maintain the desired level of technical expertise by staying current on Day technologies through internally and externally available learning opportunities as applicable as well as self-study Demonstrate an efficient, effective and timely approach to consistently expand the list of offerings and services you can deliver Must be willing and able to travel extensively and regularly (up to 75%) within the US with possible travel oversees at times Requirements A Bachelors degree in Computer Science or Engineering plus 2-3 years experience in the Web and/or ECMS technologies and 2-3 years of direct client consulting experience Participate in discussions on technical solutions and how they can solve client business problems to both technical and non-technical audiences Conceptually understand business requirements, their associated design and the development activities for Web based solutions Delivery utilizing a standardized methodology and consistent deliverable generation Debugging and appropriate debugging tools usage skills in general TCP/IP networking, UNIX and/or Windows NT/2000 Operating system, HTTP protocol and request processing, SMTP, etc. Knowledge in at least one of the current SQL dialects Knowledge in HTML, DHTML, CSS, etc. Knowledge in XML and related technologies, e.g. definition and interpretation (and occasionally, up to 55 lbs.) from floor level to above shoulder height; must be able to meet demands of frequent walking, standing, stooping, kneeling, climbing, pushing, pulling, and repetitive lifting, with or without reasonable accommodation. Availability: Ability to work flexible, full-time schedule to include days, evenings, weekends and holidays. Skills & Competencies: Customer Focus, Results Driven, Strong Organizational Skills, Communication Skills, Problem Solving/Decision Making, Job Knowledge and Relationship Management. General Summary : As a Family Dollar Store Manager in Training you will be responsible for providing exceptional customer service while assisting the Training Manager in the daily operation of a retail store. Under the direction, training and observation of the Training Manager, the Store Manager in Training (SMIT) maintains inventories, store appearance and completes daily paperwork. The Store Manager in Training must be willing and able to accept a Store Manager position within the Market upon completion of the training.  Principal Duties & Responsibilities : At the direction of the Training Manager, the SMIT supervises, trains, and develops store Team Members on Family Dollar operating practices and procedures (e.g., Door to Shelf). Must be able to effectively communicate and explain these (and other) standards and procedures to Team Members when directed by Training Manager.  Greets and assists customers in a positive, approachable manner. Answers questions and resolves customer inquiries and concerns.  Assists the Training Manager in weekly ordering of merchandise using cycle counts to ensure in-stock representation . At the direction of the Training Manager, the SMIT assists in unloading all merchandise from delivery truck, organizes merchandise, and transfers merchandise from stockroom to store.  Assists the Training Manager in loss prevention efforts by maintaining a presence in the store and providing excellent customer service.  Acquires knowledge and executes all duties necessary for the effective and profitable operation of the store. The first  Family Dollar store was opened in  Charlotte, NC , in 1959. It was a relatively small, self-service operation located in a neighborhood convenient to low and middle income consumers. The merchandise assortment featured basic goods for family and home needs. The no frills, low overhead, cash-and-carry environment provided good value at the lowest price points. As the company opened more stores, it became clear that this merchandising concept filled a niche in the marketplace and held great promise for supporting a chain of much larger size. Refinements have been made through the years, but we have never lost sight of our original concept. From the beginning, all our efforts have been focused on meeting the needs of our customer base for good quality, low-cost, basic merchandise. SR FINANCIAL ANALYST  Sr Financial Analyst-Strategic Finance and Analysis  Job Requisition Number:  92995  Posting Title:  Sr Financial Analyst-Strategic Finance and Analysis  Shift:  1 - Day Shift  Department:  FINANCE  Employment Status:  Full-Time  Location:  1801 LIND AVENUE SW  RENTON, Washington 98057-0000  Salary Minimum:  30.30  Salary Maximum:  48.48  External Description:  INTRO Providence is calling a Sr. Financial Analyst Strategic Finance and Analysis to System Support Services in Renton, WA.  Providence Health & Services is recruiting for the position of Senior Financial Analyst located in Renton, Washington. Reporting to the Manager of Strategic Finance and Analysis, this position is responsible for providing analytical support to business groups across the organization by providing consistent and meaningful financial information, reporting and analysis.  In this position you will:  Develop budget and forecast recommendations for consideration by leadership.  Assist in facilitation of the long-range financial forecast and budget.  Partner with all levels of the organization to provide ad hoc financial analysis and recommendations to support business decisions. Act as an internal financial consultant and trusted business partner to provide financial guidance, analysis, data, strategic and tactical analysis and recommendations.  Develop and review of pro formas for business plans and system initiatives. Perform financial analysis of RFPs, prepare NPV and ROI calculations, financial modeling and business valuations.  Facilitate and independently driving all processes and discussions associated with the financial aspect of the project/business group.  Champion the continuous improvement of solution development methodologies, systems requirement analysis, etc. in order to improve the delivery of the finance department s services to various other business areas.  QUALIFICATIONS Required qualifications for this position include:  Minimum of a Bachelor s degree in Business, Marketing or a health care-related discipline or equivalent is required.  Minimum of five (5) years of previous business & financial analysis, planning & project management experience.  Demonstrated expertise in the use of computers and electronic systems for data handling and transfer; and independent responsibility for health information management and data analysis, or equivalent.  Extensive experience with Excel, Access or similar databases, word processing, desktop publishing, and statistical and graphing applications is required.  Preferred qualifications for this position include:  Master s degree in Health Administration, Public Health or Business Administration is strongly preferred.  Demonstrated strong oral and written communication skills including ability to write business cases and effectively articulate ideas and recommendations. Ability to effectively interact with all levels of management.  Independent, proactive, and innovative problem solver who concisely provides options with recommended solution for management decision MINISTRY INFO About the department you will serve.  System Support Services is the name adopted to more accurately reflect the Providence employees who work throughout Providence Health & Services in support of the boundary spanning, shared services and operations across the five states from Alaska to California. Its mission is to ensure our core strategy and mission, One Ministry Committed to Excellence, is maintained by delivering a robust foundation of services and sharing specialized expertise.  To apply: Interested persons are invited to submit a resume and salary expectations to:  Internal candidates at:  https://recruiter.kenexa.com/providence/cc/Home.ss?ccid=1sn5RRaP6Ig%3D  External candidates at:  https://recruiter.kenexa.com/providence/cc/Home.ss?ccid=bupJEdUjsTs%3D Providence Health & Services is an Equal Opportunity Employer Add Email Apply Return Need Help? 1) Click on " Help" 2) Click on " Frequently Asked Questions" or 3) Talk to the Kenexa Help Desk at  877-560-4084  Page ID: Job Detail (P-REM-95)  2010 Providence Health & Services |  |

In addition, the Service Center Manager establishes and maintains an effective relationship with the local union, while also managing the service center staff to ensure that dock managers, service team managers, service coordinators, planners, and other members of the service center staff are positioned properly, are well-qualified, and compliant with the company and government regulations related to the working environment and safety. PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS Experience in a union environment preferred.  College degree preferred. We believe our clients and their families deserve the highest quality of home health care delivered with compassion, excellence, and reliability - our core values. With more than 190 offices in 19 states, founder Mark Baiada still maintains the same compassionate, human focus that made our first office unique in 1975.  We have a part time or per diem Physical Therapist opportunity for Harrisburg and the surrounding areas (the East Shore)  to assist the physician in evaluation of the level of function, perform client assessments, and plan and implement appropriate interventions, to assist clients in attaining or maintaining optimal physical well being. Each Physical Therapist must: Be licensed as a physical therapist by the state in which practicing, and Have graduated from a program approved by the American Physical Therapy Association, or the Committee on Allied Health Education and Accreditation of the American Medical Association, as indicated by school transcript or diploma or Have at least two year's work experience under the supervision of a qualified Physical Therapist and Have a criminal background check completed  Our employees are our greatest asset: Enjoy being part of a team that cares and a company that believes in leading with our values  Develop your skills with training and scholarship opportunities  Advance your career with specially designed career tracks  Be recognized and rewarded for your compassion, excellence, and reliability Benefits may include medical, dental, and life insurance; paid time off; weekly pay and direct deposit; scholarship opportunities; one-on-one training; recognition programs; referral bonuses; 401(k) with company match; and opportunities for career advancement. At Straub Surgery surgical, nursing and anesthesia care is provided to adults and children who require elective or emergent surgical intervention on an inpatient or outpatient basis. E-mail address Password Remember Me on this Computer | |  Top Topics: Career HQ >  â¢ â¢ â¢ â¢ â¢ â¢ â¢ â¢ â¢ Job Detail  |  Job Summary Director Membership Marketing POSTED: Jan 07 Salary: Open Location: Employer: Infocomm International Type: Full Time - Experienced Category: Membership Preferred Education: 4 Year Degree Employer Information About  InfoComm International® is the international trade association of the professional audiovisual and information communications industries. Established in 1939, InfoComm has 5,000 members, including manufacturers, systems integrators, dealers and distributors, independent consultants, programmers, rental and staging companies, end-users and multimedia professionals from more than 70 countries. InfoComm International is the leading resource for AV market research and news. Its training and educatio....  Job Description InfoComm is seeking a Director, Membership Marketing. The Director is responsible for day-to-day marketing to support Membership Department programs as well as InfoCommâs electronic catalog services known as IQ . The Director, Membership Marketing, reports to the VP, Marketing and Communications and works with the Marketing staff to develop marketing plans and strategies with timelines, budgets and deliverables to ensure the success of Membershipâs and IQâs objectives. The Director also serves as project manager to implement marketing plans and measure the success of print and web campaigns. In addition, the Director, Membership Marketing oversees all Membership collateral materials, working collaboratively with Membership staff on creation, reviews, approvals, adoption and use of these materials to maximize the investment in these materials (handbook, business kit, workforce kit, html emails, invitations, flyers, tradeshow materials and others). The Director also follows a consistent style throughout promotional materials and events. The Director, Membership Marketing produces some creative and requests creative, working closely with the Marketing Services Department and designers. The Director, Membership Marketing works in a cooperative and collaborative way within Marketing, with his/her internal clients in Membership and IQ, and across other departments to meet deadlines and budgets and to adhere to systems and processes used by the Association. The Director, Membership Marketing also monitors the Membership and IQ pages of the Associationâs website, recommending changes, seeking new copy, writing and editing copy, updating pages and/or working with Marketing Services to ensure timely, accurate and promotional content to support Memberships Programs. NOTES: Local Residents Preferred (No Relo)  Requirements Qualifications  To perform this job successfully, the individual should have a minimum of 8-10 years marketing experience, excellent verbal and written communications skills, writing and editing skills, and strong organizational skills. Individual should have knowledge of printing processes, publication development, marketing materials development, marketing workflow and processes, brand adherence, list compilation and rental, postage requirements, direct mail handling through mailhouses, direct marketing, online marketing and database extraction for marketing to specific target audiences. Experience with Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Adobe InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator and Acrobat required. Creativity, ability to work independently and collaboratively and a can-do attitude essential. College degree preferred in communications, journalism or business. Experience in an association environment preferred.Some travel required. Interested candidates should send resume and cover letter with salary requirements via email to . No phone calls please. Relocation expenses are not authorized. InfoComm International offers an attractive benefits package including subsidized employer paid health insurance, 401(k) plan with employer matched contributions, generous vacation/sick leave and free parking. We are an equal opportunity employer and is committed to a policy of nondiscrimination with regard to race, sex, color, age, religion, creed, class, sexual orientation, national origin, or disability. AdChoices the  smart solution for Phoenix jobs Job 1661 Administrative Assistant III Location:  Phoenix Posted on:  September 12, 2011 Share this job on Facebook Job Description: Job 1661 Administrative Assistant III Department:Education Services Location: Phoenix, AZ JOB TITLE: Administrative Assistant III JOB #: 1661 DIVISION: Education Services Division  TYPICAL HIRING SALARY RANGE: $33,583 annualized FIRST REVIEW DATE: September 23, 2011 CLOSING DATE: All positions are open until filled. POSITION SUMMARY:  The Education Services Division (ESD) of the Arizona Supreme Court is seeking an Administrative Assistant to provide comprehensive administrative support for the Division Director and management team. ESD is responsible for maintaining a statewide system of judicial education for nearly 10,000 Arizona Judicial Branch judges and employees. The Division conducts curriculum development and education programs, coordinating seminars, workshops, conferences, and eLearning for judges, staff and probation officers statewide.  Under the direction of the Division Director, the position will: serve as liaison with external and internal constituents; facilitate well-orchestrated communication; review and update website content; support committee meetings; coordinate training calendars; organize routine division matters; develop and implement support procedures; and coordinate the administrative team to ensure coverage of the division phone line and Judicial Education Center. The position is located in the Judicial Education Center at: 541 E. Van Buren Street, Phoenix. MINIMUMREQUIREMENTS: The successful candidate will hold a high school diploma, or equivalent, plus four years of increasingly responsible experience in a full-function office. Knowledge and experience with a variety of office software and equipment is also required. Other requirements include strong communication skills; effective organizational and time management skills; ability to complete detailed work accurately and in a timely manner; ability to follow complex oral and written instructions and manage several ongoing projects; ability to monitor deadlines and provide appropriate follow-up; and ability to work with confidential materials in a discreet manner. Knowledge of the Arizona court system is preferred. Travel level: negligible SELECTION PROCESS: Some positions may take 4-6 weeks to fill. Only applicants whose education, training and experience most closely meet the needs of the position may be invited to interview. Requests for a special accommodation to participate in the interview process should be made at the time you are contacted to schedule an interview. The Selection Process may include computer testing (WORD, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, proofreading, typing, etc.) and first and/or second round panel interviews. This is a regular full-time non-exempt level position. This position is open for internal and external recruitment. The Arizona Supreme Court is an Equal Opportunity Employer HOW TO APPLYPlease submit your cover letter and current resume by clicking on the link below. You will setup a profile where you can submit your resume and cover letter. Acceptable attachment  formats are: MS Word, RTF, HTML, or ASCII text format. After submitting your resume, you will receive a confirmation email. This position is not covered by the State Merit System. The  Supreme Court conducts pre-employment screenings, including a criminal history records check. Requests for a special accommodation to participate in the interview process should be made at  the time you are contacted to schedule an interview. Job: Head Start Assistant Teacher Job Posting Details Company: Job Title: Head Start Assistant Teacher Job Code: 2669230 Position Type: Full Time Actual Location: Denver Job Description Provides classroom coverage during absence of other teacher. Classrooms may include infant through preschool levels. Assists with the planning, organizing, implementing, and delivering of a developmentally appropriate program based on the individual and group educational, social, and emotional potential of the children participating in their classroom. Assists in managing the classroom environment, provides input and observation concerning program participants, and interacts with parents and other resource staff to provide a supportive environment for children and families. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Develops positive relationships with parents and families of each child. Assists in the planning and implementation of daily activities that stimulate learning in all developmental areas (physical, emotional, social, and cognitive.) Assists in the organization and maintenance of classroom materials and equipment. Assists with and accompanies children on field trips and during extracurricular activities. Participates in the preparation, setup, serving, and cleanup of meals and snacks. Collects information on enrolled children through observation and work samples and may assist in using this information to plan for the individual child and to document growth.  Job Qualifications/Requirements and Benefits QUALIFICATIONS Minimum Group Leader Qualified by the Colorado Child Care Licensing Department. First Aid -CPR. Experience with School Age Children. Must comply with all Colorado State Licensing requirements for child care staff. Ability to remember schedules, programs, policies, and other details. Ability to remain calm and calm others in an emergency and/or confrontational situation. Knowledge of the service populations cultural and socioeconomic characteristics and the appropriate techniques and practices for the client population. Ability to interact effectively as a team member and independently with Agency staff and with a diverse client base. EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE High school diploma or general education degree (GED); or one to three months related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Minimum Group Leader Qualified by the Colorado Child Care Licensing Department.  How To Apply - (When applying mention you saw this ad on ColoradoJobs.net.) Sunday - Sep 4th, 2011 Staff Nurse II Short Hour - Inpatient Nursing (#372) Return to Search Results Keywords: Company: Kaiser Permanente Northwes Job Code: MWK7700657 Location (City or ZIP): Oakland Status: Full Time Posting Date: 09/02/2011 Job Category: Healthcare/Medical Salary Range: - not specified - Career Level: - any - Education Level: - any - Print Flag this Job | Job Description The Staff Nurse (SN) II is a professional caregiver who assumes responsibility and accountability for a group of patients for a designated time frame. The SN II provides care to patients via the therapeutic use of self, the nursing process, the environment and instrumentation, and other health care team members. Essential Functions: - Performs assessment/data collection in an on-going systematic manner, focusing on physiologic, psychosocial, cultural, spiritual and cognitive status; also nutrition, pain, patient/family Education , family involvement and patient advocacy. - Formulates a goal-directed plan of care that is prioritized and based on determined nursing diagnosis and patient outcomes. - Implements care in a thorough, skillful, consistent, and continuous manner. - Establishes priorities or patient care based on essential patient needs and available unit resources of time, personnel, equipment, and supplies. - Evaluates effectiveness of care given by health care team members. - Identifies patient/family learning needs and implements appropriate measures. - Documents patient care and unit activities in a timely, accurate, and concise manner. - Demonstrates an awareness of and sensitivity to patient/family rights, age specific needs, cultural and ethical beliefs. - Demonstrates knowledge of and applies safety principles as identified within the institution. - Performs efficiently in emergency patient care situations following established protocols, remaining calm, informing appropriate persons, and documenting events. - Demonstrates sound knowledge base and actions in the care of a designated patient population. - Demonstrates responsibility and accountability for own professional practice. - Participates regularly in staff development activities for unit and Department of Nursing personnel. - Demonstrates knowledge of  Legal issues, including patient confidentiality and risk management in all aspects of patient care and unit functioning. - Participates in unit and Department Performance Improvement activities as directed. - Delegates appropriately and coordinates duties of health care team members. - Utilizes effective communication methods and skills, following lines of authority, as appropriate. - Demonstrates a service philosophy in all interactions with patients, families, and all members of the health care team. - Establishes effective working relationships with members of the health care team, patients, and families. Acknowledges staff rights and cultural and ethical beliefs. - Provides data for staffing decisions and demonstrates flexibility in the resolution of staffing issues; demonstrates flexibility when floating to other units upon requests. - Ability to navigate in a windows environment, utilizing a mouse and the ability to learn electronic medical record system application. - Identifies and solves problems effectively. - Participates in nursing research activities as requested. - Perform other related duties as necessary. - This job motivates and provides work direction (direct, check, review, assign, organize and coordination) to LVN's, Nurse Attendants, unit assistants, etc., but does not have the authority to hire, fire or discipline. Basic Qualifications: - Minimum of 6 months experience. See job duties for specific experience requirements for specialty units. - LABOR & DELIVERY - One year recent experience (within the last 3 years) in L& D with completion of AWHONN L& D course preferred. NRP certification is required. Current ACLS certification may be required in some units. Successful completion of advanced fetal monitoring course preferred within the last 2 years. Successful completion of a Fetal Monitoring Interpretation Competency within the first three months of hire may be required. May be expected to cross train to at least 1 other Maternal Child Health/Family Centered Care area with appropriate certifications. Must complete circulating and recovery competencies as required. Willingness to scrub may be required. - SPECIALITY AREAS - If no qualified candidate, may be willing to train in the specialty areas listed below. Candidates in  Training are required to obtain appropriate certifications within 6 months of hire or transfer into unit. - High School Diploma/GED. - Graduate of an accredited registered nursing program and completion of the current hours required by the BRN of RN student clinical experience or Graduate of registered nursing and either 1) 2000 hours of RN experience in clinical area of specialty from a licensed acute care facility within three (3) years of graduation; or 2) graduate of an accredited licensed vocational nursing program that includes clinical student experience in acute care and has worked 2000 hours as an licensed vocational nurse within the clinical area of specialty within three (3) years before graduation or currently enrolled in an accredited entry level MSN program and has completed pre-licensure requirements to practice nursing. - Current license to practice as a Registered Nurse in California. - Current Basic Life  Support (BLS) certification for health care providers. - Demonstrated knowledge of the RN scope of practice. - Demonstrated commitment to service orientation (members, staff, providers). - Demonstrated effective written and oral communication skills (in English). - Good interpersonal skills. - Also refer to Position Specifications outlined in the appropriate collective bargaining agreement. jobText: Job Description  Litigation Management, Inc., provides comprehensive analyses of medical information for the defense of claims, individual lawsuits, mass torts or class actions where health, illness or injury is an issue.  Litigation Management, Inc.'s staff of medical, legal and healthcare industry professionals deliver customized work products that distill large volumes of difficult-to-decipher medical records into clear and concise analyses that are on time every time.  Litigation Management, Inc.'s clients spend time developing strategies, not searching for data.  We are experiencing considerable growth and are seeking:  Operations Support âRecord Acquisition The Operations Support position contributes to the success of LMIâs operations by applying company-wide work flow and process knowledge in completing work assignments in accordance with business needs and Client expectations. This position is relied upon as part of a float pool of flexible support staff that provides department specific support and ensures changing workflow demands are met. The position masters all support functions within LMI. The initial assignment for this position is in the Record Acquisition Department, where the Operations Support employee follows the project protocol, ensures appropriate authorizations and generates requests for healthcare and or litigation specific records. The position also identifies healthcare or related providers from legal and non-legal documents; verifies provider information through Internet research and contacts providers by telephone to facilitate the efficient and timely collection of records. Documents clearly and succinctly provider contact and progress using a proprietary database application. Requirements include:  ¨ At least one year experience in the legal profession, medical profession or customer service. ¨ Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Outlook, Excel, and searching on the Internet.  ¨ Strong experience working with databases with knowledge of database structure and functionality. ¨ Very detail orientated, including accurate data entry skills ¨ Ability to adapt in a changing work environment ¨ Analytical and creative reasoning skills ¨ Demonstrated initiative, independence, and Self-motivated and directed  ¨ Ability to prioritize and perform multiple tasks and excellent organization skills ¨ Strong research and investigative skills  ¨ Excellent verbal and written communication skills ¨ Ability to remain calm under stressful conditions ¨ Ability to concentrate for extended periods of time ¨ Strong customer service orientation Preferred Qualifications: ¨ 2-4 year degree in a health-related field, legal profession, research or business fields, or paralegal certification.  ¨ Legal, Medical or Medical Records experience and working knowledge of legal and/or medical terminology To apply for this position, please log on to  . Company Profile  The nation's leading medical information management firm specializing in litigation support.

jobText: ABS Investors |  Contact Us Helping You Achieve More SM Requisition Number:  1134  Job Title:  Treasury Analyst  Area of Interest:  Accounting / Finance City:  Lewisville State:  Texas Requirements:  What level of education or specialized training is required to perform the job? -Graduation from a 4-year college or university with major course work in a discipline related to the requirements of the position is preferred. Will consider the equivalent combination of job experience & education that demonstrates the ability to perform the essential functions of this job. Experience: Experience in treasury, finance, or banking in a highly automated environment. Computer Skills: Intermediate Excel and Access List any special certifications, licenses, and/or knowledge requirements for this job: None  How many years of directly related job experience are required to be qualified to enter the job? -Proficient in Excel and Microsoft packages (Intermediate), and Access desired. -Ability to research and clear reconciling items -BA or BS in Accounting or Finance preferred -Mortgage or servicing industry, preferred -4+ years of Treasury or Accounting experience -Experience working with Treasury Workstations and banking applications a plus Job Description:  The Treasury Analyst is responsible for the daily management of our warehouse facilities using our Warehouse Tracking System (WTS). WTS tracks the loans pledged to each debt facility. This position utilizes Microsoft Access, Excel to produce reporting, and analysis on our portfolio concentration and facility requirements to ensure adherence to facility agreements. On a daily basis, the Treasury Analyst works with Treasury personnel to forecast our funding requirements and works with selected warehouse contacts to obtain funding. This position also creates a daily data transmission for the collateral custodian, as well as, reconciles WTS to our custodial reporting. This position prepares monthly journal entries related to the funding received. This position works closely with our Investor Reporting and Secondary Marketing departments to identify potential issues with the Custodian related to terminated and new Securitizations and Whole Loan Sales. jobText: Company Information About QLogic Management Team Board of Directors Global Citizenship Career Opportunities Openings Benefits The Q-Difference Contact QLogic DFT Engineer Tracking Code 3802  Job Description Help build our new Physical Design Team! Due to the continued rapid growth in our business, QLogic is creating a new COT team that will augment our experienced and highly successful ASIC design organization. This new group will be responsible for all aspects of Physical Design and IP selection for our ASIC product lines. We are fully committed to staffing the COT team with top notch talent and providing the latest, state-of-the-art design tools and equipment to ensure itâs success.  The design for test (DFT) engineer is responsible for DFT for block level and chip level DFT in the COT flow that will be used for QLogic ASIC. The individual should have a thorough understanding of methodologies and processes that are used in DFT. The individual should also be familiar with the tools that are used for DFT. This implies extensive use of one of the tool sets used for DFT from Cadence, Mentor, Synopsys or Logicvision. The candidate should have implemented DFT on at least on large ASIC. The individual should also have good interpersonal and communication skills. THE COMPANY Founded in 1994, QLogic Corporation (Nasdaq QLGC) is a leading supplier of high-performance networking solutions. The company produces the controller chips, host adapters and fabric switches that are the backbone of storage and HPC networks for Global 2000 corporations as well as small and medium businesses. QLogic delivers a broad and diverse portfolio of products that includes adapters, switches and management tools for a variety of network topologies including Fibre Channel, iSCSI and InfiniBand. QLogic products power solutions from leading companies like Cisco, Dell, EMC, Hitachi data systems, HP, IBM, Network Appliance and Sun Microsystems, and are delivered to small-to-medium businesses and large enterprises around the world by a global community of OEM and channel partners. Required Skills The individual should also have experience in the following areas: 1. JTAG tap controller implementation and verification. 2. Boundary SCAN implementation and verification. 3. SCAN insertion. 4. Implement and verify compression ATPG that includes stuck-at, at-speed and iddq. 5. Generate ATPG test patterns, including stuck-at, at-speed, and iddq. 6. MBIST planning and implementation in both RTL and netlist. 7. LBIST planning and implementation in both RTL and netlist. 8. Verification of MBIST and LBIST implementation. 9. Implement and verify PLL bist and SERDES bist. 10. Pattern simulation that includes ATPG, MBIST, LBIST and Boundary SCAN. 11. Provide timing constraints for DFT timing closure. 12. Understand DFT DRC rules and able to correct violations. 13. Know how to improve test coverage. 14. Debug failures from the ATE failure report. Some ASIC front end tool knowledge is important. The individual should have a BSEE and at least 5 years in the semiconductor industry related to DFT for an ASIC COT flow Job Location Mountain View, CA, US. Position Type Full-Time/Regular -  Submit/Create a new rÉsumÉ/CV for this posting -  Use an existing rÉsumÉ/CV to submit for this posting -  Email this posting to a friend

Click Here to Apply Online Posted : 05/17/2011  Job Reference # :  Job Type :  Share This Page Jobing Description  Position Summary  The University of New Mexico Clinical and Translational Center (UNM CTSC) at the Health Sciences Center, is a dynamic component of the Office of Research advancing scientific discovery into improved health outcomes by providing resources and infrastructure to enable investigators to perform cutting-edge clinical research. The CTSC is a member of the national Clinical Translational Science Award (CTSA) consortium.  We are seeking a Biomedical Informatics Manager (Unit IT Support Manager) to join our CTSC Biomedical Informatics component. This is an exciting opportunity to manage professional database and programming staff in addressing the day-to-day operations such as programming and systems design, the implementation of computer networks, and the development of Internet and intranet sites. The ideal candidate will have a significant emphasis on project management, resource scheduling, and cross-functional team coordination and planning.  TERM APPOINTMENT; FUNDING AVAILABLE THROUGH 03/31/2012; CONTINUANCE BEYOND THAT DATE SUBJECT TO AVAILABILITY OF ADDITIONAL FUNDING.  This is a full-time, benefits eligible position.  The University of New Mexico (UNM) provides a diversified package of benefits including medical, dental, vision, and life insurance. In addition, UNM offers educational benefits through the tuition remission and dependent education programs. For a more complete explanation of the benefits,  Skills / Requirements  Minimum Qualifications  High school diploma or GED; at least 7 years of work experience that can be demonstrated to be applicable to the duties listed in the job description.  Directly related, completed degrees from accredited institutions may be substituted for experience on a year-for-year basis.  Preferred Qualifications  Preferences:  Ability to plan, implement, test, and troubleshoot system software.  Ability to develop and write systems and applications documentation and guides for users.  The ability to provide a range of training activities for users. Will be responsible for creation of Databases, Software, User Interface, Unit Testing, Remediation and Reports. Essential Job Functions Performs moderately complex systems modeling, simulation and analysis to provide appropriate software solutions. Develops software system testing procedures, programming and documentation to ensure standard use of procedures. Provides input for documentation of new or existing programs to ensure information accessibility, as required. Designs, develops, troubleshoots and analyzes software programs to ensure compatibility with hardware systems. Customizes software based on research and customer needs as appropriate. Coordinates and facilitates communications with other departments and/or commercial vendor(s) to investigate and resolve software matters of significance and to ensure proper functioning of systems. Maintains communication with management and customers regarding status of software development and problems. Acts as technical lead on large projects involving a particular software package(s). Provides the customer base with first level support.  Understand system creation, reporting, error handling, etc Qualifications Basic Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and experience Bachelor s degree in computer science, management information systems, or related field preferred Three or more years of experience in software engineering or operating systems programming Experience working with design and coding languages Experience working with software design principles Experience working with computer hardware  Five or more years of working PHP experience (PHP5 knowledge is important)  Two or more years of MySQL DB experience, creating and building to scale properly  Three or more years of experience with CSS/HTML understanding is a must, they need to be able to interpret existing front-end code Other Qualifications Good analytical and creative problem solving skills for design, creation and testing of software  Through understanding of the Code Igniter Framework (possible code examples) Good interpersonal skills to interact with customers and team members Good communication skills to interact with team members and senior support personnel Ability to work independently and as part of a team CSC is an Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/D/V Alert a friend about this job Send this job description to someone you think may be interested in this job. Employee Type:  Full-Time Industry:  Advertising Packaging Printing - Publishing Manages Others:  No Job Type:  Manufacturing Sales Information Technology Education:  2 Year Degree Experience:  2 years Travel:  None Relocation Covered:  No Post Date:  5/13/2011 Contact Information  Contact:  Chris Bielawski Phone:  815-885-4747 Ref ID:  MERIDIAN - CSR 2011 Fax:  815-885-4646  instantly fax your resume > >  Description  Customer Service - Print - Promotional Products Inside Sales & Estimating Meridian is a Print Management Company Web Based PRINT Solutions Company Promotional Products - Company Stores www.meridian-direct.com Meridian is an evolution of over 40 years in industry experience along with cutting edge, user-friendly technology. This combination of integrated services gives us the ability to provide our array of solutions to a diverse customer base. Meridian's customer centric approach, knowledge and experience have enabled the company to operate as a turnkey solutions provider for the following industries  Healthcare  Financial  Manufacturing  Retail  Non-Profit  Web-Based Management Solutions and Services  Web-to-Print/Variable Data  Commercial Print  Point of Purchase  Data  Inventory  Direct Marketing  Retail and Store Environment  Promotional Products  A Challenging opportunity with an Expanding Commercial printer and web based print management company. Experienced Customer Service Representative with several years experience with Printed Materials, Commercial print, packaging, labels or a Technical product within a production facility. A manufacturing or distributor background. Must have strong computer skills with extensive knowledge of Microsoft Office, Word, Excel etc.  Other industry experience will be considered for the right candidate who has the knowledge, technical training, or experience from fast paced technical industry. Motivation and the ability to learn the printing businesswith technical aptitude will also be considered. Candidate for this position must be self-motivated, have great communication, organizational and computer skills. The ideal candidate should have a great attitude, dependable, personable, be professional and able to multi-task and wear many hats in our expanding company. The ideal candidate will be comfortable working with customers and sales team via phone and email. Knowledge of digital products, software, Inventory management programs is a definite plus. This position is within a very fasty paced environment. Assisting sales team members, customers and management to provide exceptional service to new and existing clients. Qualifications Additional requirements include: A high attention to detail, interpreting and executing critical and complex instructions and job specifications, positive leadership and professionalism, excellent close and color vision for inspecting digital color output, Ideal candidates should have well-rounded experience including, but not limited to the following: - Order processing into multiple software programs and online systems  - Estimating and quoting via multiple software programs inhouse or outside vendors  - Coordinate all aspects of a job from the estimating, to order processing, preflighting files, proofing to customers, follow progress of jobs by working with production and scheduling and ensure billing is correct when the job has shipped.  - Supporting all aspects for the Sales Staff  · Typing quotes for sales representatives as needed  · If necessary prepares correspondence, presentations, reports for the sales representatives  - Researches and obtains information for reports or special projects  - Maintains client database with new client information and updating current contact info  - Staying up to date on the industry trends and new products  - Performs other functions as assigned -Problem solving ability Data Entry - Quantum, ACT contact management software, Printleader Powerpoint Presentations Maintain Archived Print Jobs, Electronic Files, Color Swatches through the company digital asset management software Maintain a hign standard of quality and accuracy. .  Requirements  As a member of the Meridian Sales and Customer Service Team - Sense of urgency is a must; this is a very fast paced office that requires attention to detail and proactive thinking.  - Ability to work independently with limited supervision; self-motivated, detail oriented; have excellent interpersonal skills; demonstrate strong customer service skills and show sound judgement when dealing with different situations.  - Excellent organizational skills; ability to initiate, plan, prioritize and conduct multiple projects successfully and meet ship dates.  - Ability to work effectively under presure and be flexible and adaptable to change.  - Professional demeanor and skilled in communicating effectively with people at all levels within and outside organizations via telephone, in person, or by printed and electronic correspondence.  - Willingness to learn âwe have 4 different software packages  Modern facility with a pleasant office environment convienently located at Riverside & I- 90 in Loves Park, IL. Navigation Account Search Jobs Search Jobs:  Campus & Health System Employment Global Navigation Research/Statistical/Sciences (8 of 24 Positions)  |  |  Payroll Title: STAFF RESEARCH ASSOC II Department: MEDICINE/Pulmonary Hiring Salary Range $42,312 - $49,572 /year Location: Hillcrest Appointment Type: Career Appointment Percent: 100% Union: Total Openings: 1 Work Schedule: Days, 8 hrs/day, Mon-Fri #57992 Laboratory Technician/Tuberculosis Specialist  Filing Deadline:  Tue 6/21/2011 UCSD or UC San Diego Health System Layoff from Career Appointment or Special Selection: Apply by 06/10/11 for consideration with preference for rehire. Eligible UCSD ACCES clients should contact their Vocational Rehabilitation Counselor for Special Selection; UCSD Health System Special Selection applicants must contact Linda Morgan. UCSD Layoff applicants must leave a message at (858) 534-6333 or call your assigned Sr. Employment Advisor; UCSD Health System Layoff applicants must contact Diane Schmidt to exercise preferential rehire status. DESCRIPTION Under general supervision from the laboratory director, perform non-repetitive and repetitive, technically complex, multidisciplinary procedures working with drug-resistant Mycobacterium tuberculosis (mTB) for the Global Consortium for Drug-Resistant TB Diagnostics (GCDD), including microbiologic and molecular procedures. Work includes manipulation of cultures in BSL3 setting, processing, cataloging, storing, retrieving and assaying drug-resistant mTB isolates for research protocols. Microbiologic procedures include microscopic stains, subculture of isolates for creating a repository of TB isolates and distribution of isolates to other laboratory sites following all IATA regulations, susceptibility testing using BD BACTEC MGIT 960, MIC analysis, MODS testing. Perform mTB genotyping, including RFLP, sequencing, and drug mutation analysis. Enter laboratory data; manage, analyze and report on resulting data. Develop scientific manuscripts documenting laboratory methods and outcomes. Work closely with other laboratory personnel. Operate and maintain sophisticated equipment. Work with a variety of computer software programs. Contribute to day-to-day operation of the BSL3 TB Laboratory, including laboratory procedures, meeting with principal investigators, data gathering, preparing monthly and annual reports, and other administrative duties. ~Must work weekends and holidays as required by work load. QUALIFICATIONS Theoretical knowledge of Microbiology; specifically Microbacteria and drug resistance and knowledge and abilities essential to the successful performance of duties assigned to the position. Demonstrated experience working with drug resistant TB. Expertise handling mycobacterium tuberculosis in both a research and a clinical setting performing susceptibility studies and molecular analysis.  Demonstrated experience with mTB genotyping techniques, including RFLP, sequencing, and drug mutation analysis. Demonstrated experience working in a BSL2 / BSL3 laboratory in a research setting. Demonstrated experience with PCR and Real-Time PCR in a laboratory setting. Experience with data entry, management and analysis.  Demonstrated experience with writing reports, and scientific manuscripts documenting laboratory methods and outcomes.  Strong organizational skills to keep lab logs on assays done and communicate results to investigators. Ability to maintain good laboratory records and to compute data accurately. Strong computer skills to operate equipment and enter data. UC San Diego is an Equal Opportunity / Staff Affirmative Action Employer that values a diverse workforce.  UC San Diego is an Equal Opportunity / Staff Affirmative Action Employer that values a diverse workforce. Excellent opportunity for Palliative Care specialist  Mercy Medical Group  Sacramento, CA  Sacramento, CA  Job ID:  249397  Accepts J1s:  No  Loan Assistance:  Practice Type:  Negotiable Employee  ShareThis  Job Detail Excellent opportunity for Palliative Care specialist Medical Clinic of Sacramento, Inc. (MCS), a multi-specialty group with more than 200 healthcare providers in the Sacramento region, is looking to add a Palliative Care provider to our busy Geriatrics Department. MCS doctors provide services to patients at CHW Medical Foundation's Mercy Medical Group locations throughout Sacramento.  MCS is seeking a BE/BC Palliative Medicine specialist to provide hospital and SNF based consults and coordinate care efforts with palliative care coordinators at various locations in Sacramento. Additional responsibilities would include education of physicians, nursing staff and community members in regards to Palliative Medicine and building an Advanced Illness Care Program with Mercy Hospice. Call will be 1:8 with access to hospitalists 24/7 and a strong built-in referral system. All outpatient care locations have a full electronic medical records system, as well.  This shareholder track opportunity offers a very competitive compensation and benefits package, including bonus potential and a very desirable retirement plan.  Mercy Medical Group is a service of CHW Medical Foundation (CHWMF). CHWMF is affiliated with Catholic Healthcare West, one of the leading healthcare systems in the country.  For more information about Mercy Medical Group, visit mymercymedgroup.org.  Community, Facility and Organization Join in the excitement occuring at Mercy Medical Group. In 1948, five Sacramento physicians shared a bold vision: a new approach to providing full-service healthcare with a personal touch. This vision led to the birth of Mercy Medical, Sacramento's first medical group.  Mercy Medical Group includes more than 260 providers, representing over 30 specialties, as well as a wide array of allied health professionals. Working together, we provide " seamless" primary and specialty care that respects the needs of each individual patient. Our services represent a full spectrum of care including: On-site laboratory  Women's healthcare  Diagnostic Imaging  Vision care  Occupational Health  Urgent Care  Behavioral Health: psychiatry and counseling  Care management programs Physicians practice at area hospitals with state of the art facilities: Mercy General, Sacramento; Mercy San Juan, Methodist Hospital, and Mercy Hospital of Folsom. Sacramento is one of the most affordable cities in California. The area offers a wide variety of activites to enjoy, including including fine dining, shopping, biking, boating, river rafting, skiing, or attending one of many different cultural events. Lake Tahoe, San Francisco, Yosemite, the vineyards of Napa Valley, Amador and El Dorado Counties, and the historical Gold Rush towns of the foothills are all within easy driving distance. Additionally, our school systems offer outstanding educational opportunities for your children. Mercy Medical Group offers an excellent compensation package; including Malpractice, Health, Dental, Disability, Retirement, Vacation, CME, Moving Expenses and Production Bonus.
