|  |  |  |  Jobs in Prospects Folder Unread Messages Job Links My WorkSource Career Links Job Details >  >  Pest Prevention Service Specialist WorkSource Job Number:  WS388965084 Listed By: SPRAGUE PEST SOLUTIONS on Jul 7, 2011 Last Modified on: Jul 8, 2011 Closes on: Aug 6, 2011 Description Sprague Pest Solutions is seeking an outgoing, conscientious individual as Pest Prevention Service Specialist. The Pest Prevention Service Specialist is that vital link between our company and our clients and manages a local route providing pest control and inspection services to our commercial clients. They provide friendly, cordial service to clients, and work to build strong relationships, solve problems, and recommend actions to prevent future pest control problems. No experience is necessary as we provide a fully paid comprehensive training program, including state licensing.  This position takes someone who likes working independently in a fast-paced environment, enjoys " being the expert," and can stay organized and attentive to detail without direct supervision. A successful team member must have good communication and computer skills; excellent observation and documentation skills; and be able to work cooperatively with customers with a love to help others.  Benefits: â¢Excellent Pay â¢Bonus and Commission  â¢Professional Development  â¢Career Development  â¢Company vehicle and Service Equipment â¢Uniform â¢Cell phone and PDA â¢Medical, Dental, Vision Insurance â¢Company-paid Life and Disability Insurance  â¢401(k) program with company match â¢Paid time off  â¢Flexible schedules Qualifications: â¢High school diploma or equivalent. â¢Valid motor vehicle operator's license and good driving record.  â¢Great communication and customer service skills. â¢Solid and stable work history. â¢Work independently, reliably and consistently â¢Route experience preferred. â¢Able to routinely lift 35 lbs.; bend, squat, crawl, reach; climb over and on top of structures; ascend and descend stairs and ladders and occasionally work at heights. â¢Read and write reports legibly, and comprehend pesticide labels and training materials printed in English. â¢Use application equipment, inspection equipment, small hand tools, small power tools and personal protective equipment. â¢Tolerate a variety of environmental conditions, including seasonal weather, damp and/or dusty locations.  â¢Use a hand held PDA and software applications â¢Be comfortable working with insects and various animals in a variety of environmental conditions.  â¢Meet State Licensing requirements  Many of our most successful technicians enjoy outdoor sports and activities like hiking and hunting, and boating and fishing. If you enjoy activities that involve working with your hands, problem solving and figuring things out, you might really enjoy the work of a pest prevention service specialist.  "Sprague has given me more than I could have ever imagined, I am challenged everyday and itâs never the same thing twice. With the ongoing training provided to me paired with genuine caring of the whole Sprague family I canât imagine ever working anyplace else." Harry H., Eugene, OR If you seek a rewarding career, with a successful, professional company, submit a resume. jobText: Apply Online Job Title Team Leader Job Location 23155 OUTER DR, Allen Park, MI 48101  Job Category Store Associates Job Description Have you always wanted to be someone who makes it happen? Well, hereâs your chance to do just that as a PETCO Team Lead! What a PETCO Team Lead Does: â¢Assist the General Manager of a PETCO store with reaching sales goals and staying within budgeted payroll hours â¢Make sure the store is opened/closed daily according to established procedures â¢Help train and develop store personnel â¢Direct and assist with the ordering, loading, pricing, SKUing and stocking of merchandise according to operational procedures â¢Assist in merchandising store as instructed â¢Interact with customers and help them find the right animal supplies for their specific needs â¢Use your own judgment when needed to complete assigned tasks As a PETCO Team Lead, you should possess the following: â¢A genuine interest in the well-being of animals â¢A high school diploma or equivalent (GED) â¢The ability to demonstrate advanced math skills â¢The ability to interact professionally with both coworkers and customers in both written and verbal communication forms â¢Previous retail experience is a plus â¢The physical ability to move merchandise up to 50lbs â¢The ability to prioritize and complete tasks with little or no direction, and meet established deadlines In addition to great benefits, which may include medical, dental, and vision, PETCO offers full- and part-time associates paid time off, a great discount that can be used at any PETCO store, and flexible work schedules. Employment Specialist  Mission, SD Requisition Number:  101358 Agency:  Department of Social Services, Economic Services Salary:  $13.91 - $17.39 per hour, depending on experience N14 Closing Date:  07/05/2011 This position assesses and analyzes current life circumstances to develop and enhance employment opportunities for low income families participating in the Temporary Assistance for Needy Families (TANF) program; identifies and addresses barriers to employment; assists in job search and job retention activities; provides counseling and solutions to promote employment; develops curriculum for and presents workshops and public presentations; identifies customer's interests, strengths, skills, abilities, and challenges; determines appropriate training; and sets realistic goals to match customers with appropriate jobs. The Ideal Candidate Will Have: A bachelor's degree in social science, behavioral science, or other human service related fields; business administration, public administration, education, or public health; and/or experience in health care administration, finance, accounting, or insurance may be considered as applicable to the entry-level knowledge, skills, and abilities. Knowledge of: Native American culture (preferred but not required);  career counseling methods and techniques including issues, concerns, and barriers to employment (preferred but not required);  principles, practices, and methods of social programs (preferred but required).  Ability to: prepare clear and concise documentation, reports, and correspondence that reflect relevant facts;  demonstrate compassion, respect, courtesy, and tact when interacting with others;  gather and analyze data; reason logically and accurately; and solve problems using common sense, reasoning, and resourcefulness;  actively listen, elicit needed information, and provide accurate information;  prioritize, plan, and organize work to meet schedules and deadlines and respond and adjust to multiple demands;  utilize computerized data systems (Microsoft Office preferred but not required);  communicate effectively with individuals and groups;  assume initiative with minimal supervision.  Applications must be filed on an official South Dakota Bureau of Personnel application form. Applications may be obtained at a South Dakota Department of Labor and Regulation Employment Services Office, the Bureau of Personnel, or the BOP website at  . Applications postmarked or received within 24 hours after the closing date will be accepted. A separate application is needed for each requisition number.  PLEASE NOTE: WHEN YOUR APPLICATION IS FORWARDED TO THE APPOINTING AUTHORITY, YOU WILL BE NOTIFIED BY EMAIL. PLEASE ENSURE YOUR EMAIL ADDRESS IS CORRECT AND CURRENT.  Send applications to: SOUTH DAKOTA BUREAU OF PERSONNEL 500 EAST CAPITOL AVENUE PIERRE, SD 57501-5070 FAX: 605.773.4344 " AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER"  For internal use only: 08-5554, 06/21/2011 |

jobText: |  |  |  Careers About Careers Current Openings Current Openings Research Associate, Organization Charts Department: Research & Analysis Services Description: SUMMARY  INPUT | DIS, the premier public-sector market intelligence firm, helps companies develop federal, state, and local government business and helps public sector organizations achieve their objectives. Over 2,000 members, including small specialized companies, new entrants to the public sector, and the largest government contractors and agencies, rely on INPUT | DIS for the latest and most comprehensive procurement and market information, powerful sales management tools, and educational & networking events. INPUT | DIS has a solid reputation for providing the timely, accurate, and detailed information needed to achieve results in the government market. INPUT | DIS members win over $100 billion in government contracts each year.  The Research Associate, Organization Charts is responsible for conducting and supporting memberâ s sales and business development efforts by identifying, creating and maintaining Organizational Charts at the state, local and federal level. The position is responsible for data collection and dissemination of INPUT | DISâ s federal content through both secondary and primary research.  The Organizational Charts team is in need of a highly motivated, detail orientied, self-starter who demonstrates success in a fast-paced work environment with team-oriented deadlines.  Required Skills: QUALIFICATIONS  â ¢ Bachelor's Degree from a Tier 1 institution or and/or equivilant experience in marketing, customer support, data collection, business development or public sector.  â ¢ Superior ability to articulate complex concepts in both written and oral forms.  â ¢ Keen attention to detail including outstanding grammatical skills.  â ¢ Ability to learn and apply complex market knowledge quickly.  â ¢ Strong verbal communication skills, including experience with telephonic based research  â ¢ Excellent internet research skills.  â ¢ Intermediate skills with Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio and Outlook.  â ¢ Customer focus and ability to interact with clients at public sector events.  â ¢ Ability to learn, understand and utilize new software rapidly.  â ¢ Superior interpersonal skills and capability to work successfully in a collaborative environment.  â ¢ Proven commitment to academic and/or professional excellence; job seekers with limited professional experience must have an overall undergraduate GPA of a 3.5 or higher.  â ¢ Understanding of services market concepts and key components.  â ¢ Knowledge of the public sector technology procurement (including Federal Acquisition Regulations â FAR) or business development (BD) is not required but is preferred.  DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES  â ¢ Research, identify and create organization charts at the state, local and federal level.  â ¢ Update content via primary telephonic and secondary internet research.  â ¢ Identify key contacts inside of organizations such as; key decision makers, subject matter experts, and contracting and program officials.  â ¢ Represent INPUT | DIS at public-sector industry events.  â ¢ Assist in the delivery of high-quality and timely responses to specific customer inquiries.  â ¢ Support in the selection and training of team-members.  â ¢ Stay abreast of top-level organization changes, including re-organization efforts of assigned departments, agencies and offices.  â ¢ Identify organization of interest not currently represented in the product.  â ¢ Other duties as assigned.  Contact Careers: P: (703) 885-9000 F: (703) 860-8504 Please reference the position for which you are interested in any correspondence.  Information Services are delivered through INPUT's  portal. Consistently ranked among the top architecture and engineering firms by leading industry publications, HDR has designed some of the most innovative facilities in the world. We are currently searching for a Senior Designer for our Phoenix office. This is an exciting opportunity for someone who desires to function as a key designer for a nationally recognized firm. The Senior Designer must interview well with a proven record of winning new projects and new clients. Must be capable of developing highly creative and effective design solutions with an established design reputation evident through design awards, publications, education or other venues. Ability to guide initial design concepts and ideas through successful project completion on multiple projects. Capable of meeting design excellence goals while meeting management goals and project budgets. Must have the proven initiative to teach and train other designers and project teams in the essentials of design excellence and in the critical tenets of HDR's Design Philosophy. Effective in mentoring and developing junior design staff, challenging, inspiring and/or motivating others to join in the constant pursuit of design excellence. The Senior Designer will be a key design leader at HDR who must have the vision and attitude to lead design efforts from multiple offices, while effectively partnering with office management and project management on all efforts. Must be capable of identifying, attracting and retaining key design staff, and will be responsible for targeting and developing strategies for hiring senior and junior design talent. Must be active in local, national or international professional design related organizations. Keyword(s): 101696, Senior Designer, Architecture Requirements Bachelors or Masters Degree in Architecture or related field. 15 years of project design experience. Maintains a professional architectural registration. LEED AP preferred. Excellent leadership and mentoring skills. Excellent writing and communication skills. Preference will be given to candidates with Healthcare, Science Technology or Civic/Justice related project experience. Experience and/or interest in sustainable design/LEED desired but not required. Pharmacist, Supervisor (Stallworth Rehabilitation Hospital)  Job Title:  Pharmacist, Supervisor (Stallworth Rehabilitation Hospital)  Job Type:  Full-Time  Location:  Nashville, TN  Position #:  00202100  Standard Hours:  40  Req#:  RN281361  Department Name:  Pharmacy  Post Date:  05/20/2011  Job Description: Vanderbilt University Medical Center (VUMC) is seeking a full time pharmacist to manage pharmacy services at Vanderbilt Stallworth Rehabilitation Hospital (VSRH). Responsibilities include staffing, coordinating and managing all aspects of pharmaceutical services at this 80 bed facility. The pharmacy is fully automated with progressive pharmacy information system and automated dispensing cabinets utilized for decentralized distribution. The pharmacist plays a critical role on the clinical team to provide safe and effective medication therapy for this specialized patient population. Candidates should be team oriented and patient focused. Responsibilities include staffing, and managing the clinical and operational pharmacy program.  Basic Requirements:  This position requires Bachelor's degree and 24 months experience. Management experience is preferred. This position requires current Vanderbilt experience-internal candidates only. License Required:  Pharmacist License  Additional Information: This is a full-time position; 40 hours per week. Background screens will be performed and education will be verified prior to employment. Please be prepared to provide required information and/or documentation. Vanderbilt is a smoke-free workplace in compliance with the Non-Smoker Protection Act, Tennessee Code Annotated 39-17-1801-1810. In accordance with that law and Vanderbilt policy, smoking is prohibited in all buildings on Vanderbilt property and on the grounds of the campus with the exception of designated outdoor smoking areas.  Vanderbilt is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer

National Accounts Manager National Accounts Manager The National Accounts Manager has primary responsibility for the business growth of MOUNTAIN, LTD. The National Accounts Manager, s/he is expected to develop and maintain a strategic sales plan (for the COO's approval) to fulfill the growth and revenue goals of the corporation. The National Accounts Manager is responsible for the overall management of the Sales and Business Development Department to insure maximum sales volume of the division and maximum profitability on all accounts. S/he will oversee the sales efforts of the sales/business development professionals assigned to him/her, holding each team member accountable for meeting both quantitative and qualitative metrics and quotas. S/he is expected to recruit, hire, train, develop and evaluate sales professionals. As the National Accounts Manager s/he is required to plan and direct all aspects of the sales department's budget, goals, policies, objectives and initiatives. Required Skills:  Ability to motivate assigned sales force in sales efforts and operations staff in meeting quality assurance standards through exceptional customer service activity. Ability to foster open communications and win the respect of other managers as well as the sales/business development and operations staff by creating a win-win situation (by demonstrating retention of sales is a group effort and equals success and prosperity) for the entire team. Job Title:  Claims Examiner III - CA - WC City:  Orange State/Province:  California Position Type:  Full Time Description:  Senior Claims Examiner California Workers' Compensation CLAIM YOUR FUTURE AS A GREAT PERFORMER! Continuing double-digit revenue growth rates and progressive employment practices make Sedgwick Claims Management Services the place where great people can do great things for clients while maximizing their career possibilities.  We have earned a reputation for innovation, quality, sustained growth, financial stability and a colleague-friendly work environment.  We are proud to  have been voted the  Best TPA in America  for 2005 and 2006 , and the first and only Third Party Administrator to receive the coveted  Employer of Choice  designation.  Come be a part of our team and  " Claim Your Future."  PRIMARY PURPOSE : To analyze complex or technically difficult claims to determine benefits due; to work with high exposure claims involving litigation and rehabilitation; to ensure ongoing adjudication of claims within company standards, industry best practices and specific client service requirements; and to manage subrogation of claims and negotiate settlements. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS and RESPONSIBILITIES Analyzes and processes complex or technically difficult claims by investigating and gathering information to determine the exposure on the claim; manages claims through well-developed action plans to an appropriate and timely resolution.  Assesses liability and resolve claims within evaluation.  Negotiates settlement of claims up to designated authority level.  Calculates and assigns timely and appropriate reserves to claims; monitors reserve adequacy throughout the life of the claim.  Calculates and pays benefits due; approves and makes timely claim payments and adjustments; and settles claims within designated authority level.  Prepares necessary state filings within statutory limits.  Manages the litigation process; ensures timely and cost effective claims resolution.  Coordinates vendor referrals for additional investigation and/or litigation management.  Uses appropriate cost containment techniques including strategic vendor partnerships to reduce overall cost of claims for our clients.  Manages claim recoveries, including but not limited to subrogation, Second Injury Fund recoveries and Social Security offsets.  Reports claims to the excess carrier; responds to requests of directions in a professional and timely manner.  Communicates claim activity and processing with the ill or injured party and the client; maintains professional client relationships.  Ensures claim files are properly documented and claims coding is correct.  Refers cases as appropriate to supervisor and management.  Maintains a quality assurance program to support the total performance management initiative and the consistent delivery of quality claims service.  QUALIFICATIONS Education & Licensing Baccalaureate degree from an accredited college or university preferred. Licenses as required. Professional certification as applicable to line of business preferred. Experience Four (4) years of claims management experience required. Skills & Knowledge In-depth knowledge of appropriate insurance principles and laws for line-of-business handled, recoveries offsets and deductions, claim and disability duration, cost containment principles including medical management practices and Social Security application procedures as applicable to line-of-business.  Excellent oral and written communication, including presentation skills  PC literate, including Microsoft Office products  Analytical and interpretive skills  Strong organizational skills  Excellent negotiating skills  Good interpersonal skills  Ability to work in a team environment  Ability to meet or exceed Performance Competencies WORK ENVIRONMENT When applicable and appropriate, consideration will be given to reasonable accommodations. Mental: Clear and conceptual thinking ability; excellent judgment, troubleshooting, problem solving, analysis, and discretion; ability to handle work-related stress; ability to handle multiple priorities simultaneously; and ability to meet deadlines Physical: Computer keyboarding, travel as required Auditory/Visual: Hearing, vision and talking NOTE : Credit security clearance, confirmed via a background credit check, is required for this position. The statements contained in this document are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by a colleague assigned to this description. They are not intended to constitute a comprehensive list of functions, duties, or local variances. Management retains the discretion to add or to change the duties of the position at any time. Sedgwick CMS is an Equal Opportunity Employer and a  Drug-Free Workplace Additional Information:  Must have California Self-Insurers Certificate (SIP) or AB1262 California Experienced Examiner Designation or currently meet the requirements for designation under AB1262. WCCA, WCCP preferred.  Sedgwick CMS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, sexual orientation, age, marital status, medical condition, disability or any other legally protected status.
ONETName: Claims Examiners, Property and Casualty Insurance

jobText: Job Title: Program Aide (CNA) - Morning Star (On-Call/PRN)  Closing Date/Time: Continuous  Salary: $11.00 Hourly Job Type: Temporary Location: Aurora, Colorado Department: Parks, Recreation and Open Space |  Performs specialized support and care functions for the adults participating in the day care program at the Morning Star adult care facility. Primary Duties and Responsibilities:  Provides participants with assistance in personal care needs; takes an active role in planning, leading, monitoring and setting up a variety of activities such as arts/crafts, games, music, exercises, physical activities, special events and community excursions; maintains a safe and positive environment for all activities; assist participants with personal care, including feeding, walking, transfers, and bathroom use; may interface with physician oversight concerning client medications; performs kitchen duties (snack preparation/cleaning), driving, and performs additional duties as assigned. Maintains a thorough knowledge of day program policies and procedures & enforces these consistently and fairly. Assists front desk as needed and assists participants with meals and snacks. Performs other duties as assigned. Minimum Qualifications:  EDUCATION: High school diploma or GED. Completion of Certified Nursing Assistant course with current Colorado Certification.  LICENSES, CERTIFICATES, OR EQUIPMENT REQUIRED: Colorado Driver's License. MUST HAVE CURRENT Colorado CERTIFIED NURSING ASSISTANT LICENSE. Ability to obtain the following within the first six months of employment: certification in CPR, completion of training course and competency evaluation in medication administration; training in transfers (provided by department staff). This position may require the incumbent to occasionally use personal equipment (e.g. vehicle, cell phone, tools, etc.) in the course of their employment.  EXPERIENCE: At least one year of related experience working with elderly and /or special needs clients. An equivalent combination of education, training and experience that demonstrates required knowledge, skills and abilities may be considered.  KNOWLEDGE: Knowledge of personal care and needs of senior and special needs adults. Knowledge of geriatric programs issues and needs, various disabilities such as: Alzheimer's/dementia, mental health issues, developmental disabilities, a plus.  SKILLS: Strong leadership, interpersonal and customer service skills. Flexibility, good initiative, problem-solving and judgement.  ABILITIES: Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with employees, participants and citizens; provide prompt, courteous service to the public. Ability to handle sensitive or difficult situations with tact and diplomacy. Requires flexibility, excellent communication skills, written and verbal, plus problem solving and decision-making skills. Ability to follow instructions, promptly and efficiently. Applicant must be reliable, enthusiastic, creative, and able to manage behaviors, motivate and inspire participants. Applicant must have reliable transportation to the work site. Working Conditions:  PHYSICAL CONDITIONS: Light to Moderate physical work; requires the ability to lift a maximum of 50 pounds; lifting, carrying, walking and standing; especially in transferring participants from a wheelchair to the toilet and from the chair to a wheelchair; occasional eye/hand coordination to operate equipment; vision for reading, recording and interpreting information; frequent speech communication and hearing to maintain communication with other employees, vendors, program participants, caregivers, and citizens.  WORK ENVIRONMENT: Works primarily in clean, comfortable environment.  EQUIPMENT USED: Standard business and professional equipment and tools associated with the services being provided. Agency: City of Aurora Address: 15151 E. Alameda Parkway Aurora, Colorado 80012-1555  Phone: (303) 739-7225 Web Site: | |  Copyright 2000-2011 GovernmentJobs. All rights reserved.

jobText: AT&T is at the center of the communication revolution. We are the number one wireless company in America and the largest telecommunications and entertainment company in the universe! You're part techno guru, part social butterfly. You are made for AT&T. You're outgoing. You have amazing energy. You love to talk about cool technology. Well, we have customers waiting to speak with you. As a Retail Sales Consultant, you'll get to know our communication and entertainment technology inside and out. And you'll be the one everyone else looks to when it comes to what's next in wireless and wired technology solutions. It's good to be the guru. We offer: Exciting career paths that lead to new opportunities and financial rewards. Competitive pay (base plus commission) - hourly pay $12.89, but Retail Sales Consultants can earn $1,200 or more per month in commission by meeting and/or exceeding sales objectives! Excellent benefits (401k, tuition reimbursement, paid time off, medical/dental and more!) Top-notch on-going training on the latest technology A fun, fast paced work environment Job Description: Sells all products and services offered by the Company. Meet all sales objectives. Handle all administrative aspects of the sale including: completing customer contracts and warranties, pulling products from inventory, accepting customer payments and filing the completed orders. Maintain strong knowledge of all Company products, accessories, pricing plans, promotions, and service features. Maintain knowledge of competitive offers and provide critical market feedback to the Store Manager regarding local competition and product/service needs. Handle service inquiries from customers. Provides efficient, courteous customer service and assistance in all aspects of product offerings and services. Qualifications Required Qualifications: If you enjoyâ Using competitive spirit to meet and exceed assigned sales goals Staying up-to-date on the latest data/entertainment technology and devices, such as Wi-Fi, data devices, TV entertainment tools Understanding customers' needs and helping them discover how our products meet those needs Multi-tasking in a fast paced team environment Working a variety of hours including weekends, evenings and holidays involving occasional overtime Educating and engaging customers through product demonstrations Interacting with customers and providing prompt and courteous customer service to all customers in person, via phone or written note Position may be commissioned and quota based Then this may be the job for you. The successful candidate will be able to perform the following with or without reasonable accommodation: Ability to work flexible hours, including evenings, weekends and holidays Ability to stand for long periods of time Ability to complete all paperwork completely, accurately, in a timely manner Ability to lift up to 25 pounds Ability to operate a personal computer, wireless equipment, copier and fax Ability to work in other locations as the needs of the business dictate may be required.  Complete all aspects of opening and closing the store in accordance with written procedures. Submit all transaction journals on a daily basis.  Assists with inventory maintenance May be required to wear a uniform Desired Qualifications: 1-3 years retail/customer facing/sales experience preferred. DELETE THOSE NOT APPLICABLE : Ability to interface with customers in both English and Spanish preferred Ability to interface with customers in both English and Spanish required Will be assigned to float between store locations. Must be able to work at various locations regularly and as needed Provisions listed in these Job Descriptions may be changed or modified by AT&T Mobility without prior notice at any time, at the Company's sole discretion. MORE Jobs Members Featured Groups Sr. Aircraft Systems Analyst  Company Name: QinetiQ North America Systems Engineering Group Job Title: Sr. Aircraft Systems Analyst Job Code: 20506-2011 Location: ,  35806  Job Description: QinetiQ North America, Inc., Systems Engineering Group delivers systems engineering and integration, software development, logistics information management, training systems management, information technology services, and test and evaluation support for the development, modification, fielding and sustainment of military equipment and systems. Our core competencies include: Enterprise IT Services Logistics Solutions/Life-Cycle Support  Programmatic Services  Security Solutions  Software Development & Integration  Systems Engineering & Integration  Test & Evaluation Training Solutions Summary: Perform duties as an aircraft avionics subject matter expert (SME) for the MH-47G helicopter. Review, modify and create technically accurate data for incorporation into the MH-47G Avionics and Maintenance Interactive Electronic Technical Manuals (IETMs) and flight manual suite. Research and resolve technical data discrepancies. This position is located in Huntsville, AL. Duties and Responsibilities: Review change data for diagnostic, operational check, visual check, and maintenance work packages for technical accuracy. Review change data for wiring diagrams, block diagrams, and system schematics for technical accuracy. Review change data for Repair Parts and Special Tools List (RPSTL) work packages for technical accuracy. Create new or modify existing data to be technically accurate and to standard from Block Modifications, Publication Change Request (PCRs), Engineering Change Proposals (ECPs) and Modification Work Orders (MWOs). Participate in the verification of data during table top reviews. Review, identify, and remove existing technical data found to be in error in Army Aviation Technical Manuals using the PCR process. Perform assigned tasks and other duties assigned with little to no supervision.  Identify Continuous Improvement Opportunities for QinetiQ-NA policies, procedures and practices and Government processes. Works as a consulting team member or an individual consultant on implementation, enhancement, integration, or support projects. Duties usually performed at customer?s site. Operates under minimal supervision on medium to large size projects involving multiple products and/or platforms. Works on medium to large-sized (sites/locations), single or multi-effort projects, usually with multiple computer environments where design is complex: Analyzes customers' business requirements and application objectives; develops an application design in products to meet customers' needs. Estimates time frames, quality and quantity of resources required to successfully implement project; develops project plan incorporating all project variables. Sees that appropriate company resources are assigned to complete project tasks according to plan. Establishes criteria concerning deliverability, performance, maintenance, design and costs. Conducts periodic status checks with customers and team to assess progress against plan. Performs re-forecasts of project variables as necessary throughout project. Prepares weekly status reports on all project activities. Serves as senior-level pre-sales and post-sales technical support specialist when needed. Acts as a liaison between customers and company. Coordinates project resources according to the plan. Provides guidance to other consultants regarding medium to large-sized implementation and retainer projects. Provides technical guidance to technical support staff. Design complexity may vary from fairly straight forward to moderately complex, with single or multiple products and involve multiple computer environments. Able to serve effectively as liaison between company and customers. Excellent communication, presentation, organizational and planning skills. Excellent interpersonal skills to work as a team member and customer liaison. Proficient PC skills. Available for extensive travel as required. Bachelor's degree in business, marketing, sales or computer science. Advanced degree desirable. Typically Qualifications Requires five to seven years of experience in software design, technical product support, or consulting. B.S. degree preferred but not required. Minimum of 10 years experience as an avionic mechanic on Army Special Operations MH-47E/G helicopters is required Computing Skills : Excellent basic computer knowledge is required along with the following specific skills (in order of importance). Adobe Acrobat - excellent skills. Database software applications (MS Access or better) - excellent skills. Spreadsheets (MS Excel) - excellent skills. Word processing (MS Word) - excellent skills. Presentations (MS PowerPoint) - excellent skills. Analytical Skills: Synthesize complex or diverse information; collects and researches data; utilizes intuition and experience to complement data.  Ability to work independently, as well as in a team environment, and make decisions to accomplish assigned tasks. Able to analyze, prioritize and accomplish multiple tasks in a dynamic environment and accomplish customer requirements against allocated constraints. Leadership and Communication Skills: Provide professional customer support. Speak clearly and persuasively in positive or negative situations. Listen and seek clarifications; respond well to questions. Write clearly and informatively; vary writing style to meet needs.  Solicit and apply customer feedback (internally and externally). Ability to work with others as a team to accomplish set goals. Improve processes, products, and services. Find ways to improve and promote quality; demonstrate accuracy and thoroughness. Security: Requires a SECRET clearance in accordance with the National Industrial Security Program Operating Manual (NISPOM).  Personnel will be subject to all Security regulations, rules, and policies of the Government facility.  Physical Demands:  The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  While performing the duties of this job, the employee requires normal manual dexterity, speech and hearing. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 30 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job require frequent use of a computer monitor.  Work Environment:  The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Back to prior page Printable Format Job Description - Liability Claims Administrator (11943) Job Description Liability Claims Administrator - 11943 Primary Location Minnesota-Chanhassen Description Purpose The purpose of this position is to minimize financial loss resulting from liability claims made against the company. This position is responsible for providing quality oversight claim management to the completion of each claim in a timely, cost effective manner.  Job Responsibilities and Accountabilities Works directly with third party administrator to ensure quality claim management in the resolution of each claim Conduct periodic and ongoing claim reviews to ensure the file is reserved appropriately, documented timely, and that the TPA has implemented an aggressive action plan to resolve each claim in a timely and cost effective manner Liaison to third party administrator adjusting staff on all files to include file reviews and granting of settlement authority as needed; final decision maker on settlement vs trial Acts as a liaison between defense counsel, corporate legal and business units on litigated proceedings. Work with manager to help identify adverse trends and mitigate exposures Responsible for claims oversight for assigned Geographical area. Handles and resolves issues arising from the handling of GL claims by the Third Party Claims Administrator (TPA) on behalf of SUPERVALU, Inc.  Discuss strategies with TPA's claims technicians and Corporate Legal on serious, high exposure claims and other complex technical claim handling issues.  Leads the claim review process for business unit Participates/conducts the quarterly TPA performance guarantee audit Assists the department manager and director in the training and coaching of the TPA adjusting staff, instructing them in the proper performance of work while familiarizing them with company procedures, expectations and guidelines. Ensure compliance with Medicare Secondary Payer Reporting. Assists Risk Control in completing the RCM yearly evaluations by providing performance feedback with respect to management of claims and adherence to claim management practices and programs. Evaluate defense counsel on an ongoing basis to ensure that they continue to meet SUPERVALU's business needs Act as liaison between TPA and field locations Partner with safety and risk control to help identify adverse trends and mitigate exposures Continues to review corporate claim processes to improve efficiencies  Oversight responsibility for approximately $60 million in outstanding claim liability  May assumes the manager's duties in the absence of the manager. Scope Indirectly leads mentors and trains TPA Claims Adjusters and SV field personnel. Settlement authority of $XXX Oversight responsibility for approximately $60 million in outstanding claim liability Job Requirements Relevant Experience, Education, Certification, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities  Bachelor's degree preferred, High school diploma required.  Minimum 5 years of General Liability Claim experience. Prior experience managing litigation of GL/AL Claims preferred. Multi-state GL experiences a plus. Prior experience in a self insured environment preferred Experience with personal computer applications and claim systems required. Experience with applicable computer applications is required Exhibit excellent communications skills, both verbal and written.  Possess ability to work with and through others to achieve desired results Ability to organize and prioritize workload is essential Must be able to handle confidential information in a mature and professional manner while using sound judgment and discretion in processing claims and assisting the adjusting staff Strong ability to strategize and prioritize Willing to continue education to keep apprised of latest industry statutory laws and trends.  Physical Environment Some travel is required Most work is performed in a temperature-controlled office environment Incumbent may sit for long periods of time at desk or computer terminal Incumbent may use calculators, keyboards, telephone, and other office equipment in the course of normal workday Stooping, bending, twisting, and reaching may be required in completion of job duties Why Work for SUPERVALU?  As the third-largest grocery retailer in the nation, we know that bright, motivated people are the reason for our success. Because of our associates, we've been providing the best service to our customers for more than 135 years. We encourage fresh thinking, offer an environment of inclusion and support, and set no boundaries on your achievement! A GREAT PLACE TO GROW The above statements are intended to describe the general nature of the work performed by the employees assigned to this job. All employees must comply with Company policy and applicable laws. The responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel so classified may vary within each department and/or location. As an Assistant Restaurant Manager, youâll be an important member of the management team. Youâll tackle a whole host of restaurant responsibilities with the help of your team. And with enough time, training and experience, youâll have the tools to take that next step towards making it big.  Responsibilities: Ensures the delivery on the Customer Promise through managing the daily operations of a restaurant  Manages financial controls, operations, people development, customer service and compliance across shifts for desired restaurant outcomes (i.e., increased sales, profitability and employee retention)  Full accountability for restaurant operations in the absence of the Restaurant General Manager or Senior Assistant Manager  Directs efficient and accurate preparation and sale of products for prompt customer delivery within the established speed of service guidelines  Motivates and directs team members and Hourly Shift Coordinators to exceed customer expectations with food and friendly service in clean surroundings  Supervises and trains team members and Shift Coordinators on team stations, products, processes and policies  Manages cash control/security procedures and implements marketing plans, maintain inventory, manage labor, and apply financial reports across shifts to enhance restaurant results  Enforces compliance with government regulations, Market Policy, employment laws, food safety, National Security Policy, operations and policies and procedures relating to all restaurant activities across shifts  Recruits, selects, hires and retains effective team talent. OPS - Warehouse Shipping 12pm - 8:30p Tracking Code 304000-797  Job Description Medline Industries, Inc. has an immediate opening for a  Warehouse Shipping Associate . We are seeking a dynamic, hard-working people. A desire to work for a fast-paced, large corporate organization is a plus. In addition you must have a "roll-up your sleeves" attitude. The challenging responsibilities of the position include: Reads production schedule, customer order, work order, shipping order, or requisition to determine items to be moved, gathered, or distributed.  Conveys materials and items from receiving or production areas to storage or to other designated areas. Sorts and places materials or items on racks, shelves, or in bins according to predetermined sequence such as size, type, style, color, or product code.  Fills requisitions, work orders, or requests for materials, tools, or other stock items and distributes items to production workers or assembly line.  Assembles customer orders from stock and places orders on pallets or shelves, or conveys orders to packing station or shipping department.  Marks materials with identifying information.  Opens bales, crates, and other containers.  Housekeeping duties including all forms of warehouse cleanup not limited to waste, wood, general refuse disposal, wiping, wet and dry cleaning, sweeping and/or mopping inside and outside. Records amounts of materials or items received or distributed.  Weighs or counts items for distribution within plant to ensure conformance to company standards.  Arranges stock parts in specified sequence for assembly by other workers.  Compiles worksheets or tickets from customer specifications.  Operates hand truck, cart, dollies, forklift, "man-up" order-picker, and walkie to transport stored items from warehouse to plant or to pick up items from several locations for shipment.  In return, Medline offers a business casual, entrepreneurial work environment with strong growth potential; a competitive compensation package; along with a complete benefits package including medical/dental/vision/life insurance; education assistance; 401(k) with company match and much more! The required skills for this position are: High school diploma or general education degree (GED). One to three months related experience and/or training. Equivalent combination of education and experience. Ability to speak, read, and write English with proficiency.  Ability to read and comprehend simple instructions, short correspondence, and memos.  Basic keypunch skills needed. Medline Industries, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action and Drug Free Employer. Job Location Middletown, NY, US. Job  details Job details Job 1 of 1  Req ID 187981BR Industry Job Title ET-III, ATC Comm (VSAT) Technician Standard Job Code/Title E2393:Network Monitorng Anlyst Sr Required skills US citizen with a Department of Defense SECRET security clearance (selected applicant will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information). Must have a valid US driver's license with photo. Must have extensive and thorough knowledge of the principles of electricity and electronics, and shop supervision, including shop practices and techniques. Must have thorough knowledge of electronic and electrical circuitry. Must have the ability to interpret and work from blueprints, drawings, schematics, manuals, handbooks and technical specifications. Must have prior supervisory experience. Candidate must also have a minimum of five (5) years of experience in electronics repair, maintenance and testing of ATC Communications systems and a minimum of three (3) years electronic repair, maintenance and testing of the ATC Communications systems identified elsewhere in the SOW. Specific Job Description Lockheed Martin Global Training and Logistics is looking for an Electronics Technician III -Air Traffic Control (ATC) Communications Very Small Aperture Terminal (VSAT) Technician, to demonstrate advanced technical knowledge to solve unusually complex problems (i.e., those that cannot be solved by reference to manufacturers' manuals or similar documents) in working electronic equipment and support Air Traffic Control ACC radio infrastructure through-out Afghanistan air space. The ET-III will provide technical guidance and supervision to lower level technicians. Perform preventive maintenance on ATC radio systems and related equipment. Inspect equipment at specified intervals determining operational status. Replace defective components. Perform operational checks. Maintain inspection and maintenance records. Maintain Facilities Status Records (e.g.: AFTO 499, 512, 514, etc.). Independently verify operational condition of Control tower Facilities and integrated system to be within prescribed parameters IAQ supporting Technical Orders/Manuals or directive (commercial manuals, FAA Orders, etc.). Receive familiarization training on newly installed equipment, which may consist of CM-200 Ground to Air Radio, Enhanced Terminal Voice Switch and a DoD/FAA Voice Recorder. Specific training will be provided by the government.  Technicians will also have experience working with ATC VSAT systems. These systems include: performing preventative maintenance on ATC VSAT equipment, replacing defective components, configuring/reconfiguring ATC VSAT networks. On site ATC VSAT familiarization training will be provided by the government during VSAT installation. The government will provide intitial off-site training for ATC VSAT programming, management and installation.  Requirements: US citizen with a Department of Defense SECRET security clearance (selected applicant will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information). Must have a valid US driver's license with photo. Must have extensive and thorough knowledge of the principles of electricity and electronics, and shop supervision, including shop practices and techniques. Must have thorough knowledge of electronic and electrical circuitry. Must have the ability to interpret and work from blueprints, drawings, schematics, manuals, handbooks and technical specifications. Must have prior supervisory experience. Candidate must also have a minimum of five (5) years of experience in electronics repair, maintenance and testing of ATC Communications systems and a minimum of three (3) years electronic repair, maintenance and testing of the ATC Communications systems identified elsewhere in the SOW.  Education: HS Graduate OR Completion trade school AND attended an FAA or DOD electronics or industrial course OR successfully completed an accredited correspondence course.  In addition to Lockheed Martin's competitive salaries, employees receive incentive bonuses (Sign-on and Completion), Travel and Foreign Area Living Allowances, and Department of State hardship and danger uplifts; coupled together these calculate into a very appealing total compensation package. Standard Job Description Monitors satellite network usage and capacity. Identifies and recommends solutions for smooth continuing operation of network as capacity needs change. Makes corrections to network configurations to ensure efficient operation. Monitors and documents traffic analysis. Monitors all hardware components to ensure terrestrial and possible satellite network communication facilities are operating at optimum levels. Security Clearance Secret Typical Minimums Bachelors degree from an accredited college in a related discipline, or equivalent experience/combined education, with 5 years of professional experience; or 3 years of professional experience with a related Masters degree. Considered career, or journey, level. Industrial Sales Management  Kayline Company  | Job Reference:  cbus  Location:  Columbus, oh  Salary:  $25,000 - $40,000  Education:  College  Experience:  1 to 3 years  Job Type:  Full-Time  Date Posted:  Sep 1 2011  |  Job Description  THE KAYLINE COMPANY Entry Level Industrial Sales Opportunity PROFESSIONAL BUILDING MAINTENANCE PRODUCTS Want to work a local territory for a stable regional business? The Kayline Company is a 116 year old distributor of the highest quality specialty chemical and energy saving lighting products in America.  By marketing both specialty chemicals and lighting products we set ourselves apart from our competition by offering one stop shopping for most maintenance departments.  We are a company run by individuals who started their careers in field sales. We therefore know and understand the sales process and understand what salespeople need to succeed. We offer a small company atmosphere providing the individual attention you desire. We are leaders that use innovative programs to market our products directly to maintenance people, house keepers and property managers and have the products that solve the problems they face every day.  Because of the nature of our product line, we enjoy repeat sales, monthly from most of our accounts. Recent market conditions in Columbus have created an outstanding entry level opportunity to build a book of business providing the financial security you desire. If you are a results salesperson with hunter characteristics, proven closing skills and are ready to take the next step in income and career, our sales program will get you there.  We seek experience in our industry or an account specialist with 2 years experience in uniform sales, fastener sales or other local outside sales. Qualified candidates must demonstrate successful skill sets for opening new business and strong organizational skills. If you desire the freedom to work independently and be compensated for your results we urge you to contact us. We provide expert field training and support along with the industries top compensation package including salary during training. Tired of fake promises? Check out our website  email resume to  or call 800 426-5820  Benefits  Company Profile  Originally a gas lantern manufacturer, the Kayline Company began operations in 1895 in Cleveland Ohio. Kayline Company markets top quality building maintenance products and energy saving long life lighting to customers across the country.  Kayline's reputation as a leader in innovation and environmental alternatives has built a strong reputation of excellence throughout industry. All our products are rated heavy duty industrial and are marketed to professional maintenance and housekeeping departments. Our products feature advanced design, energy efficiency and environmental concern. We sell directly to the end user and we are one of the only companies that sell both chemicals and lighting, thus we provide one stop shopping for our customers maintenance needs. At the Kayline Company,  Every day is a commitment to excellence. |

Title:  IT Auditor Company: PSOC  Location: Salisbury, NC  Type: Full Time Fax Resume to: Duties and Responsibilities:  Executes IT Audit activities, procedures and work steps of application systems, general computer controls, and system development reviews as assigned by IT Audit Manager. Participate on process improvement teams and assist with the design of business process and information technology work processes. Prepare Audit report drafts of findings and conclusions while offering recommendations in presentation and written reports to management. Assists the IT Audit Manager with participation in special projects by conducting specific and technical review/investigation activities. Works with integrated Audit teams to execute IT Audit steps. Skill in using a personal computer with word processing, spreadsheet and other business software to prepare reports, memos, summaries and analysis. Approximately 25% travel required, some overnight. Education, Experience, and Skills Required: MUST have current or recent work experience as an IT Auditor. Bachelor's Degree from an accredited college or university. CISA, CISSP or CIA certification. Working knowledge of the Standards for the Professional Practice of Internal Auditing and the Code of Ethics developed by the Institute of Internal Audits. Working knowledge of generally accepted IT Audit standards, statements, practices, IT Security and control practices. Working knowledge of information technology terminology, concepts, and practices. Skill in assessing the effectiveness of internal controls over key IT risks, identifying significant exposures, analyzing information technology processes and detecting changes in key risk and/or control effectiveness. Working knowledge of distributed technology (i.e. UNIX/Sybase, Windows NT), web-based technology, and basic infrastructure control issues. Skill in collecting and analyzing complex data, evaluating information and systems and drawing logical conclusions. Ability to demonstrate effective verbal and written communication skills, including active listening and presentation of findings and recommendations. U.S. Work Eligibility: U.S. Citizen or Permanent Resident The above information, including salary details if indicated, is subject to change at any time and without notice, and is not an offer of employment. By replying to this job posting, you are not considered an applicant for employment unless you are so advised by the hiring firm.  Note: NEVER disclose your Social Security Number, Credit Card Number, Bank Account Information or other related Personal Information to any prospective employer or staffing firm unless you clearly understand the need.

Back to prior page Printable Format Job Description - C& I Account Manager âUtility Sponsored Energy Efficiency Program (1000001041) Job Description C& I Account Manager âUtility Sponsored Energy Efficiency Program ( Job Number: 1000001041 ) Description Energy, Environment & Transportation Energy Efficiency Division South Carolina About ICF International ICF International (NASDAQ:ICFI) partners with government and commercial clients to deliver professional services and technology solutions in the energy and climate change; environment and infrastructure; health, human services, and social programs; and homeland security and defense markets. The firm combines passion for its work with industry expertise and innovative analytics to produce compelling results throughout the entire program life cycle, from research and analysis through implementation and improvement. Since 1969, ICF has been serving government at all levels, major corporations, and multilateral institutions. More than 3,500 employees serve these clients worldwide. ICF's Web site is  www.icfi.com . ICF's Energy, Environment & Transportation group offers results and solutions to a broad range of clients in the energy industry in the Americas, Europe, and Asia. We have advised both private and public sector clients in all facets of the energy industry for more than 30 years. ICF International provides a portfolio of strategy, analysis, advisory services, and implementation tools to clients in the energy sector. Long recognized for innovative solutions, ICF International's combination of strategic, policy, risk management, market, and industry expertise enables us to advise clients from the inception of their business plan through the delivery of services to their customers. ICF is one of the nation's premier organizations in the development and implementation of innovative demand management strategies-including energy efficiency, demand response, smart grid, and peak load management-for energy companies, governments, and commercial clients. Our experts provide outstanding depth and breadth of experience and have completed hundreds of successful assignments associated with some of the most complex, far-reaching, and high-visibility market transformation programs in the country. For more than 20 years, ICF has provided cutting-edge marketing, technical, and project management services to promote energy efficiency, both domestically and internationally. We work with dozens of utilities on such programs and extend a full scope of services to the U.S. Department of Energy and U.S. Environmental Protection Agency's ENERGY STAR ® programs. Job Description: ICF is adding staff to its energy efficiency team in our Southeast Region to support a wide range of energy efficiency programs. Our clients include utilities, recognizable Fortune 500 global corporations, as well as a variety of industry, and Government organizations. We are seeking an established Account Manager to take a significant role in the implementation of programs that will deliver and expand our offerings in the Southeast. You should have the unique combination of interpersonal and analytical skill that will make you a critical member of our team from the day you arrive. We place a premium on creativity, an ability to work independently when necessary but to function as part of a team, a drive to succeed, and a commitment to client satisfaction. Qualifications Key Responsibilities: Working in support of various utility sponsored programs that encourage energy-efficiency and renewable energy in commercial industrial, and government markets.  Ideal candidates will have a strong interest in energy or resource efficiency and an understanding of utility markets.  Recruiting program participants (customers and trade allies), account management, developing and implementing sales strategies, preparing and delivering persuasive presentations, relationship building activities.  Basic Qualifications: A Bachelor's degree and 5+ years of experience managing successful energy efficiency programs, with specific expertise in commercial, industrial, and government energy issues.  5+ years with the commercial, industrial, and government markets, various customer facilities and energy systems and with energy efficient and renewable technologies.  Experience tracking state/local and national energy policies  Experience providing partners with technical and marketing assistance  Preferred Skills/Experience: Economic analysis and familiarity with DSM program planning and evaluation  Utility experience and understanding of DSM program implementation  Experience with ENERGY STAR, LEED, and other program platforms  Ability to prioritize and multi-task, and work under strict deadlines.  Outstanding analytical, writing, and communication skills and excellent interpersonal and self-motivation skills  Professional Skills: Team player with the ability to work in a fast-paced environment  Sound business ethics, including the protection of proprietary and confidential information  Ability to work with all levels of internal staff, as well as outside clients and vendors  Proficiency in MS Office Applications (Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, Excel)  ICF offers an excellent benefits package, an award winning talent development program, and fosters a highly skilled, energized and empowered workforce. ICF International is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer - M/F/D/V For a listing of other career opportunities at ICF, please visit our Career Center at  Send this job to a friend Send this job description to a friend by email. jobText: / / Package Handler - Part-Time Package Handler - Part-Time at UPS in South San Francisco CA Full-Time Jobs in Oakland California Job Group:  Manual Operations Timing:  Sunrise (3:30 AM - 8:30 AM) UPS is hiring individuals to work as  part-time Package Handlers . Part-time employees usually work 3 ½ - 4 hours each weekday (Monday through Friday) and typically do not work on weekends or selected holidays. Package Handlers receive an hourly rate of $8.50 â$9.50. UPS part-time employees also receive an attractive benefits package. jobText: Report It Job DescriptionÂ Octapharma Plasma is seeking a high energy technical leader to manage its IT Operations team. The IT Operations Team Leader has responsibility for leading a team composed of Windows server and network engineers. These engineers are responsible for new technology projects including: requirements gathering, design, Bill of Materials creation, implementation planning, maintaining a stable environment, and providing a point of escalation for trouble tickets. Octapharma Plasma operates in an Active Directory environment of roughly 100 servers which are a mix of physical and virtual servers. The Octapharma Plasma network is an MPLS network operating on an exclusively Cisco platform of switches, routers, firewalls and Call Manager/Unity/Presence servers. There is frequent communication with other technical teams in the Octapharma worldwide organization. The successful candidate will have prior experience providing hands on technical support and design/implement skills in a Cisco environment, familiarity with Microsoft Active Directory, project leadership experience, and current experience defining, driving, and improving technical architecture, internal process, and performance.  The Octapharma Plasma environment is extremely fast paced and dynamic in support of our Company’s mission. As part of the IT leadership team, the candidate will help to define and plan projects to improve our use of technology, reduce costs for technology services, and provide creative solutions to problems observed in our fleet of donation centers. As a technical leader, the Team Leader must also be able to play the role of player/coach, able to contribute at a technical level in their area of expertise if required, but also able to provide the leadership necessary for the infrastructure services provided by IT. Job RequirementsÂ Minimum of 2 years of recent managerial experience leading a technical team that includes: budget setting and budget management, performance management, capital project formulation, strategy setting, and hiring and development  Ability to interact within the organization to listen, develop, and formulate organizational support for technology projects and to ensure all elements of the organization are aware of proposed technology projects  Current Cisco certification  Experience developing and negotiating contracts and service agreements  Experience with maintaining an IT Change Control process  Work in a Regulated environment is a plus  Report It CareerBuilder.com's Advice For your , when applying to a job online: Never give your social security number to a prospective employer, provide credit card or bank account information, or perform any sort of monetary transaction. Powered by SuccessFactors Career Opportunities: HR Manager HR Manager  RockTenn Folding Carton Eutaw, AL RockTenn, following the acquisition of Smurfit-Stone Container Corporation in May 2011, is one of North Americaâs leading manufacturers of paperboard, containerboard and consumer and corrugated packaging and one of the worldâs largest paper recyclers, with annualized net sales of approximately $10 billion. Based in Atlanta, GA, we operate 245 facilities in the United States, Canada, Mexico, Chile, Argentina and China. We have an opportunity for an HR Manager for our Eutaw and Livingston Folding Carton Plants. The Human Resources Manager has the overall responsibility for general management, strategic planning, tactical responsibilities and coordination of services for the facilityâs HR Function. This position directs the planning, development, implementation and evaluation of a diverse range of policies and procedures, in support of the facilities established mission and goals. The HR Manager will work closely with the local General Manager, Plant Manager, and Supervisors to manage employee relations, performance issues, and progressive discipline. Will participate in monthly HR divisional team conference call and interact regularly with divisional HR team on matters involving law and Company policy.  ESSENTIAL DUTIES and RESPONSIBILITIES Ø Responsible for compliance with all applicable Federal and State Laws including EEO, FMLA, HIPAA, ADA, and Collective Bargaining. Ø Handles complaints, settles disputes, resolves conflicts, and conducts internal investigations. Ø Conducts periodic training on applicable topics including anti-harassment and diversity.  Ø Responsible for meeting the staffing needs of the organization. This includes the selection, testing, and hiring of employees as well as conducting new employee orientation. Ø Responsible for analyzing training needs, determining how to deliver the training needs. Ø Responsible for the administrative aspects of the human resources function including maintaining records and confidential employee files, and providing statistical and regulatory reporting. Ø Coordinates labor relations activities including contract interpretation and grievance administration. Handles complaints, settles disputes, resolves grievances and conflicts, and conducts internal investigative procedures.  Ø In conjunction with divisional HR team, researches and implements policy recommendations and changes to General Manager and Leadership Team.  Ø Consults and advises Leadership Team on topics of interest that could have impact employee morale. Required Experience: Ø Bachelor's degree and 5 -10 years of Human Resource experience, manufacturing experience preferred  Ø Maintain thorough, accurate documentation and records for all employee matters  Ø Strong customer service orientation Ø Ability to hear issues on employee conflicts and solve such issues using a variety of methods and tools Ø Complaint resolution lifecycle experience including investigations  Ø Skilled in areas of strategic planning, problem solving, coaching and conflict resolution Ø Driving Performance Management cycle and systems  Ø Development of training systems  Ø Responsible for all day-to-day employee relations activities  Ø Requires excellent written and oral communication Ø Skilled user of Microsoft Office Ø Strong organizational, analytical and project management skills Ø Exposure to Health and Safety processes and programs  Ø PHR or SPHR certification preferred  Apply Save Job Email Job to Friend Return to List Email this job to a friend The job has been sent to  Please provide the information below  Job title:  * Your email address:  * Your friend's email address:  Message:  Verification code:  * Please enter the verification code here:  Send Cancel

Category  HUMAN RESOURCES  Location  Portland, Seattle  Work Status  Full Time  HR Consultant - Organizational Strategy #18688  Description  Open until filled, level 19, reports to 606244  The Senior HRC is a member of an HR team of business partners assigned to divisions to provide advanced consultation and functional support in the areas of talent management, training, performance management, workforce adjustment and employee relations for our Regence brand.  Combine your degree and HR management experience with the following skills and abilities:  Normally, to be proficient in the competencies listed above, the incumbent would have at least a Bachelor's Degree in Human Resource, Business Management or a related field-Masters degree preferred. 7 or more years of experience with increasing responsibility in the areas of strategic workforce planning, organizational effectiveness and design and broad-based talent management strategies and tactics. HR experience in the health care insurance industry preferred PHR or SPHR including project management and broad business knowledge/experience desired.  Skills and abilities needed for success:  Solid Generalist experience, preferably in a highly matrixed and complex culture.  Thorough knowledge of federal and state employment laws and regulations and their application i.e., Title VII, EEO/AA, FLSA, FMLA, ADA  Knowledge of compensation administration principles and procedures  Ability to make administrative and procedural decisions and judgments on sensitive, confidential issues  Ability to present educational programs and/or workshops  Provide on-the-job and technical guidance and training to staff  Analyze, develop, establish and maintain efficient office workflow and administrative processes  Excellence in written and verbal communication as well as strong influencing skills  Demonstrated project management, consultative and analytical skills  Strong interpersonal and communication skills and the ability to work effectively with all levels of management and staff including C level leadership.  Strong computer skills i.e. MS Office, HRIS etc  Ability to work in a matrixed organization and be skilled in communicating effectively to multiple HR team members at various levels of assignment and authority.

Skills:  Data Analysis, Data Management, Data Structures, Data Quality, Install/System Maintenance, RDBMS - Oracle/MySQL, Install/System Updates, Scripting  Date:  5-18-2011  Location:  Ann Arbor, MI  Area Code:  734  Tax Term:  FULLTIME CON_CORP CON_IND CON_W2 CON_HIRE_CORP CON_HIRE_IND  Pay Rate:  Market  Length:  Position ID:  273295  Dice ID:  10366343  Travel Required:  none  Telecommute:  no  Data Analysis, Data Management, Data Structures, Data Quality Position: Data Analysis, Data Management, Data Structures, Data Quality, Install/System Maintenance, RDBMS Location: Ann Arbor MI Responsibilities: - Consistently deliver usable and scalable database on time and within budget while conforming to client's expectations for content and quality - Indentify and rectify the root cause of data quality issues and complex data investigations  - System Updates and Installs - Application support, auxiliary file changes, file moves and special " fix" job processing - Creating automated scripts and other tools to automate tasks. We expect our employees to work hard, learn constantly, remain sharply focused on customer value-add and develop, over time, into the next generation of technology leaders. We*re looking for the next generation of leaders who will not only thrive by adapting to fast changing environments, but embrace change as the weapon against obsolescence. This makes the Systems In Motion team the most charged, energetic, driven and fun people to work with. jobText: Current Job Stats 15 New  Jobs Posted Today 2741 Total  Jobs Available Job Seekers Help ·  ·  Job Description for  Loss Prevention Leader Job Information Company Name: ShopKo Stores () Location: Belvidere, Illinois Position: Full-time Job Category: Store Level Salary Range: Not Specified Reference Code: 123095 Job Description Applicants must also apply at www.shopko.com POSITION SUMMARY: The Store LP Leader is responsible for tasks and duties required to protect ShopKo assets at an assigned store. These assets include the facility and equipment, cash, merchandise and the safety of teammates and customers. Assists the Store Management in training and communicating loss prevention processes and policies to all teammates. DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES: TIME ALLOCATION: Assists with the execution and implementation of shrink reduction programs through proactive planning and monitoring loss exposures. Monitors closed circuit monitors to reduce external losses. As necessary involves local authorities and writes investigation reports. 30% Reduces theft loss through effective and successful internal and external theft investigations involving cash and merchandise; contacts appropriate internal and external parties regarding all reportable incidents. 30% Completes Loss Prevention administrative duties involving audits and inspections relating to the physical building security, merchandise/cash protection and customer/teammate safety. 25% Provides Loss Prevention awareness and training to all store teammates through effective communication. Participates in leadership meetings, and reports on trends in store operations to store leadership. 15% ADDITIONAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES FOR LP STORE LEADER WITH REPORTS: Provides directions through daily planning and assignment of work tasks; monitors teammate(s) to ensure work is being performed to satisfactory standards; follows-up on timely completion of tasks; provides input to teammate(s) on enhancing job performance; provides input to store managers for their performance reviews and any disciplinary issues. MINIMUM KNOWLEDGE, EXPERIENCE & SKILLS REQUIREMENTS: 1. Must be 18 years or older (state requirement). 2. Must have experience in retail loss prevention; including coursework in Criminal Justice, Police Science or Security Administration or equivalent experience. 3. High school equivalent reading and math skills. 4. Must demonstrate strong leadership skills to communicate and implement programs and handling critical loss investigations. 5. Requires effective decision making skills for handling customer and teammate problems. 6. Must demonstrate an exemplary commitment to provide exceptional customer service. 7. Requires excellent verbal and written communication skills. 8. Requires ability to work independently with minimal supervision.  9. Must exhibit highest level of integrity and ethical standards. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS & WORK REQUIREMENTS: 1. Must be able to sit and move around sales and stock room floors for extended periods. 2. Must demonstrate physical agility (bending, twisting, reaching). 3. Must be available to work days, nights and weekends. 4. Requires ability to travel independently to various locations in the community as well as occasional overnight travel. 5. Requires ability to install, set up and monitor surveillance equipment. These statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by teammates assigned to this job classification. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required Please also apply at. www.shopko.com Additional Information Shopko Store #133 1400 Big Thunder Blvd. Belvidere, IL 61008 815-547-3003 Submit Resume Contact Information Contact Name: Jamie Little or Dick Plautz Email Address: | | | |  2011 LPjobs.com  website visual treatment designed by
