jobText: Job Details Job Number 11-010573 Post Date 04/02/2011 Job Title Deli/Bakery Sales Manager - Food Lion Positions Available 1 Operating Company Food Lion Full/Part Time Status Full-Time FLSA Status Non-Exempt (Hourly) Location Store #01470 -- MURFREESBORO Address 3060 SOUTH CHURCH ST.  City MURFREESBORO  State TN Description Job Title: Deli/Bakery Sales Manager - Food Lion Job Location: Job Duties: Ensure that Food Lion service standards are met. Responsible for sales, profits and associates of the Deli/Bakery Department. Responsible for maintaining standards according to the Deli/Bakery Standard Practice Manual, maximizing sales by providing extraordinary customer service and minimizing shrink through proper utilization of Standard Practices. Serve as a role model for customer service and other vital behaviors, and instill this value in all associates. Manage store Deli/Bakery Department. Directly responsible for supervision of Deli/Bakery Associates, Bakers, Cooks and Cake Decorators. Accountable for the profitability of the store Deli/Bakery Department. Effectively maintain department operating figures, gross profit, shrink, wage percent and supply cost to Food Lion standards. Develop and maintain a friendly selling approach to customers by all Deli/Bakery associates. Engage and interact with customers to create a positive shopping experience. Ensure that ordering, receiving, preparation, conditioning and displaying of merchandise is done in accordance with Food Lion policy. Ensure that all merchandise is properly rotated at all times. Maintain a clean and sanitary department at all times. Develop and maintain a competent, enthusiastic and courteous department organization through training, supervision, delegation of responsibilities and follows-up on work assignments. Take inventory of department merchandise as needed and conducts he physical inventory of all product on hand each period. Know how to effectively use the In-Store Computer and scan system. Ensure proper maintenance, care and use of all Deli/Bakery Department equipment and property. Find more efficient ways to do the job and seek to reduce costs and improve labor productivity. Due to scheduling or heavy flow of customers, will need to perform duties of a Deli/Bakery Associate from time to time. Understand, follow and teach all pertinent Food Safety guidelines, procedures and requirements. Provide ongoing performance management training and conduct timely formal performance appraisals for direct reports. Train and supervise all associates in the Deli/Bakery Department. Continually review current Standard Practices to ensure proper Standard Practice execution. Adhere to all company guidelines, policies and standard practices. This description is intended to outline the primary responsibilities, general nature and level of work being performed by associate assigned to this position. It is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and competencies.  Requirements Job Requirements: Technical skills in all areas of preparation and handling of Deli/Bakery product in compliance with Food Lion standards. Ability to communicate and direct associates of department in order to achieve expected results. Ability to analyze situations, identify problems and implement solutions. Ability to reach, bend, stoop and lift up to 25 pounds. Ability to break down and reassemble all equipment in the department for sanitation purposes. Ability to push or pull up to 1,350 pounds using a pallet jack. Ability to meet production standards established by Food Lion. Ability to weigh, price, label, organize and rotate products, perform job duties as needed and complete necessary paperwork. Must understand and be able to teach all required paperwork. Must have successfully completed Computer Based Training and (CBT) and Training Aid courses. Close Back to Home Page Find more jobs with Barnes - Jewish Hospital Save Job Email to a friend Apply Now Rate This Job Report This Job Location: Saint Louis, MO Area Code: 314 Tax Term: FULLTIME Pay Rate: Length: Full Time Position ID: 1101922 Group ID: 10139802 Title: Nurse Coordinator - Per Diem - 8 hr Dayshift Specialty: Date: 4-6-2011 Description: Why do candidates choose Barnes-Jewish Hospital?  About Barnes-Jewish Hospital  Barnes-Jewish Hospital at Washington University Medical Center is the largest hospital  in Missouri and is ranked as one of the nation's top 10 hospitals by U.S. News & World Report. Barnes-Jewish Hospital's staff is composed of full-time academic faculty and community physicians of Washington University School of Medicine, supported by a house staff of residents, interns, fellows and other medical professionals. Recognizing its excellence  in nursing care, Barnes-Jewish Hospital was the first adult hospital  in Missouri to be certified as a " Magnet Hospital" by the American Nurses Credentialing Center.  Role Purpose  The Nurse Coordinator is responsbile for coordinating the health care of select patient populations/designated service across the continuum of care using the nursing process.This position coordinates patient contact, patient education, and prepares patient/family for procedure/test  in collaboration with the healthcare team.  Essential Responsibilities  Conducts age-appropriate assessments. Identifies physiological, psychological, teaching, learning and discharge needs  in all assessments. Reflects safety, drug therapy, sensory, behavioral and developmental needs  in all assessments. Assesses, observes and reports signs of abuse Performs reassessments with changes  in patient's condition at intervals defined by policy Establishes plan of care within 24 hours of admission or prior to start of procedure Develops interdisciplinary individualized care plans  in collaboration with the patient and healthcare team Discusses patient's goals for pain management/control and incorporates into plan Ensures appropriate teaching tools are available for patients/families/significant others. Designs and/or develops tools based on physician/service preferences  Minimum Qualifications  Bachelors Degree  in an Nursing or related health care field Current RN Licensure  in Missouri Current Basic Life Support (BLS) Certification or ability to obtain prior to direct patient contact Nursing experience  in Cardiac setting - 2 years or more Basic computer/keyboarding skills Must be able to sit, stand, walk, and/or move about for 75% of a shift  Preferred Qualifications  Bachelors degree  in Nursing Excellent written and verbal communication skills Excellent organization and customer relation skills Intermediate computer/keyboarding skills Nursing experience  in congenital heart, cath lab or arrhythmia setting - 5 years or more Supervisory Experience - 1 year or more  AHJ  Barnes - Jewish Hospital Web:  Rate Job Positive Neutral Negative Misrepresented job Pays below market level Not a real job Position no longer available Other Please Provide an Explanation (400 character limit) Security For security purposes, please enter the characters seen to the left in the text field below before submitting. jobText: Login» User Name Password \  \ Job Detail Job Detail Job Title Part-Time Lab Clerk Job Category Other Job Type Full Position Job Location E-mail Experience Level 0-2 years Compensation Not Specified Company Direct Employer - EntryLevelCrossing Credit 14 Posted/Last Updated June 14, 2011 Job Description Job Responsibilities and Requirements: Summary: This position is responsible for: Learning and performing multiple microbiological test procedures in a food safety laboratory setting; Preparing and inventorying various microbiological media and supplies; Participating in various food safety research projects; Participating in temperature data collection for various pieces of equipment (incubators, refrigerators, freezers); Entering data into a computerized laboratory information management system (LIMS). Based on initiative, this position offers potential for participation in various food safety research projects; Collection of samples in the processing plant environment; Interaction with various inter-company customers; Full-time employment if a position becomes available. This position will be required to work three of every four weekends, Sat and Sun, 8 hrs each day during the semester (if there are 24 weekends in a semester, 18 of them must be worked with a minimum of 8 hours each day for Saturday and Sunday) Possibility of working some holidays. Qualifications: Education: Incoming sophomore, junior, senior, or graduate level. Minimum 2.50 GPA. Poultry/animal science, food science, biology or microbiology majors preferred Experience preferred: Laboratory work associated with college course work. Computer Skills: Requires standard computer skills including generating spreadsheets or word processing macros. Travel: Local travel only Supervisory Responsibilities: None Special Skills: Precision and accuracy in data collection and transfer. Minimum of 24 hours and maximum of 29 hours per week - days/hours will vary based on school schedule. Ability to multi-task. Self starter with the ability to work independently or in teams. THIS IS AN ENTRY LEVEL HOURLY POSITION. RELOCATION ASSISTANCE IS NOT OFFERED. ONLY REGIONAL CANDIDATES WILL BE CONSIDERED. |  Keywords Location example: drug discovery New York, NY or 10001 > > For Job Seekers Occupational Therapist Assistant - Fort Hood, TX Company: (Staffing Firm/Recruiters) Location: Category: Therapy - Others Therapy - Occupational Posted: Oct. 04, 2011 Job Type: Full-time Compensation: 15 - 25 per hour Deadline: 10/31/2011 Description & Requirement Challenge Yourself - Be an Army Civilian - Go Army!  Civilian employees serve a vital role in supporting the Army mission. They provide the skills that are not readily available in the military, but crucial to support military operations. The Army integrates the talents and skills of its military and civilian members to form a Total Army.  You will conduct preliminary review of data pertaining to individual diagnosis and past medical history, compile and organize information, determine indications and contraindications for treatment and develop treatment program according to established goals. Administer full range of OT modalities and procedures to include ultrasound, phonophoresis, electric stimulation, iontophoresis, hot/cold applications, functional activities (ADLs), adaptive equipment, wound care, edema/scar control, desensitization/sensory re-education and splinting. Performs patient/family education associated with established treatment plan. Re-evaluate patient progress and response to therapy regimen at appropriate intervals. Develop treatment goals under the supervision of an OTR. Modify treatment approaches, within the scope of the established treatment plan, to reflect Soldier's changing needs. Collaborate with the interdisciplinary team to make recommendations for rehabilitation and reintegration needs.  Specialized Experience: One year in the same or similar work equivalent to at least the next lower grade or level requiring application of the knowledge, skills and abilities of the posiiton being filled. Candidates for this position will clearly demonstrate in their resume that they possess specialized experience which involves knowledge of common medical terminology, basic biology, anatomy, physiology, kinesiology, pathology of disease, normal and abnormal psychology, and basic teaching and learning principles. Knowledge of and experience in applying occupational therapy theories, principles and methodologies to plan and carry out care. Knowledge of and ability to perform occupational therapy data collection methods such as chart reviews, interviews, observations, and standardized assessments/measurement techniques for evaluating human performance.  OR  Education Substitution: One full year of graduate education meets the requirements for GS-7.  RECRUITMENT BONUS MAY BE AUTHORIZED FOR THIS POSITION Application Apply on line at USAJOBS at  Search for Job Announcement NCMD11026998DR4  Announcement will be open 10/5/11-10/31/11 Internal Job Code:  NCMD11026998DR4 (When applying, please mention this ad in medhunting.com) Think this job inappropriate for the site?  . |  |  |  |  |  |  |  | 2011  .

Salary, commission, incentives, and benefits  Â  Company Columbia Collectors is a reputable, growing, well-established company that has been in business over 50 years.Â The Company has a strong footprint in the local area, with solid, long-term customer relationships.If you are looking to establish a career in a recession-proof industry with an exceptional employer, Columbia Collectors might be a fit for you.Â  Â  Job Description Account Managers (collectors) will be responsible for managing all aspects of a customer's accounts, including contacting consumers with delinquent accounts, setting up payment plans, and skip tracing for information. They will be expected to assess each situation and determine the appropriate actions necessary.Â Training and mentoring will be provided by seasoned collectors/account managers, giving the individual an opportunity to gain substantial knowledge of the industry, including insight into a multitude of client industries, and legal knowledge in the areas of consumer protection and debt collections.Â  Â  Skills Individuals are expected to have strong verbal communication skills, be detail oriented and have the ability to prioritize effectively. Applicants must be efficient with computers and familiar with programs such as Microsoft Office and Microsoft Windows operating environments. Pluses are previous work in the industry, familiarity with Columbia Ultimate's Collection software, legal knowledge and/or background, familiarity with consumer protection laws, state laws, and F.D.C.P.A.Â Bi-lingual applicants are desired. Â  Compensation There will be salary pay to start and a salary/commission pay scale will be introduced after training. Commission will be based off of earnings so motivated individuals who work quickly and efficiently have high earning potential. Comprehensive benefit package, including paid vacation and medical insurance. Â  Additional Information Local candidates only, No relocation Please remit resumes to email above. Bi-lingual applicants preferred please submit resumes in .pdf , .doc , or .docx . Location: Vancouver WA  Compensation: Competitive Salary, Commision and Incentives  Principals only. jobText: Job Seekers: My CareerBuilder My CareerBuilder Post Resume Back to Search Results > >  Orthobiologics Sales Specialist, Chicago South  Baxter Healthcare Corp Learn more about this company > >  View all jobs at this company > >  Apply Now > >  Save it |  Email It |  Print it |  Share with Facebook Friends Report It Job Snapshot  Location:  Chicago, IL  Employee Type:  Full-Time Industry:  Biotechnology Manages Others:  Not Specified Job Type:  Sales Education:  4 Year Degree Experience:  Not Specified Post Date:  3/15/2011 Contact Information  Contact:  Baxter Healthcare Ref ID:  45961BR Description  Baxter International Inc. develops, manufactures and markets products that save and sustain the lives of people with hemophilia, immune disorders, infectious diseases, kidney disease, trauma, and other chronic and acute medical conditions. As a global, diversified healthcare company, Baxter applies a unique combination of expertise in medical devices, pharmaceuticals and biotechnology to create products that advance patient care worldwide.  Baxterâs BioScience division is a leading producer of both plasma-based and recombinant clotting factors for hemophilia, as well as biopharmaceuticals used to treat immune deficiencies, alpha 1 antitrypsin deficiency and other blood-related disorders. Baxter also produces vaccines for the prevention of infectious diseases, as well as biosurgery products used for hemostasis and tissue-sealing in surgery. Baxter BioScience's breadth and depth of expertise in recombinant protein manufacturing, plasma fractionation and proprietary Vero-cell vaccine manufacturing technologies set it apart from other companies in these fields.  The BioSurgery Orthobiologics Sales Specialist (OSS) will focus on products in the Orthobiologics surgical area and be responsible for sales activities including new account development and/or expanding existing accounts within an established geographic territory. Shares job expertise and provides guidance to other sales reps. Additional responsibilities include the following:  1 Establishes and maintains effective relationships with customers including surgeons, nurses and operating room staff.  2 Develops and implements sales strategies with focus at the local, regional and national levels. This includes forecasting and identifying current and future market potential for the surgical use for the BioSurgery Orthobiologics portfolio.  3 Maintains and increases on label usage of Baxter products in the surgical suite through participation in surgical procedures, in-servicing and educational presentations.  4 Monitors product sales and works closely with Marketing, Customer Service and Customer Operations to ensure high levels of customer satisfaction.  5 Provides feedback to immediate supervisor and marketing personnel for the development of marketing policy, recommended product and product line revisions as well as pricing changes.  6 Attends regional and local Surgical Conferences.  7 Provides feedback regarding product simplification and standardization to enhance profitability of sales line.  8 Works closely with other sales representatives to increase penetration of products in accounts.  Position will have an assigned geographic territory which may span several states. Travel is required (up to 60%) and may involve visits to remote or urban areas either individually or with other personnel.  Individuals must live within the current geography or be willing to relocate to it. Familiarity with posted territory strongly desired.  Strong knowledge of BioSurgery customer base.  Results oriented with strong customer focus.  Strong leadership, management and organizational skills.  Ability to exhibit analytical, strategic and creative thinking, as well as planning and developing people.  Strong verbal, written, interpersonal and communication skills.  Strong knowledge of Sales processes.  Strong business acumen, financial and negotiation skills.  Embraces and promotes change.  Bachelor's degree required with a minimum of 5 years of relevant medical device/healthcare sales experience within an operating room environment. The successful candidate should have demonstrated experience in Spine, Orthopedics and other surgical specialties. Knowledge of anatomy and physiology is required. Proven sales performance and the ability to manage a large territory required. Valid driverâs license is required.Baxter provides its employees with comprehensive compensation and benefits.To view other opportunities at Baxter and to learn more about the company, please visit our Web site at  www.baxter.com/about_baxter/careers . EOE M/F/D/V. When it comes to providing for medically fragile children and adults, we know what matters most! We strive to provide the very best for our patients everyday. Many times our services allow for loved ones to stay home for their care, surrounded by their family. That quality of life difference can provide for a better, more enjoyable daily life every single day. PSA has over 3100 skilled caregivers, providing professional, high quality, private duty nursing and therapy services to patients in multiple locations throughout the United States.  Is flexibility of scheduling a priority when choosing where to work?  Do you have a limited amount of time and/or flexibility to offer?  Do you want the ability to choose the types of cases you are assigned?  Are you currently working full time and want to supplement your income? Did you respond,  Yesï to any of these  questions ?  YES ? Let  PSA Healthcare be  your answer . PSA Healthcare specializes in offering quality nursing professionals the flexibility they are seeking while maintaining a commitment to quality care for our patients. At  PSA Healthcare , we are looking for nurses who are compassionate about patient care and recognize that their contribution as a  PSA Healthcare Nurse can make the difference in whether a patient remains in the home. Working as a PSA Healthcare Nurse means: Variety of scheduling options and patient assignments, pediatric and adult One on one nursing care Commitment to providing quality care for patients Training and access to round the clock RN clinical support Flexibility to maintain a work/life balance Weekly pay check with Direct Deposit option Whether you are looking for a great opportunity for extra work or looking for a career that offers flexibility or a shorter commute,  PSA Healthcare offers you the freedom to choose your hours, to work as little as a few hours a month or 40 hours per week and to make a real difference in the lives of our patients. Let PSA Healthcare be Your Answer  Apply Today!! Required Skills: To be considered for employment by PSA Healthcare for this Opportunity, you must be able to meet the following requirements, with or without accommodation. Proof of eligibility to work in the United States Current and unrestricted RN license to practice in the state for which you are applying Current CPR certification Current Continuing Education if required by state Diploma, Associate or Bachelor degree in nursing from state accredited RN program Demonstrated proficiency in clinical assessments, documentation and compliance with nursing care and policies and procedures Good organizational and communication skills Physical Requirements: Frequent lifting and repositioning of patients Repeated or prolonged standing, bending, kneeling, twisting and occasional climbing of stairs Acute sense of sight and hearing (corrected or uncorrected) and strong sense of touch, smell and taste Agility and strength sufficient to handle patients and equipment without assistance Must be able to appropriately respond physically and psychologically to emergency situations in the home or during transport Must be able to function in a wide variety of environments which may involve exposure to allergens and other health conditions PSA Healthcare is an Equal Opportunity Employer and complies with applicable employment laws. M/F/D/V are encouraged to apply. Visit  jobs.psahealthcare.com for a complete list of job openings in your area! jobText: Refugee Services - Executive Program Director  Lutheran Services of Georgia  Apply Now > >  Save it |  Email It |  Print it |  Share with Facebook Friends Report It Job Snapshot Location:  1330 West Peachtree Street Nw  Suite 300  Midtown Atlanta, GA 30309 ( Map it! )  Loading Map...  Base Pay:  $60,000 - $70,000 /Year  Other Pay:  Comprehensive benefits: insurance, 403(b), generous leave  Employee Type:  Full-Time  Industry:  Social Services  Not for Profit - Charitable  Other Great Industries  Manages Others:  Yes  Job Type:  Nonprofit - Social Services  Management  Other  Education:  Graduate Degree  Experience:  At least 5 year(s)  Travel:  Negligible  Relocation Covered:  No  Division:  Refugee Services -  Post Date:  8/27/2011  Contact Information Fax:  404-591-1031  Description Lutheran Services of Georgia resettles up to 800 refugees per year in the metro Atlanta area.  We are looking for an Executive Program Director for our refugee services department.  The Executive Program Director of Refugee Services is a senior leadership position that oversees the plans and operations of all services that aid in the settlement and social integration of refugees in Georgia communities. The Director is responsible for developing, directing, coordinating, and implementing the goals and objectives for the department, all related contracts, budgets and cooperative agreements, ensuring that all programs are fiscally sound and meet high quality standards. He/she is a leader who directs others, both paid staff and volunteers. The Program Director is LSGâs public voice for refugees and serves as the Regional Coordinator for Lutheran Immigration and Refugee Services. He/she is a member of the Sr. Leaderâs team and reports directly to the President/CEO.  Requirements Advanced degree in Social Work, Business Administration, Social Ministry or certified or licensed in a specific discipline or related human service field.  Minimum of 5 years of recent relevant work experience in a strategic management capacity in a medium or large social services program. Or a combination of education and experience that enables performance in all aspects of the position.  Demonstrated leadership qualities and strong management skills.  Experience formulating and managing multiple complex budgets.  Extensive knowledge and experience in working with community organizations.  Must be a strategic thinker and have the experience planning, developing and implementing systems that support the programâs goals and objectives.  Must understand the need of clients as they transition from one culture to another.  Knowledge of immigrant/refugee issues.  Experience in effective social advocacy.  Experience with grant writing and fundraising activities.  Proven success in developing and managing programs that provide services to diverse and cross cultural groups.  Must have experience planning, organizing and developing community relationships and experience speaking to a wide variety of audiences.  Must have experience managing a diverse workforce, both professional and support staff.  Must have ability to develop staff leadership skills and create and nurture cohesiveness among staff members.  Must have proven excellent communication skills in both written and oral modalities.  Must have excellent computer skills, proficient in the utilization of the Microsoft Suite and other data base management software.  Fluency in a foreign language is desired. jobText: My Cart is empty |  User login form  Email Address: Password: |  Main site navigation  Account Exec-Inside Sls  You are in:  >  >  > Account Exec-Inside Sls  Account Exec-Inside Sls  FedEx Services  | Job Reference:  JS13600  Client Name:  FedEx Services  Location:  Buffalo, NY  Salary:  Salary not Determined  Job Type:  Full-Time  Reports To:  HR  Date Posted:  May 27 2011  |  Job Description  Overview :  Each day, the 275, 000 employees of FedEx Corporation are responsible for delivering over 6 million shipments to more than 220 countries and territories around the world! Because of our " absolutely, positively" spirit and commitment to excellence, FedEx was recently included in  FORTUNE magazine's 2010 " 100 Best Companies to Work for in America"  and  Black Enterprise magazine's  " 40 Best Companies for Diversity" . As a global enterprise, all FedEx companies embrace and reflect the diversity of the communities where we live and serve.  Our culture fosters and promotes an environment where a person's performance is what counts.  It is not surprising that over the years FedEx has been consistently recognized within the global business circles for leadership, workplace environment and contribution to technological and economic advancements.  Bring your talent and join us in continuing to make every FedEx customer experience outstanding! As a part of the FedEx team you will be an integral component of an organization that recognizes and rewards the contributions of its employees by providing:  ¨ a dynamic work environment with a wide range of career options  ¨ competitive salary and bonus opportunities  ¨ work-life balance and generous benefits  Want to learn more about how FedEx continues to deliver for our employees, our customers and our shareholders? Want to be a part of it?  First step.....apply today! Position Information :  FedEx is looking for a highly qualified candidate in the  Buffalo, NY area who is ready to start their Sales Career with FedEx. Your career starts as an Inside Sales - Account Executive in our  Pittsburgh, PA sales office for 18 months.  Relocation to Pittsburgh, PA is required. We provide extensive online and classroom training, regular coaching and development with your manager along with mentorship by teammates.  As an Account Executive working in our  Pittsburgh, PA sales office, you will be responsible for a territory located throughout the north central or North East portion of the US. You will be responsible for developing new business, as well as maintaining and deepening existing customer relationships. Focus is on using the  telephone, webinar, email, and occasional face-to-face contact to achieve personal sales goals. You will engage customers and develop value propositions that meet their needs, increase volume from existing customers and acquire volume from new customers. You will be successful in delivering the FedEx family of services in your marketplace, through well-developed sales skills, collaboration, and effective negotiation.  The ideal candidate will excel within  18-24 months , with an opportunity for promotion, including a relocation package, to our Field Sales organization in the  Buffalo, NY market area, or other destinations that meet your personal and career objectives.  Compensation and benefits include a competitive salary, quarterly bonus opportunity, medical, dental and recruiting bonus.  Qualifications :  College degree or eighteen (18) months commercial/industrial sales experience preferred. High school diploma/GED required. Must be self motivated and possess strong time management, PC and communication skills  |  Find more jobs in  . JOB SEEKERS, EMPLOYERS,  What Where Search in Job Title Only Mile 5 mi 10 mi 15 mi 25 mi 50 mi 100 mi +  +  +  Job Details Job Title Senior Construction Railroad Inspector Job Profile Senior Construction Railroad Inspector','06723','!*! Parsons Railroad Inspector- Ontario, California Parsons is one of the world's largest transportation planning, engineering, and construction firms. We have an extensive portfolio of diverse transportation projects including rail and transit, road and highway, bridge and tunnel, and aviation infrastructure. Parsons expertise encompasses all phases of transportation engineering operations - from the initial planning stage through final design, construction, and commissioning. Parsons has the people and power to move the world. POSITION OVERVIEW: With minimal supervision, performs the most difficult and complex inspection tasks, including assessing adherence to quality control procedures for steel. Inspects various facets of work on the construction site and performs continuous surveillance of assigned construction activities to ensure compliance with all applicable codes, standards, and specifications. Documents nonconformance and participates in determining appropriate resolution. Inspection activities are usually concentrated in one or more of the following areas: soils, concrete, steel, mechanical, or electrical. Frequently serves in the capacity of Lead Inspector. Willingness to travel and/or to relocate to field sites is expected. SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES: Conducts tests to determine if work has been done in accordance with contract specifications and may include any of the following: Performs civil and structural tests, such as soil compaction, moisture content, aggregation, graduation, concrete slump, air entrainment, concrete compression, lines and grades surveys, bolt torques, and concrete coring. Performs destructive and nondestructive tests on metals and other materials through magnaflex, dye-penetrant, radiographic, tension and compression, paint thickness, and resistivity. Performs surveillance of underground piping to ensure tightness, bedding, and grade. Inspects and monitors piling installation to ensure location and bearing. Checks location of reinforcing steel before placement of concrete. Validates piping systems, including P& ID checks and hydraulic or other pressure tests. Inspects electrical installations to ensure proper grounding, circuit integrity, and adherence to statutory and customer regulations. Performs continuing inspection of painting and insulation to ensure thickness and coverage continuity. Provides general inspection on all construction labor and subcontracted tasks to ensure professional workmanship. Verifies equipment alignment and balancing operations. Administers welder qualification tests. Recommends job safety practices and drafts safety reports. Prepares quality control reports and recommends changes to procedures. Performs other responsibilities associated with this position as may be appropriate. 2-year degree in a technical discipline or construction-related field, or a high school diploma and 10 yrs of experience on heavy construction projects in Railroad track inspection, Railroad crossing, signals, large drainage channel facilities, utility coordination, change order, and field engineering. PREFERRED EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE: SKILLS/COMPETENCIES: Must be able to read and interpret blueprints and construction specifications, be totally familiar with construction-related processes related to area of assignment, and have the potential to perform in a lead capacity. Parsons offers an ethical, challenging, diverse, rewarding and fun work experience where enthusiastic, responsible people use their energy, talent and dedication to make a difference in the world. Candidates are encouraged to apply at  or  We provide career growth and development, a competitive compensation and benefits package which includes medical, dental, vision, and life insurance; tuition reimbursement program; credit union membership; Employee Stock Ownership Plan and a 401(k) plan. Parsons is an equal opportunity, drug-free employer committed to diversity in the workplace. M/W/D/V. Founded in 1944, Parsons, an engineering, construction, technical, and management services firm with revenues of $2.7 billion in 2010, is 100% owned by the Employee Stock Ownership Trust. This We conquer the toughest logistical challenges and deliver design/design-build, program/construction management, professional services, and innovative alternative delivery solutions to private industrial customers worldwide as well as to federal, regional, and local government agencies. Parsons is a leader in many diversified markets with a focus on infrastructure, environmental, and defense/security. Currently, more than 10,500 Parsons' employees are engaged in more than 4,500 projects in 50 states and 24 countries. These dedicated workers speak 72 languages collectively, and hold more than 7,900 college degrees and professional registrations. Parsons' employees continue to go anywhere in the world, meet every technical and management challenge, and persevere until the job is done. jobText: Job  details Job details Job 1 of 1  Requisition ID 97227BR Job Title Digital Asset Coordinator Business eCommerce - ALL State or Province/City IL Hoffman Estates Job Description The User Experience and Creative Group of Sears Holdings Corporation, Inc. is looking for an Digital Asset Coordinator to join the team. The ideal candidate is a highly independent self-starter with at least two to three years of experience and a great sense of humor. The User Experience and Creative Group is a motivated group of close-knit professionals, including developers, information architects, Web designers, and other creative types who work hard every day to provide an intuitive and innovative experience for the customer.  The primary focus of the Digital Asset Coordinator is to act as the liaison between online merchants, designers, and developers to implement creative assets for Sears.com, Kmart.com and MyGofer.com promotional programs in a fast-paced production environment. In addition, this individual will rotate on-call responsibilities to support live site changes. Responsibilities/Skills/Experience Requirements Key Responsibilities include: Under the direction of the Lead Digital Asset Coordinator, the Digital Asset Coordinator will: Act as primary liaison between merchants, designers, copywriters, and developers to effectively deliver creative online promotional assets Review the weekly promotional spreadsheet for accuracy and completeness and follow up with merchants for missing details, clarification, and to prepare the documentation for the development team Obtain imagery for online creative promotional assets as requested by the merchant and Web design teams Maintain and manage digital image repository for Web design team Work closely with merchants, copywriters, designers, developers, and others to produce a team-driven end product that leads to a top-notch user experience Upload creative to online application on a weekly basis for obtaining merchant review feedback  Gathering and communicating feedback Act as final checkpoint for all creative promotional assets before implementation and QA in staging environment before go-live Be on-call to implement live site changes to online assets as-needed Ensure all creative promotional assets are aligned with the promotional and seasonal strategic direction as provided by the Creative Director Ensuring content has been approved by Legal, when necessary Experience/Education Requirements:  Bachelorâs degree or equivalent work experience  Minimum 2 years working in an online environment preferred Basic understanding of modern Web-based technologies and general eCommerce Excellent organizational, interpersonal, written, and verbal communication a must Ability to multi-task and prioritize; must be able to meet tight deadlines for multiples projects  Flexible and able to thrive in a fast-paced, high pressure, deadline oriented environment Must be able to deliver high quality work consistently and on time Ability and desire to quickly learn new processes and applications Experience and understanding of online production environment Proficient with Microsoft Office applications including MS Excel, Word, and Outlook  Attention to detail, while also considering the big picture Self-motivated with positive attitude Other Desirable Skills: Basic usability/user interface design experience  Basic experience with Content Management Systems  Direct marketing and/or Internet marketing experience  Basic knowledge of Photoshop Years Experience 2 - 5 Years Experience Preferred Minimum Education Bachelors Level Degree Travel Requirements On Occasion (Less than 5%) 2009 Sears Holdings Corporation - All Rights Reserved  Index Monitor

jobText: the  smart solution for local jobs |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  >  >  > Vice President/ Senior Vice President - Reputation Management  Vice President/ Senior Vice President - Reputation Management Company:  Global Leader in Marketing and Communications Location:  Los Angeles Posted on:  January 11, 2011 Share this job on facebook Job Description: Job Description: We have an immediate opening for a Vice President or Senior Vice President with a strong corporate communications background to join our dynamic team. This position provides the opportunity to work in a fast-paced environment with collaborative teams on clients in the areas of technology, healthcare, clean energy, corporate and financial services. The company encourages and supports building solid account management teams, developing business and professional growth opportunities, and strong profitability.  The successful candidate will focus on building and maintaining strong relationships with clients, writing and executing programs for Fortune 100 and mid-sized companies, and advancing corporate communications strategies that embrace the client s strategy and positioning. Primary responsibilities for the Vice President include: writing client materials, pitching reporters at trade and mainstream media outlets, executing issues/crisis management programs, and generating executive visibility opportunities. Candidate will also be expected to manage projects, balance staff workload, develop and manage budgets, be involved in strategic planning and ensure profitability.  Qualifications: The successful candidate must be results oriented, have a deep background developing and executing corporate reputation programs, and experience providing strategic counsel and leadership to influence and impact client strategy. Additionally, candidates should have: * Minimum of 10-12 years of corporate communications experience gained in an agency or a corporate environment, with an emphasis on media relations, corporate and technology communications, and crisis communications. * Skilled communicator with deep experience in a broad range of corporate communications, including executive positioning, lead generation, media relations, employee communications, and issues management. Experience in community relations, corporate social responsibility, and sustainability is a plus. * Strong strategic thinking and planning, with demonstrated experience in corporate positioning. * Proven track record providing leadership on crisis/issues management. * Demonstrated success in new business with proven ability to develop compelling proposals and present them effectively and persuasively. * Ability to direct research and interpret and apply the results to develop messages and approaches that convey a company s value and differentiate it from others in the competitive field. * Ability to synthesize complex integrated marketing communications aimed at segmented audiences across all disciplines advertising, direct mail, promotion, employee communications, social media, and public relations. * Superior writing skills, with the ability to develop and edit high-quality materials. Required experience: 5+ years Minimum required education: Bachelor's Degree Job category: Business & Strategic Management;Production & Operations;Marketing & Product;Sales, Retail & Business Development Keywords: Global Leader in Marketing and Communications, Los Angeles, Vice President/ Senior Vice President - Reputation Management, Business, Los Angeles, California View more  Share this job on facebook Sponsored by: /  More Other Locations By using this website you agree to our  . Hobbyist and homeowner woodworking questions are inappropriate.  Messages should be kept reasonably short and on topic, relating to the focus of the forum. Responses should relate to the original question.  A valid email return address must be included with each message.  Advertising is inappropriate. The only exceptions are the Classified AdsExchange, MachineryExchange, LumberExchange, and Job Opportunities and Services Exchange. When posting listings in these areas, review the posting instructions carefully.  Subject lines may be edited for length and clarity.  " Cross posting" is not permitted. Choose the best forum for your question, and post your question at one forum only.  Messages requesting private responses will be removed - Forums are designed to provide information and assistance for all of our visitors. Private response requests are appropriate at WOODWEB's Exchanges and Job Opportunities and Services.  Messages that accuse businesses or individuals of alleged negative actions or behavior are inappropriate since WOODWEB is unable to verify or substantiate the claims.  Posts with the intent of soliciting answers to surveys are not appropriate. Contact WOODWEB for more information on initiating a survey.  Excessive forum participation by an individual upsets the balance of a healthy forum atmosphere. Individuals who excessively post responses containing marginal content will be considered repeat forum abusers.  Responses that initiate or support inappropriate and off-topic discussion of general politics detract from the professional woodworking focus of WOODWEB, and will be removed.  Questions or criticisms regarding Forum policies should be directed to WOODWEB's  ( ).  Carefully review your message before clicking on the " Send Message" button - you will not be able to revise the message once it has been sent. You will be notified of responses to the message(s) you posted via email. Be sure to enter your email address correctly. WOODWEB's forums are a highly regarded resource for professional woodworkers. Messages and responses that are crafted in a professional and civil manner strengthen this resource. Messages that do not reflect a professional tone reduce the value of our forums. Messages are inappropriate when their content: is deemed libelous in nature or is based on rumor, fails to meet basic standards of decorum, contains blatant advertising or inappropriate emphasis on self promotion ( ). Libel: Posts which defame an individual or organization, or employ a tone which can be viewed as malicious in nature. Words, pictures, or cartoons which expose a person or organization to public hatred, shame, disgrace, or ridicule, or induce an ill opinion of a person or organization, are libelous. Improper Decorum: Posts which are profane, inciting, disrespectful or uncivil in tone, or maliciously worded. This also includes the venting of unsubstantiated opinions. Such messages do little to illuminate a given topic, and often have the opposite effect. Constructive criticism is acceptable ( ). Advertising: The purpose of WOODWEB Forums is to provide answers, not an advertising venue. Companies participating in a Forum discussion should provide specific answers to posted questions. WOODWEB suggests that businesses include an appropriately crafted signature in order to identify their company. A well meaning post that seems to be on-topic but contains a product reference may do your business more harm than good in the Forum environment. Forum users may perceive your references to specific products as unsolicited advertising (spam) and consciously avoid your web site or services. A well-crafted signature is an appropriate way to advertise your services that will not offend potential customers. Signatures should be limited to 4-6 lines, and may contain information that identifies the type of business you're in, your URL and email address ( ). Repeated Forum Abuse: Forum participants who repeatedly fail to follow WOODWEB's Forum Guidelines may encounter difficulty when attempting to post messages. There are often situations when the original message asks for opinions: " What is the best widget for my type of shop?" . To a certain extent, the person posting the message is responsible for including specific questions within the message. An open ended question (like the one above) invites responses that may read as sales pitches. WOODWEB suggests that companies responding to such a question provide detailed and substantive replies rather than responses that read as a one-sided product promotion. It has been WOODWEB's experience that substantive responses are held in higher regard by our readers ( ). The staff of WOODWEB assume no responsibility for the accuracy, content, or outcome of any posting transmitted at WOODWEB's Message Boards. Participants should undertake the use of machinery, materials and methods discussed at WOODWEB's Message Boards after considerate evaluation, and at their own risk. jobText: Sr. Systems Administrator Responsible for identifying and analyzing system requirements to develop detailed design specifications for data traffic and system enhancements to include designing, configuring, and maintaining system services within company infrastructure, monitoring the data communications to ensure system is available to all users MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS Applicant for this job will be expected to meet the following minimum qualifications. Education * Bachelor's degree in computer science, information systems, electrical engineering, computer engineer or a related field is required. Equivalent work experience in a similar position may be substituted for educational requirements Experience * Minimum three years experience administering and maintaining an operating system is required. Minimum one year project coordination experience preferred Technical * Based on area of responsibility and departmental need: * Knowledge of one program platform (Tandem, Windows, Unix, Geotel, or Web) is required and knowledge of one standard programming language (e.g., C, SQL, Visual Basic, C++, COBOL, HTML, PERL, TACL) is preferred, Knowledge of BizTalk may be required * Knowledge of ADP/Kronos may be required. * If utilizing Unix experience the following maybe preferred: Linux Operating Systems, RedHat Enterprise Server, Sun Solaris Operating System AIX Operating System, Tomcat Server, Apache, Veritas Volume Manager, Veritas NetBackup, Legato AAM, Legato High Availability Manager, BIND DNS, SendMail, F5 BigIP Load Balancers or similar, Firewalls, Storage Arrays, Strong Shell and/or Perl Scripting, Work in a hybrid Unix/Linux/AIX/Microsoft environment, Business Objects, EMC Autostart, Weblogic, IIS, multi tiered application environments and interactions with other business systems, advanced technical knowledge of integration with operating systems kernels, advanced networking skills with knowledge of routing and switching technologies Other * Intermediate knowledge of Word and Excel required * Able to carry pager, be on-call and respond within a reasonable time frame Intrado Inc. is North America*s leading provider of 9-1-1 infrastructure systems and services. Founded in 1979, Intrado*s wide range of offerings for safety and commercial markets includes 9-1-1 data management, wireless data services, target notification and data aggregation and delivery. The company's unparalleled industry knowledge in data management, network transaction, call handling and notification technology reduces the effort, cost, time and complexity associated with providing reliable information for 9-1-1, safety and commercial applications.  Please visit our website for more information on the company at www.intrado.com Please send your resume with salary requirements to HR@Intrado.com Only qualified candidates will be contacted. Drug Test, Background Review, and Motor Vehicle Check required. Intrado is an Equal Opportunity Employer Intrado 1601 Dry Creek Dr Longmont, CO 80503 Fax: (720) 494-6652 Web:  Apply Now Hot Topics About Dice Related Dice Sites | | | | Rate Job Dice.com Positive Neutral Negative Report Job Dice.com Misrepresented job Pays below market level Not a real job Position no longer available Other Please Provide an Explanation (400 character limit) For security purposes, please enter the characters seen to the left in the text field below before submitting. jobText: / / Residential Program Manager - Adult Residential Program Manager - Adult at NHS Human Services in Levittown PA Full-Time Jobs in Philadelphia Pennsylvania NHS of Bucks County is looking for a Program Manager to oversee our Adult Residential program in Levittown. The Program Manager will plan, direct, and manage the clinical and administrative coordinaton of the program, residents, and staff. -Assist in the recruiting and hiring of program staff. -Actively participate in all required meetings and committees, including NHS meetings and monthly -County meetings with Bucks Co staff. -Comply with governmental regulations regarding confidentiality of resident records, documentations and client rights. -Implement policies and procedures in compliance with all external and internal policies, laws, and regulations.  -Develop and maintain the clinical and administrative coordination of all aspects of the program, its residents, and staff (including student interns).  -Ensure a clean, safe and homelike environment. -Ensure a meaningful and productive activity schedule for residents to include skill training groups and treatment programs specifically targeting those areas of need identified in the service planning process, and that necessary transportation is arranged. -Ensure all staff compliance with regulations, policies, and procedures. -Operate the program within the prescribed budget and maintain documentation of expenditures. -Participate in PQI efforts. -Participate in review and evaluation of program goals, activities, policies, and procedures. -Provide administrative on-call availability to staff/program 24 hrs/day, 7 days/week. -Make staff aware of designee in absence. -Payroll for staff. -Insure that the daily routine begins, develops, and ends as expected/outlined. -Review and update general Report all health concerns immediately to the appropriate authority (i.e., doctor, dentist, therapist , residential nurse and/or supervisor); record in log. -Report all unusual incidents, problems, incidents contrary to policy, or change in individualâs program to the Regional Director. -Report any accidents immediately, giving full data: submit incident report.  -Report medical incidents requiring treatment to the Regional Director and Residential Nurse immediately. -Review report and file Incident Reports within 24 hours; Do County Reports and/or HCSIS as needed. -Take appropriate steps in the resolution, recording, and reporting of emergencies/incidents. -Conduct the following meetings at program: -General staff meeting (Monthly) -Individual supervision of program staff  -Weekly Community Meetings with residential consumers (document) Job Requirements -Bachelors Degree in Human Services field. Masters preferred.  -1 to 3 years related  Mental Health Residential Supervisory experience.  -Must have clean valid drivers license and reliable transportation.  NHS is an EOE Employment Type : Full-Time Manages Others : True Travel Required : Not Specified Relocation Covered : False Experience Required : At least 3 year(s) Degree Required : 4 Year Degree Pay Scale Minimum : $37,000.00 Maximum : $37,000.00 Bonus : not specified Commission : not specified Posted : 8/17/2011 Categories : , ,  85 Kindle Lane  Levittown, PA 19055 Contact Information Nakia Mayo Fax : 267-295-9089

Back to prior page Printable Format Job Description - Product Manager (Optical Channel Go-To-Market) (000NP) Job Description Product Manager (Optical Channel Go-To-Market) - 000NP Description BASIC FUNCTIONS: Product/Go-To-Market Manager will be responsible for development and execution of Go-To-Market (GTM) programs and initiatives as part of the Global Rx Frame category team. This individual will execute cross-functional programs that enable internal colleagues to learn the benefits and selling points of both new products. The candidate will be responsible for communication to Oakley's global organization and will coordinate execution across multiple countries, business office, time zones, and cultures. This means the individual needs significant negotiation and " give and take" skills, with an ability to convincingly convey why GTM initiatives are critical to execute. This is not 'just' cross-functional collaboration, this is a person crafting a plan, getting buy-in and executing. Before considering this position, please check out Oakley.com to determine if our corporate culture might be a fit for you. RESPONSIBILITIES : · Work with matrix organization to create and deliver go-to-market tools · Interface with global branches · Interface with internal sales leader and brand manager to drive sales · Manage all aspects of product life-cycle. · Maintain competitive intelligence. · Assist in the development and implementation of the strategic plans. · Conduct market research to identify opportunities, market trends and customer needs. · Team with sales, manufacturing and service groups to ensure that key milestones and " gates" are achieved throughout product development process. · Maintain SAP & CRM product database. · Ability to succeed in a fast-paced, sometimes stressful, team-oriented environment. · Possess service oriented attitude. · Ability to work through ambiguous issues to drive and deliver meaningful solutions. · Employment of 80/20. Cable of what information you are getting and ability to make a business decision about the issue. Qualifications QUALIFICATIONS : · Undergraduate degree in Marketing or Business.  · 3+ years experience in a marketing role or 3 years of proven sales experience (B to B) · Self-starter who requires minimal supervision. · Exceptional oral and written communication skills. · Have effective communication with all levels of the organization and with RMS clients · Must be able to articulate the essence of a matter succinctly · Quantitative with awareness of statistical and mathematical concepts. · Proficient use of Microsoft Office. Job Seeker Login Email Password remember me Search Jobs Keywords Penske Truck Leasing >  >  > Job: Diesel Technician II Job: Diesel Technician II Posted : 08/18/2011 Job Type :  Share This Page Jobing Description Position Summary: Penske Technician II will generally assist in the repair and diagnosis of major components or remove/replace major components at the direction of Lead Technician or Maintenance Supervisor. Expectations include the ability to diagnose and repair the following with little or no supervision: Clutches, PTO Systems, Electric Systems, Hydraulic/Air Brake systems, Heating/Air Conditioning Systems, Instruments and Gauges, and Preventive Maintenance Service. Major Responsibilities: - Demonstrate proficiency in the repair and diagnosis of - with some assistance: Engines (gas and diesel), Power train to include differentials, transmissions, clutches, drive shafts, PTO's and wheel ends, Electrical systems including starters and alternators, HVAC systems, Steering systems, Electronics to include ECM's, ECU's, sensors etc., Engine bolt on items such as turbos, fan clutches, injectors, cooling system etc., Brake systems including ABS, Suspension systems (spring and air) - Perform mechanical and general appearance reconditioning of equipment for " trade-ins" and prepare new equipment for delivery. - Identify and determine parts required for repair of disassembled units - Perform all levels of preventive maintenance services - Identify warrantable repairs and document on repair order - Maintain work area appearance and safety - Road test Vehicles when necessary to diagnose malfunctions or to ensure that they are working properly. - Use hand tools such as screwdrivers, pliers, wrenches, pressure gauges, and precision instruments, as well as power tools such as pneumatic wrenches, welding equipment, and jacks and hoists. - Inspect brake systems, steering mechanisms, wheel bearings, and other important parts to ensure that they are in proper operating condition. - Perform routine maintenance such as changing oil, checking batteries, and lubricating equipment and machinery. - Adjust and replace brakes, tighten bolts and screws, and reassemble equipment. - Raise trucks, buses, and heavy parts or equipment using hydraulic jacks or hoists. - Inspect, test, and listen to defective equipment to diagnose malfunctions, using test instruments such as handheld computers, motor analyzers, chassis charts, and pressure gauges. - Examine and adjust protective guards, loose bolts, and specified safety devices. Inspect and verify dimensions and clearances of parts to ensure conformance to factory specifications. - Specialize in repairing and troubleshooting of major components such as engine, transmissions and differentials, to include replacing complete assemblies, turbochargers, fuel system components etc. - Other projects and tasks as assigned by supervisor Qualifications - 2-4 years practical experience with tractor trailer maintenance required - High school diploma or equivalent required - Vocational/Technical or certification preferred - Specialized training in the repair and replacement of vehicle components preferred - Proficiency in the use of shop tools required - A valid drivers license is required - Current CDL license with air brake certification preferred, willingness to acquire CDL if you do not have one. - Basic computer skills preferred for data entry into maintenance systems. - Ability to work in non-climate controlled conditions required - Willingness to travel as necessary within the district (customers yards, close geographical area and training sites), work the required schedule, work at the specific location required, complete Penske employment application, submit to a background investigation (to include past employment, education, and criminal history) and drug screening are required - The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an associate to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The associate must regularly lift and /or move up to 25lbs/12kg, frequently lift and/or move up to 50lbs/23kg and occasionally lift and/or move up to 100lbs/45kg. Specific vision abilities required by this job include Close vision, Distance vision, Peripheral vision, Depth perception and Ability to adjust focus. While performing the duties of this Job, the associate is regularly required to stand; walk; sit and talk or hear. The associate is frequently required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel and reach with hands and arms. Penske Truck Leasing Co., L.P., headquartered in Reading, Pa., is a joint venture among Penske Corporation, Penske Automotive Group and General Electric. A leading global transportation services provider, Penske operates more than 200,000 vehicles and serves customers from more than 1,000 locations in North America, South America, Europe and Asia. Product lines include full-service truck leasing, contract maintenance, commercial and consumer truck rentals, transportation and warehousing management, and supply chain management solutions. Visit www.GoPenske.com to learn more about the company and its products and services. Penske is an Equal Opportunity Employer Women and Minorities are encouraged to apply Work Locations : 1405 Glendale Ave (3249) 1405 Glendale Ave Sparks, 89431 Application Instructions My Search: Locations Exact address not specified - showing center of zip. jobText: Job  details Job details Job 1 of 1  Req ID 48012BR Business Title Network Systems Engineer Group SEAT Location USA CALIFORNIA Camp Pendleton Clearance Level Needed Top Secret Category Networks & Telecommunication Services Job Duties and Responsibilities ManTech is seeking a Network Engineer to provide isolation and resolution of complex hardware and software problems  involving the application, the operating system, the hardware, and the communications infrastructure. The candidate  will support the integration of new technologies into communications, network and system infrastructures Local Area Network and Wide Area Network (LAN & WAN) and the migration of networks and development of network addressing schemes. Specifically, the services include integration planning of capabilities and systems for MEF Intelligence Centers (MIC), Major Subordinate Commands, and Marine Air Ground Task Force (MAGTF) Sensitive Compartmented Information (SCI) communication requirements and intelligence networks; the transition and migration of networks; and development of network addressing schemes. General Responsibilities: Provide support to the MEF and regional subordinate commands from the MEF Intelligence Center (MIC) with technical hands-on network administration and engineering support for internal and enterprise architectures. Provide enterprise support to the USMC SEO with technical coordination, network administration and engineering support for enterprise architectures and capabilities. Responsible for providing technical support for Marine Corps Joint Worldwide Intelligence Communications System (JWICS) communications, network and all intelligence systems within the MEF. Supports the collection of information for data calls and portfolio management of LAN IT hardware, software & licensing to MEF G-2 Systems and the SCI Enterprise Office. Provide monthly status reporting of network health to the Systems Officer and the SCI Enterprise Office. Conduct resident IT training as needed. Create/maintain accounts and mailboxes on SCI Networks and Intelligence Systems. Integrate new hardware and software technology. Facilitate integration of Marine Corps Intelligence systems into Garrison Networks as required. Provide assistance/planning for software upgrades including patches and migration to new operating systems and applications. Provide system administration for Intel system and network environments. Provide configuration assistance for the Intel systems and network environments. Provide system and network training for Marines performing administration duties. Maintain enterprise software images for various workstations, deployed and in garrison. Maintain SCI Network Diagrams. On call for any emergency issues that require response. Provide engineering, systems maintenance, and support of the USMC SCI Active Directory environment. Deploy in support of MEF as required (non-combat deployment) Requirements: The candidate must have, at minimum, Bachelors Degree; BS degree strongly desired, and 6-8 years experience requirement with a focus in Marine Corps IT/network services type of support functions). A minimum of five years relevant technical experience in LAN/WAN technical support The candidate must have the ability to operate automated diagnostics systems and to interpret diagnostics findings. Shall have an industry technical certification, such as Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP),Enterprise Network Systems (ENS), and DoD 8570 security IAT Level II certification Other Skills Required: This position requires demonstrated initiative, sound judgment, effective decision-making, and excellent oral and written communication skills. Specific equipment or software requirements. Clearance: Position requires, at a minimum, a TS/SCI clearance  Qualifications Requires Bachelorâs degree (in Computer Science, Engineering, Economics or Math) or equivalent, and seven to nine years of related (telecommunication analysis) experience. As a leading provider of innovative technology services and solutions for the nationâs defense, security, space, and intelligence communities; we hold nearly 1,000 active contracts with more than 40 different government agencies. jobText: ShareThis City : Watertown, MA Date : 07/27 Start date would be August 3rd, and would be every other week or so for the next few months (Aug - Dec) for taking care of my 20 month old daughter.  My husband has to travel to Florida frequently. Some months my husband might have to go 2 weeks in a row, and other times every other week , other times Tues- Thurs, or Mon - Wed, and sometimes the whole week. It will be a little inconsistent with the hours needing coverage, so flexibility is key.  The am hours are in the mornings 5:30-7:30am - needing to be here just in case. My daughter sleeps in, and I will get her up when I get home from teaching my fitness class. You can nap, read, workout in my basement, just no TV, phones or anything noisy. No need to do much unless there is an issue!  On the weeks my husband is away I will also need coverage on Tues and Thurs nights again while I am teaching, from 6-8pm. I would want you to play with my daughter, give her a bedtime snack, bathe her, and get her ready for bed. I will put her bed when I get home.  Experience with toddlers a must, have a reliable car, must be ON time and EXTREMELY dependable, and be able to give 3 references! I will do a background check as well. Infant CPR certified a plus.  Will pay $10 an hour and pay in CASH weekly! In Watertown. No weekends - just weekdays are needed.  Serious inquiries ONLY.  Thanks!  Contact

Job Opportunities - Manufacturing |  |  |  Title: Material Handler Requisition #: rich-00000633 City, State: Morristown, TN Employment Type: Full Time Work Shift: What would I be responsible for? Rich Products Corporation is known around the world as the founder of the non-dairy segment of the frozen food industry and the leading supporter and solutions provider to the Food Service, In-Store Bakery and Retail marketplaces. We are one of the world's premier family-owned food companies with more than 7,300 associates worldwide.  We currently have a great opportunity as Material Handler to work in our Logistics department at our Morristown, TN manufacturing facility. Please visit our website at www.richs.com/careers to apply for this position or view other exciting opportunities. The Material Handler is responsible for the flow of raw materials and finished goods throughout the facility. Must be able to operate powered forklift equipment on all shifts. Ensures all equipment is in operating condition and ready for on time start up. Must have the knowledge and experience to make necessary adjustments to keep products flowing consistently. Performs process control and quality checks. Operates date coders and verifies code dates on cases. Observes all OSHA and facility safety rules and regulations including use of personal protective equipment. Maintains work area in a safe and orderly fashion according to General Manufacturing Practices and Safety Guidelines. Responsible for accurate, timely, and legible completion of daily production reports/ documents Trains new associates Performs any other miscellaneous duties as assigned What do I need to be considered a candidate? Must have a High School Diploma or GED  2 Years experience in a manufacturing shipping environment Must have good communication skills, both written and verbal Ability to perform mathematical calculations (add, subtract, multiply, divide, compute rates and percents) Knowledge, skills, and ability to operate computer programs as needed Must be able to deal with change, pressure and exercise good judgment skills Must have desire and ability to operate as a member of a Self-Directed work team Must have ability to work in and contribute to Production Improvement, Associate Involvement, and Temporary Teams as assigned. PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS: Moderate degree of physical activity Daily activities include walking, standing, climbing, reaching, twisting, stooping, grasping, bending, pushing, pulling and moving about the facility. Works in high noise area, hearing protection may be required. Hearing ability to meet Manufacturing facility safety requirements Vision abilities include close, distance, peripheral and depth perception Required lifting not to exceed 55 lbs Exposed to cold/ heat/ humidity Able to work a multi shift environment May handle potentially hazardous equipment or material Will be required to work around bakery ingredients as part of daily activities We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and invite qualified candidates to apply. As part of our efforts to provide a safe and productive environment and hire talented and qualified associates, we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing and background investigations.

|  |  |  >  >  >  JOB POSTING MIDDLE SCHOOL PRINCIPAL-CURTIS CORNER MIDDLE SCHOOL Curtis Corner Middle School ( )  South Kingstown Public Schools  Wakefield, Rhode Island ( )  Print job Job Details Job ID: 61172 Application Deadline: October 28, 2011  Posted: October 14, 2011  Job Description Position: Middle School Principal Position Description: As instructional leader of the school, a middle school principal is responsible for establishing an instructional vision and a focused plan for improving student achievement; monitoring and supervising instruction; supporting teachers in improving instructional practice; creating a community of continuous learning for all staff and students; and fostering a culture of high expectations, rigor and respect. In addition, the middle school principal is charged with building strong partnerships with families and community, creating a safe, supportive climate, and effectively managing operational and technical priorities to ensure instructional progress and school management. Reports to: Superintendent of Schools Essential Duties:  1. Lead development, evaluation and improvement of instructional programs which provide access and support to rigorous instruction for all students. 2. Promote a positive, caring climate for learning; deal sensitively and fairly with persons from diverse cultural backgrounds, and communicate effectively with all students, staff and parents. 3. Lead the development of school improvement plans in alignment with the district strategic plan. 4. Use data to track progress on school performance objectives and academic excellence indicators. 5. Support teachers and parents in their understanding and use of data to inform decisions. 6. Regularly observe classroom instruction and work to improve employee performance as principle evaluator for educator evaluation systems in the building. 7. Interview and orient new staff. 8. Articulate the school and district mission to the educational community.  9. Utilize effective techniques to encourage community and parent involvement. 10. Supervise all school operations. 11. Performs other duties as assigned by the Superintendent. Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: 1. Demonstrated ability to manage systemic change and successfully implement reform initiatives that produce gains in closing the achievement gap. Demonstrated success and experience in instructional program design and development. 2. Demonstrated knowledge of high leverage, research-based instructional strategies and models for improving instructional practice. 3. Demonstrated proficiency in the use of data to assess student progress and inform instructional practice. 4. Effective interpersonal skills in managing and interacting with diverse groups of stakeholders. 5. Excellent time management and organizational skills. 6. Demonstrated ability to manage conflict through quality decision making and effective problem solving. Position Type: Full-time  Positions Available: 1  Equal Opportunity Employer South Kingstown Public Schools is committed to maintaining a work and learning environment free from discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, pregnancy, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital/civil union status, ancestry, place of birth, age, citizenship status, veteran status, political affiliation, genetic information or disability, as defined and required by state and federal laws. Additionally, we prohibit retaliation against individuals who oppose such discrimination and harassment or who participate in an equal opportunity investigation.  Job Requirements Qualifications: Minimum of three years successful teaching experience Masters Degree  RI Certification as Middle/Secondary School Principal Assistant Principal experience preferred At least 3 years of relevant experience preferred  Masters degree preferred  Citizenship, residency or work VISA in United States required Application Instructions South Kingstown School Department actively seeks applications from the most capable, professional candidates. In order to be considered, you must submit a COMPLETE SchoolSpring application. Incomplete SchoolSpring applications will NOT be considered. If selected for hire, you will be required to provide the following items in person: 1. W-4 2. Federal BCI (Done through your local police department or State Attorney General's Office) 3. I-9 (Must be filled out in person) Please bring appropriate documentation. Application Questions This employer has requested that all applicants answer the following questions. It is  highly recommended that you type any essays in a word processing program, save them, and then paste them on the proceeding job application page. 1. This application is for RI certified teachers only. Please indicate your area(s) of RI certification, your certification number(s), and expiration date(s).  Brief Response (Answer limited to 200 characters, including spaces) 2. Are you a Highly Qualified teacher?  Yes/No 3. If you are not a Highly Qualified teacher, do you have a plan to achieve HQ status?  Brief Response (Answer limited to 200 characters, including spaces) 4. Please indicate the grade level(s) you wish to teach.  Multiple Choice / Multiple Answers - PK-5  - 6-8  - 9-12  5. Are you currently a RI retiree receiving a pension from the State of RI?  Yes/No Contact Information Human Resources 307 Curtis Corner Rd Wakefield, Rhode Island 02879 Phone: 401-360-1311 Email: Print job Copyright 2001-2011 SchoolSpring, inc. - The Employment Source for Educators  by using this website you agree to be bound by the  |  |  |

Jump to: ,  ,  Careers Careers Restaurant Assistant Manager - store #2919 Youâve got the makings of a superstar. As an Assistant Restaurant Manager, youâll be an important member of the management team. Youâll tackle a whole host of restaurant responsibilities with the help of your team. And with enough time, training and experience, youâll have the tools to take that next step towards making it big.  Responsibilities: Ensures the delivery on the Customer Promise through managing the daily operations of a restaurant  Manages financial controls, operations, people development, customer service and compliance across shifts for desired restaurant outcomes (i.e., increased sales, profitability and employee retention)  Full accountability for restaurant operations in the absence of the Restaurant General Manager or Senior Assistant Manager  Directs efficient and accurate preparation and sale of products for prompt customer delivery within the established speed of service guidelines  Motivates and directs team members and Hourly Shift Coordinators to exceed customer expectations with food and friendly service in clean surroundings  Supervises and trains team members and Shift Coordinators on team stations, products, processes and policies  Manages cash control/security procedures and implements marketing plans, maintain inventory, manage labor, and apply financial reports across shifts to enhance restaurant results  Enforces compliance with government regulations, Market Policy, employment laws, food safety, National Security Policy, operations and policies and procedures relating to all restaurant activities across shifts  Recruits, selects, hires and retains effective team talent. Counsels and disciplines team members as necessary  Minimum Qualifications: High School Diploma or GED required, some college preferred  1-2 years of experience working in the quick service restaurant industry  Reliable transportation  If you feel you meet the above requirements, and would like to be a part of a great team and work with people who care, please submit your resume today. Note that the responsibilities and qualifications listed above are for positions at restaurants owned or operated by Burger King Corporation. Job descriptions, compensation, benefits and other employment terms and conditions applicable to positions at independent franchised BURGER KING® Restaurants will vary and are determined solely by the Franchisee.
