Loading Map...  )  Employee Type:  Full-Time Industry:  Computer Software Consulting Healthcare - Health Services Manages Others:  No Job Type:  Health Care Information Technology Education:  None Experience:  Not Specified Post Date:  7/27/2011 Contact Information  Ref ID:  52388 Description  Healing the healthcare system starts with you. It starts with the chain of events you initiate when you work with McKesson Provider Technologies - a chain that extends across the country and results in millions of people getting more from their healthcare.  McKesson Provider Technologies delivers comprehensive solutions with the power to change the way healthcare is provided. Our capabilities extend beyond healthcare IT software to include automation and robotics, business process re-engineering, analytics and other services that connect healthcare providers, physicians, payors and patients across all care settings. Over 50 percent of U.S. hospitals use our solutions on a daily basis. We're also a leader in solutions that manage complex financial information and optimize resources and supply chain management. Ultimately, we're helping the system run smoother so that healthcare works for all of us.  Current Need The Enterprise Intelligence Implementation team requires a Technical Implementation Engineer to implement our data warehousing and analytics software packages. Technical Implementation Engineers assist customers with installing, configuring and upgrading McKesson applications, as well as problem solving and issue resolution. A wide variety of technologies come into play in this position, including: Oracle 10g, Unix and Linux Operating Systems, Microsoft SQL Server and Microsoft Windows Server and workstation platforms.  Position Description Responsible for providing technical support to the McKesson project team and the customer product support team during the implementation of Horizon Performance Manager (HPM), Horizon Business Insight (HBI) and other Enterprise Intelligence software components. Install application components on customer's servers as part of new implementations, upgrades and migrations. Consult with customer's IT staff on recommended system maintenance tasks while preparing system for productive use. Provide technical guidance and education to customer to ensure self sufficiency. Serve as single point of contact for technical issues & questions from sales through the transition to McKesson's Support organization.  Occasional evening and weekend work will be required; advance notice will be provided whenever possible. Up to 25% travel required. This position may work remotely Additional Knowledge & Skills Experience with a variety of relational databases (primarily Oracle 10g and MSSQL) and Operating Systems (Linux and Windows Server) systems is required. Direct experience implementing or supporting HPM or HBI is preferred, as is experience with overall system administration. Exposure to SAN technologies, backup strategies and networking protocols is a plus.  Requires excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Must be able to interpret and communicate complex technical information to others. Will be assigned to multiple client projects concurrently, so excellent organizational and time management skills are a must. Analytical skills required for in-depth triage and problem resolution. Head Start Head Start Stylist job in Tuscaloosa, AL  Company  Head Start Job Title  Head Start Stylist Job Type  Full-time, Part-time Hours  Not Specified  Location  Tuscaloosa, AL  Tuscaloosa, AL 35401  See all  Head Start Stylist  Stylist  Overview:  The Hair Stylist is responsible for delivering exceptional customer service while providing the full range of hair care services. Specifically, the hair stylist is expected to:  â¢Market themselves and grow their business  â¢Complete required administrative tasks  â¢Provide exceptional customer service  â¢Control expenses  â¢Consistently exhibit and develop technical competence  As a hair stylist, you will be held accountable for these key areas. Successful performance will be measured by meeting or exceeding established minimum productivity requirements.  Qualifications:  â¢Valid current cosmetology license, to include a manager license as required by local (or state/provincial) cosmetology regulation. Position may require the stylist to work alone in the salon.  â¢Ability to work in a dynamic salon environment.  â¢Good time management skills, good judgment, and the ability to multi-task.  â¢Well-developed interpersonal skills to communicate effectively with Salon Manager, salon staff, Area Supervisor, and clients.  â¢Ability to read, digest and analyze various reports.  â¢Mathematical skills to accurately compute and complete required functions.  â¢Ability to work a flexible schedule including nights and weekends.  Essential Functions:  1. Market themselves and grow their business  a) Utilize existing business building tools and programs to increase sales, increase customer counts and retain customers;  b) Meet or exceed minimum productivity requirements as established by the company;  c) Promote and sell services and products, including recommending and selling additional services and/or retail products which will enhance and improve the customerâs image and/or contribute to the customerâs satisfaction with services performed;  d) Execute promotional campaigns as directed by the Company;  e) Maintain professional appearance and a positive attitude.  2. Provide exceptional customer service  a) Understand the needs of customers; handle and resolve customer service issues to maintain customer loyalty;  b) Consistently execute customer service programs;  c) Conduct quality consultations by suggesting hairstyles according to physical features of the customer, current styles, or from the customerâs instructions;  d) Communicate to the customer a clear understanding of the pricing before services are performed;  e) Display a sound understanding and perform all available services in a competent, efficient and professional manner.  3. Control expenses  a) Follow weekly salon schedules as directed by Salon Manager;  b) Correctly charge for services rendered and products purchased, including proper discounting according to Company policy;  c) Effective control of salon operating costs relating to back-bar and retail inventories;  d) Safeguard company assets by adhering to company policies and procedures.  4. Consistently exhibit and develop technical competence  a) Conduct comprehensive consultation with each customer;  b) Perform all services that are requested from our customer and offered by the salon in a competent, efficient and professional manner and in compliance with all applicable state and local sanitation rules;  c) Learn and continue to develop technical skills via company provided education.  5. Complete required administrative tasks/compliance  a) Adhere to all corporate policies, procedures and work rules;  b) Ensure closing procedures are adhered to and daily bank deposits are made;  c) Maintain workstation and other salon areas in a sanitary, clean, orderly manner to board certified standards for cleanliness;  d) Perform a variety of tasks related to salon operations, including but not limited to: answering telephones, stocking shelves, taking cycle counts/inventory, and other duties as assigned;  e) Maintain and uphold safety standards by identifying and correcting conditions that affect salon safety;  f) Timely submission of all company required paperwork;  g) Communicate effectively with management, customers and co-workers in a professional and courteous manner;  h) Attend work timely and consistently, including attending mandatory staff meetings, training sessions or as otherwise required by management.  i) Computer knowledge including, but not limited to, point-of-sale systems.  Physical Requirements and Work Environment:  â¢Frequent lifting up to 10 lbs. to pick up bottles of product needed to perform hair services and stock retail shelves. Occasional lifting 10-25 lbs. to assist unloading monthly shipment of products.  â¢Continuous standing throughout the day to perform hair services and other job related functions.  â¢Continuous walking âgreeting the client at the front of the salon and walking them back to the styling chair, to and from the shampoo area, to get supplies needed for the service and walking the client back to the front of the salon.  â¢Continuous repetitive movement with fingers, hands, wrists and arms using scissors to cut hair, rolling hair in rods to perform perm services, vigorous movement to massage/shampoo clientâs hair, twisting wrists to blow dry and styling hair with various irons.  â¢Continuous grasping of clientâs hair, blow dryer, curling iron, combs, and hair coloring brushes in order to perform services.  â¢Continuous reaching, alternating between shoulder level and above shoulder level height to perform services, stock shelves, retrieve product/supplies from cupboards and shelves.  â¢Frequent twisting and bending to shampoo clientâs hair and twisting to reach for tools while client is seated in styling chair and sweep hair off the floor after service.  â¢Occasional pushing and pulling to move styling chair.  â¢Continuous exposure to various chemicals and fragrances used in performing services and styling hair, including but not limited to permanent solutions, straightening solutions, shampoos, conditioners, hair spray and client perfume.  â¢Occasional climbing of ladder/stepstool to stock shelves, retrieve products, change bi-monthly collateral, and maintain salon.  â¢Visual observation of customerâs hair, including close vision, color vision and the ability to adjust focus.  â¢Ability to communicate with customers regarding services offered and requested and the customerâs needs and wants.  â¢Basic reading, writing and mathematical skills necessary to read and complete company forms and other documents, read product instructions and prepare daily close-out documents.  â¢Occasional travel to mandatory meetings and training sessions, including overnight travel.  Additional Info  Minimum Age  16+ years old  Job Industries

Class Code: 073631  Salary: $17.66 - $28.26 Hourly $1,324.15 - $2,119.38 Biweekly $2,869.00 - $4,592.00 Monthly $34,428.00 - $55,104.00 Annually Print Job Information Summary/Distinguishing Features Benefits SUMMARY: Under general supervision, is responsible for correctional program managerial work of average difficulty; and performs related work a required.  DISTINGUISHING FEATURES: An employee in this class is responsible for assisting in the direction of a correctional program of average difficulty, such as resident or juvenile classification or foster and group homes. This class differs from that of Correctional Program Manager 2 in that an incumbent of the latter is responsible for a program of greater scope and complexity. Examples of Duties and Responsibilities:  1. Assists in directing and coordinating correctional programs such as offender classification and foster and group homes.  2. Assigns, trains, supervises and evaluates assigned staff and their work; reviews and makes recommendations on employment, promotion, demotion, transfer and other human resources actions.  3. Assists in development, implementation and monitoring of correctional program policies and procedures.  4. Assists in the study of organization, operations, and services and makes recommendations for improvements effecting economy, efficiency, and quality of organization, operations and services.  5. Supervises the preparation and maintenance of a wide variety of records and reports.  6. Performs important personal contact and liaison work with inmates, attorneys, families and other interested citizens; acts as a liaison between central office and field personnel. Minimum Qualifications:  Education and Experience: Graduation from an accredited college for university with a bachelor's degree and experience equivalent to substantial (five or more years of) full-time varied increasingly responsible professional correctional experience; qualifying full-time professional experience may be substituted for the required education, on a year-for-year basis, to a maximum of four years; additional graduate coursework in a field pertinent to correctional work may be substituted for the required experience, on a year-for-year basis, to a maximum of two years. Necessary Special Qualifications/Examination Method:  Necessary Special Qualifications: None.  EXAMINATION METHOD: Education and Experience, 100%, for Career Service positions. For Executive Service positions, Minimum Qualifications, Necessary Special Qualifications, and Examination Method are determined by the appointing authority. Our centers are state-of-the-art. Our benefit package is outstanding. And our regular shifts help you balance your career and your personal life. Genesis HealthCare operates more than 200 skilled nursing centers in 13 states, and offers rehabilitation services to nearly 1,000 health care facilities in 23 states. And right now, we have openings near you. So apply today. For a remarkable RN like you, it's a remarkable opportunity. As a  Registered Nurse / RN at Genesis HealthCare, you will:  · Use your physical assessment skills and mastery of fine nursing principles to manage a range of acute-care and rehabilitation patients · Develop and implement individualized care plans for your patients · Assist with orientation and supervision of nursing staff Job Requirements Registered Nurse / RN Requirements:  · Bachelor's degree from an accredited school of nursing preferred · Current license for the state in which you are applying · Some supervisory experience highly desirable As one of the nation's largest long-term care and rehabilitation providers, we offer a generous and wide-ranging compensation package, including: *Medical/dental/vision insurance *Company-paid life insurance and short-term disability *Voluntary insurance programs *401(k) Plan *Tuition Reimbursement Program *Continuing Education Programs *Leadership Training Program *Pre-tax Flexible Spending Accounts *Extensive paid leave for holidays *Service awards  *Generous Eldercare benefit for family members Additionally, Genesis offers professional growth opportunities and an array of other benefits you won't find anywhere else. Type: CON_W2 Pay Rate: Depending on Experience Job Length: 12 months + Position ID: 1001554640 Dice ID: technis2 Travel Required: unspecified Telecommute: no Contact Information Save this job Click Here to Apply Printer-Friendly Job Description 142995-validation Engineer-1;linux;architecture; A Santa Clara, CA Validation Engineer  Years of Experience & Expertise Level: 2 to 3 years; BS or MS in Engineering Project Description: The candidate will be performing validation testing on Intel Platforms and will support first level triage/debug of Linux OS based CPU test failures. Candidate will help with limited modifications of C-based tests and Python scripts. Familiarity with ITP, LA and other Platform debug tools is a Plus.  Daily Responsibilities:  . Running the validation test on linux based operating system. Isolating the software failures and fixing basic bugs. . Building the PC platform to required config, loading BIOS and boot the system with linux based OS. . Creating Ghost images of various installations  . Running a variety of manual testing and scheduling the automated test lines. . Writing and modifying the automation scripts. . Providing feedback and regular & timely updates on resolved defects and latest test status  . Support additional ad-hoc testing as needed based on engineering code drop  Necessary Skills (Must Have): . Thorough knowledge of computer architecture. . Programming and scripting language (C, Perl, Python) knowledge. . Knowledge of linux file system is a plus. . Ability to clearly document system configurations, settings for each test and capture the results in MS Excel  . Logical system debug and troubleshooting skills  . Experience in creating and/or modifying tests and test documentation  . Strong written and verbal communication skills required Additional Skills Desired (Nice to Have): Previous software or hardware validation experience would be an added advantage  Company Overview Technisource is an employer of choice to 300,000 individuals. We've been finding rewarding career opportunities that prove a great match for individuals' skills and experience for more than 60 years. Let Technisource connect you to a career opportunity that will ensure your continued success! The Membership Sales Director will be responsible for developing membership and other program revenue which will enable the branch to forward their strategic mission plan. Return to Previous Page Printable Format Job Description - Customer Proj/Prgm Mgr IV, Veteran's Healthcare, (US Citizenship Required) (610138) Job Description Customer Proj/Prgm Mgr IV, Veteran's Healthcare, (US Citizenship Required) - 610138 Description The scope of this position is to use data from the PD Project Repository (TSPR), Primavera Project Management and Timesheets tools, Microsoft Project Server, and other available data sources to analyze current PD workloads and project future resource needs.  The following are some of the key skills and qualifications the individual working in this role will need:  · Project planning, to include project schedule development; cost and schedule variance analysis; critical path analysis; and resource utilization  · Expertise in the use of Primavera Project Management and Microsoft Project Server  · Experience with the VA Primavera Schedule Minimum Requirements Checklist; Project Self Health Check Template; Automated Health Check tool; and PM Toolkit report  · Visual Basic to develop Microsoft Project and Excel macros to facilitate workload and schedule analysis and reporting  · Knowledge in the following areas:  Industry standards for project planning and scheduling  VA Universal Project Milestones (UPMs)  Performance management and measurement principles, including Earned Value Management  Use of OMB performance reporting to reconcile actual project costs with schedule planned value  Schedule baseline change control  Detailed analyses of existing project schedules and estimates  VA Schedule Minimum Requirements  VA policies, guidance documents, and standard procedures/processes to govern VA and contractor resources  VA PMAS Dashboard reporting, including calculation of current/previous increment variances  Qualifications Education and Experience Required: US Citizenship with ability to pass extensive background investigation  BA/BS Degree with 7 years experience in project management or in like roles/businesses  · Excellent communication skills, both oral and written; prepare and present briefings and training sessions to VA customers, PD project managers, and planners  ·  PMP certification is desired Responsibilities include (and are not limited to):  · Performing workload analysis to identify labor hours by role/resource on completed projects  · Conducting trend analysis to determine past resource usage and forecast future VA requirements for project execution  · Conducting project schedule health check reviews to confirm PD project schedules comply with VA Schedule Minimum Requirements  · Performing project performance analysis to reconcile actual project costs with schedule planned value  · Meeting with and presenting information to VA customers, PD project managers, and planners  · Reviewing and interpreting VA policies, developing guidance documents, and providing information to VA and contractor resources  Job - Services Other Locations - New York - Albany  Schedule - Full-time Job Type - Experienced Shift - Day Job Travel - No Send this job to a friend Send this job description to a friend by email. All the relevant details will be included in the message. Send this job to a friend Powered by

Employee Type:  Full-Time Industry:  Automotive - Motor Vehicles - Parts Sales - Marketing Retail Manages Others:  Not Specified Job Type:  Automotive Sales Inventory Experience:  At least 2 year(s) Post Date:  6/3/2011 Contact Information  Phone:  318-226-9675 Fax:  318-221-2401  instantly fax your resume > >  Description  Automotive Part Sales A local equipment supply/automotive company is seeking a full-time, experience Automotive Part Salesperson! Auto parts sales personnel work behind the counter, and must be knowledgeable when customers request products. Auto parts salespeople need to accurately identify specific automotive parts in catalogs that meet each customer's needs. The auto parts salesperson must order or suggest substitute parts to customers if the item is not in stock. Ordering sometimes requires the implementation and accurate use of measurement instruments such as calipers and micrometers. Auto parts sales workers are responsible for keeping track of inventory, both in the back room and out on display. The salespeople use computer inventory systems to reorder new parts or items as needed. Auto sales personnel must unpack boxes of shipments and stock shelves. Forklift use is required for this position. They are also required to run cash registers and finalize customer transactions.
